loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash O. is 45 years old. He is from Migori town. He is married and has four children who are all boys between the ages of 18 years and 9 years old.

Joash has a business of sugarcane that he has been doing for the past eight years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET  LTD  to enable him to buy more sugarcane for crushing. Sugarcane does well in his location and his business has really improved since the first loan. The profits made from this business will be used to cater for the family's needs.

His desire is to be able to buy an electric cane crusher and be able to stop using the manual one.

loans.use: To buy more sugarcane to add to his stock

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok M., 68, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. M. rents her generator for the village's use, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Her husband operates a karaoke business, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. M. has to spend USD 60 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita H. is from the city of Mantic Tangub. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a pedicab transport business. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle

loans.name: Reoun

texts.en: Reoun S., 31, is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house. S. is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and a child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment factory industry. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida G. V. tiene 54 años, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos. Ella vive con sus hijos en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.  

Lida es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.  

Lida sembra cacao y maíz y tiene este negocio desde hace 8 años. Ella compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. Ella solicita el crédito para terminar de ampliar los huertos de cacao y sembrar maíz. Gracias al crédito ella podrá mejorar su producción. 

En el futuro ella desea tener una finca más grande, un carro y un local de compra y venta de productos. El mayor desafío que ella enfrenta en su negocio es la época de invierno cuando se baja la producción.

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasillos y descansar con su familia.
texts.en: Lida G. V. is 54, a widow, and has 6 children. She lives with her children in the Chillanes canton in Bolivar province. Lida is a member of the Unidos Somos Mas ["United, We Are More"] rural lending bank. This new bank is part of the Matilde Esther community in the Guayas province. This community is located 2 hours from the Chillanes office in the Bolivar province. The group has 23 members who have different jobs, for example in agriculture, raising livestock, and running small restaurants and cafeterias. Lida sows cocoa and corn, and has had this business for 8 years. She buys and sells her products in Matilde Esther. She is requesting this loan to finish expanding her cocoa plots and to sow corn. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her production. In the future she wants to have a bigger farm, a car, and a store to sell and purchase products. Her greatest challenge is wintertime, when production decreases. In her spare time she likes going for walks and resting with her family.

loans.use: to finish expanding her cocoa plots and to sow corn

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in Multan, a big city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in the area of Kher abad in a 2-room brick house. She came here 10 years ago. Nusrat is married and has 3 daughters and a son. She is unable to provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions. Her husband is a daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed every day because sometimes he gets work and sometimes not.

That is why Nusrat started her boutique business 5 years ago to financially support her husband in fulfilling the family's basic needs. Nusrat collects orders from her neighborhood clients and completes them on time to earn income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to further improve her boutique business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material such as clothes, beads and colored thread in bulk, which will help her make more embroidered dresses to sell to her customers. Nusrat is very hopeful that an investment will help her develop her boutique business further and enable her to send her younger children to school in the near future. Nusrat is a new loan applicant with Asasah. Note: In the photo, Nusrat is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy embroidery items for her boutique business

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en: Nixon has a mixed farm in Kitale, western Kenya, producing eggs and vegetables. He has been in the farming business for five years. Nixon has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. He says that in the next five years, he would like to own at least 1,000 chickens and be the main egg supplier to the local market. Nixon is 28 years old and married with 2 children, 2 and 8 years old, who both attend school.

loans.use: for poultry farming

loans.name: Riqchary Wayna Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “RIQCHARY WAYNA”; el banco  comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,  provincia Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia; La socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia es natural de Urubamba y se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral (gallinas, pollos, gallos); también se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de verduras ella compra y vende productos también ella ahora solicita el préstamo para la compra de un tipo de maíz llamado maíz Tara, es un maíz de grano grande, y también con el maíz amarillo ella lo procesa y elabora la famosa chicha de jora bebida considerada afrodisiaco desde el tiempo de los Inkas. La socia también aumentara animales comprará más cuyes, y aves.La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y maíz Tara.

Los otros socios se dedican al comercio minorista ellos venden animales menores, otros carpintería, docentes, otra socia vende gelatinas.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the “RIQCHARY WAYNA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Emilia is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She is from Urubamba and for the past 15 years she has been in business raising small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and poultry (hens, chickens, roosters).  She also sows and harvests vegetables, and buys and sells products.  

Emilia is requesting a loan to buy a type of corn called 'Tara' corn.  It is a corn with large kernels which she mixes with regular yellow corn to produce the famous drink 'chicha de jora' which has been considered an aphrodisiac since Incan times.  Emilia will also use her loan to increase her number of animals, buying more guinea pigs and poultry.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying small animals and 'Tara' corn. 

Other members of this group sell products retail.  Some sell small animals, others work as carpenters or teachers and one sells gelatin desserts.  Emilia appreciates the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To invest in buying small animals and 'Tara' corn.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung K. is 36 years of age and a resident of Kompong Tom province. In order to meet the needs of her family, Kung K. sells a few grocery items from her home. She has four years of experience in this business and is earning over $9 per day. Kung K. was married and divorced her husband. 

Kung K. and her kid have been living under her old parents' roof. She really wants to have her own personal house to live in with her kid, but her cash on hand is not sufficient. In order to deal with this problem, Kung K. would like to request a loan to add with her saving accounts to buy a piece of land for building her own house.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for building her own house

loans.name: Juliet Z.

texts.en:
This is 50 year old Juliet. She is married, and has 4 children aged 31, 29, 24 and 20. She has 5 additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephews.

In 2009, Juliet established her drug store business. She began her business because she wanted to help with medications and to get more income. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 829,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.

Juliet requires a loan in order to buy additional drugs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 165,800. In the future, Juliet plans to get a clinic of her own and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medical drugs.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol K. is able to make a living by selling a few fresh fish on her wooden kiosk in front of her house in the Ornlong Veng district in Siem Reap. She always goes to the place which is full of fisherman in order to buy fish in bulk for a reasonable price, and then she sells them retail for net income. On average, Kol K. generates from her fish-selling business around $3.80 a day to help cover the family's living expenses. She has a life partner in her husband who is a motorcycle repairman, earning around $4 in profit per day in order to share responsibility with Kol K.. 

 Kol K. will use the loan to buy many sacks of cashews to stock up for resale. This loan will really help her and her family with extra income.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of cashews to stock up for resale.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Milagro

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente con 1 hijo a cargo. Vive en casa de padres. La cual está ubicada en el Caserio Chacupe Bajo, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, en la provincia de Chiclayo.. Pero aun no tiene servicios (agua y luz). Sus actividades principales en dicho caserío son lla agricultura ,  crianza de animales de engorde y actividades artesanales.

Yaneth se dedica a la confección de sombreros de palma, los cuales son vendidos a turistas y comerciantes mayoristas de artesanía en Monsefú, Tiene más de 15 años en dicha actividad, también realiza actividades agrícolas como obrera.  Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para los gastos de su familia.

Yaneth quiere comprar útiles escolares, palma  y otros materiales para confección  de sombreros.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 300 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.  El dinero lo quiere utilizar sobre todo para ayudar a su hijo  con los implementos necesarios para  su educación.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child in her care.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in the village of Chacupe Bajo: a small rural village in La Victoria district, in Chiclayo province.  The village still does not have access to basic services (water and electricity).  The main business activities carried out in the village are farming, livestock raising and making handicrafts.

Yaneth makes palm leaf hats which are sold to tourists and craft wholesalers in Monsefú.  She has been in this line of work for more than 15 years.  She also works as a laborer, doing farm work.  She uses the income that she makes to cover her family's expenses.

Yaneth would like to buy school supplies as well as palm leaf and other materials for making hats.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She would like to use the money, above all, to help provide her son with the tools he needs for his education.

loans.use: to buy materials and to cover her son's school expenses

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro M. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 54 years old. Pedro is married and has ten school-age children. Pedro owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Pedro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Pedro is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Pedro from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Siyathuthuka Group

texts.en:
Khanyile is a 54-year-old, married woman with 4 children, who are between the ages of 25 and 36 years old. Khanyile runs a tuckshop in Empangeni, Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. (Tuckshops are small corner stores where you can buy food, drink and other basics.) She has been in this business for 2 years and sells breads and cold drinks at her home. She also receives income from the government's old-age support grant. 

Khanyile requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses. She will use the loan to buy breads and cold drinks. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her build a house for her family.

In the future, Khanyile hopes to see her business grow in such a way that she employes someone to work for her.

In the photo, Khanyile is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy breads and cold drinks

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of commodities such as biscuits, soft drinks and canned goods. Rosalinda has had this business for 10 years. According to Rosalinda, her husband is helping her manage the business. Rosalinda still wants to expand her business further.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy groceries such as canned goods, sugar, condiments, oils, biscuits and soft drinks. Each month, Rosalinda earns about PHP 5,000 from her business.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her store so that she can increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, sugar, condiments, oils, biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Doña María estableció su pequeño negocio, con más de quince años en las ventas, el cual ha venido cambiando de productos y obtener otras mejoras para el bien comun de la familia, hoy en día tiene una pulpería y la venta de tortilla.
Teniendo el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo e hijos quienes le ayudan en la venta, también atreves del financiamiento en Afodenic ha logrado el aumento de inventario, lo que ha tenido mejores ventas al ofertar variedad de productos.
Lo que quiere invertir es en compra de tres quintales de maíz, carbón, bolsones de papel, y la compra de una vitrina de vidrio para exhibir mas sus productos, ya que ha venido comprando, teniendo en mejores higiene sus ventas. Siendo para ella de gran provecho esta alternativa del préstamo.
texts.en:
María set up her small business, with more than 15 years experience of working in sales.  Over time, she has changed the products that she sells and made other improvements for the common good of her family.  She currently owns a grocery store and a tortilla business.

María has the moral and financial support of her husband and children who help her in making her sales.  Through loans from Afodenic, she has managed to increase her inventory which has resulted in better sales as she now offers a variety of products.

María would like to invest in buying three 100lb bags of corn, coal, paper bags and a glass display case to display more of her products.  She has been buying products and keeping her sales merchandise in better, more hygienic conditions.  This loan will be very helpful to María.

loans.use: to buy corn and coal to increase her tortilla sales.  She will also buy a display case for displaying more products

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, vive con su esposa y 6 hijos de 19, 17, 14, 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, él trabaja en la agricultura por herencia de su padre, trabaja con sus hijos mayores quienes le ayudan a sembrar, trabajan de las 4:00am a 11:00am, su dificultad es el terreno que es en pendiente y es peligroso alguna caída.
Actualmente está iniciando las labores de siembra de maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes,  con estos materiales y con los fertilizantes aplicados tendrá un mejor desarrollo y producción el cultivo, sus dificultades en esta etapa es el ambiente, que el exceso de agua o la falta de esta, puede dañar la producción.
Con esta siembra si todo da resultados positivos, tendrá alimentación para vario tiempo para su familia, quienes son su prioridad.
texts.en:
Martin lives with his wife and their 6 children, aged 19, 17, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years old.  He works in agriculture as an inheritance from his father.  He works with his older children who help him with the planting.  They work from 4:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.  His difficulty is the terrain which is steep and falls off dangerously.

He is currently starting the work of sowing corn; for this he is looking for a loan to invest in manure and fertilizers.  With these materials and the application of the fertilizers, he will have better crop development and production.  His difficulty at this stage is the environment, as excess water or the lack of it can damage production.

With this planting, if everything goes well, he will have food for some time for his family, who are his priority.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty-three years.  He is 68 years old, married to Lucy, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. He's planning to use the milk for consumption and to sell the excess.

In future, Peter hopes to practice mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura, 33, is the leader of this group. She is married and has three children, the youngest of whom is only a year old. While she takes care of her children, her husband drives a cab and brings in a monthly income of 10,000 soms. Both of them understand the importance of financial investment. However according to Ainura, access to finance is not the only thing to grow a business. They pay the same attention to customer satisfaction too. After some time, Ainura plans to get back to her previous business, a shop that they opened three years ago. The monthly income of the family reaches 10,000 soms. The loan is requested in order to buy automobile parts for her husband’s cab. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts for her husband's cab

loans.name: Eliazar Lenin

texts.es:
El señor Eliazar Lenin  vive en la ciudad de Managua.
El señor Eliazar  visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que piensa hacerles  mejoras a su vivienda.
La inversión que el  señor  va hacer es la compra de y cemento, piedra, arena, hierro, las mejoras que el señor va hacer es el anexo  a un cuarto.
 agradece mucho a ceprodel por que gracias al financiamiento ha podido mejorar su vivienda y así también sus condiciones de vida para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Señor Eliazar Lenin lives in the city of Managua.

Señor Eliazar visited our office to request a loan as he intends to make improvements to his home.

The investment that the Señor will make is in buying cement, stone, sand, and iron.  The home improvement that the Señor will make is an extension to a room.

He is very grateful to Ceprodel, as thanks to the funding he has been able to improve his home and in this way improve living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to make home improvements and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly, 32 years old, is a goldsmith. His wife does farming at home.  Their income is $7.50 per day. He has one child who is 8 years old and studying at school. Every month, he has to spend $41 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy clothes and VCDs for his wife to sell in front of the house. This loan can help his wife to have a career for earning money to support the family. In the future, he hopes to have enough money to get a small shop for making gold to sell by himself, because now he is working in another’s shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes and VCDs for his wife to sell from home

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum is a married woman who has five children. Four of her kids are school age and another child has already married. Presently, she is a farmer. From this business, she earns a low income per day. To assist in her revenue, her husband works as a construction worker. He always spends some money on a motor taxi. Seeing the difficulty of her husband, Tum wishes to request a loan through HKL's partner Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase a motorbike to facilitate her husband’s work. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ma. Merlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Merlinda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Ma. Merlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages like soft drinks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Ma. Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tubemaso Group

texts.fr:
Ferdinand est un commerçant âgé de 46ans qui habite  la localité de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il vend des produits vivriers comme le café, le haricot, les pommes de terre et les bananes depuis 28ans. Il  est aussi cultivateur. Il n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. Il est marié et père de  enfants dont 5qui étudient.  
Le crédit Kiva  de 130,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de produits vivriers comme le café, le haricot, les pommes de terre et les bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUBEMASO».
texts.en:
Ferdinand is a 46-year-old storekeeper who lives in the town of Bukirasazi, within the province of Gitega in the center of the country. He has sold food staples like coffee, beans, potatoes and bananas for 28 years. He is also a farmer. He did not go to school. He is married and a father; five of his children go to school.

The Kiva loan of 130,000 B. francs that Ferdinand is seeking will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy a large quantity of food staples, such as coffee, beans, potatoes and bananas so that he can resell them in order turn a large profit.

Ferdinand is a member of the Tubemaso community group.

loans.use: to increase their capital and buy a large quantity of food staples - such as coffee, beans, potatoes and bananas - to resell in order to make a large profit.

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alfonso es soltero, tiene 45 años de edad, estudios sus estudios primarios, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de toda clase, inició este trabajo siendo operario para otra negocio y lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo para compra mercadería consistente en suéteres, chumpas, lencería, sudaderos, camisas, playeras y entre otros. En el futuro espera ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Carlos Alfonso is single and 45 years old. He studied through primary school and sells all types of clothing. He began this work while having another business and has 10 years of experience.

He is asking for a loan in order to have capital to buy merchandise of sweaters, sport jackets, lingerie, sweatshirts, shirts, t-shirts and other items. In the future he hopes to see his store expand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Ma. Guadalupe es divorciada tiene 2 hijos que  depende económicamente de ella, tiene 15 años trabajando como operadora en una maquiladora de la localidad laborando 10 horas diarias de lunes a viernes para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas de alimentación, vestido y calzado y educación de sus hijos.  La señora María Guadalupe vive en una casa de interés social que adquirió en Noviembre del 2007 desde entonces ella la habita y hasta el día de hoy aun se la siguen descontando vía nomina en su empleo ella requiere se le apoye para comprar protecciones e instalación de las misma en la casa que ella tiene. Para esto necesita pagar al herrero que le hará el trabajo de esta manera ella obtendrá mayor seguridad en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is divorced and she has 2 children who are financially dependent on her. She has been working at a manufacturing plant in the community for 15 years, working 10 hours per day from Monday to Friday. She works to satisfy the basic needs her children, including nutrition, clothing, shoes, and education.

Maria Guadalupe lives in a house provided by social housing that she acquired in November of 2007. She has been living here since then and to date she continues to be charged through payroll deduction from her employment. She needs help in purchasing protective structures and their installation on the house that she has. She needs to hire a welder to do the work. She will obtain a greater degree of security for her house.

loans.use: to purchase protective structures and construction materials

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 16 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Generosa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es: Julissa, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de superación. Viven con su pareja y sus dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad en su casa propia, inmueble que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo de Julissa consiste en el medio de transporte de carga, para esto cuenta con una furgoneta que compró con su pareja, dedicándose ambos a dicha actividad. Su pareja se encarga de manejar el vehiculo, y ella se encarga de la búsqueda de cargas para que sean trasportados a los puertos fluviales de la localidad, a ésta actividad se dedican hace ya un año, tiempo en el cual les ha valido para que sean conocidos en el negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le trae un ingreso económico, que le permite pagar los gastos de su casa y darles lo mejor a sus hijos, contrario a esto, son los días lluvioso pues dificultan su trabajo. Este será el segundo préstamo que viene realizando con MFP, está agradecida de trabajar con un grupo responsable. Con el préstamo solicitado, lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de sus vehículo de transporte de carga, comprando repuestos y accesorios.
texts.en:
30-year-old Julissa is an entrepreneurial woman who has a desire to do well.  She lives with her partner and her two children, who are 12 and 7, in her own home which she managed to build with the support of her partner.  Julissa's business is providing a cargo transportation service.  She has a small truck for this purpose which her partner bought as they both work in the business.  Julissa's partner drives the vehicle and she takes care of finding cargo which needs to be transported to local river ports.  The couple have been in this business for one year and have become known in their business.  What Julissa likes about her work is that it makes her an income which allows her to cover her household expenses and provide her children with the best.  What she doesn't like are rainy days as they make her work difficult.

This will be Julissa's second loan from MFP and she is grateful to be working with a responsible group.  Julissa will use the loan that she has requested to invest in repairing and servicing her vehicle, buying spare parts and accessories.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle

loans.name: 070701-Thôn 9-Hoằng Thịnh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Dung is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 070701-Thôn 9-Hoằng T.nh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

Dung works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Dung has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2008, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

In the future, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 25 años es una mujer muy alegre, convive junto a Candel, de 29 años viven en su casa propia junto a su único hijo Luís, de 05 años quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Carmen ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Ella cultiva café, producto que posteriormente lleva a vender en su misma localidad, donde las vende al por mayor a sus compradores, quienes esperan sus cultivos debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su chacra hasta su localidad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar fertilizantes y abono para hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo y seguir obteniendo buenos productos de café. Este será su préstamo numero 02 con MFP y esta muy alegre por el apoyo financiero que le brindan ya que así puede cumplir con su trabajo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará  fertilizantes y abono para hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo y  seguir obteniendo buenos productos de café.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 25 year old happy lady who lives with 29 year old Candel.  They live in a home of their own, together with their only son, five year old Luis, to whom they want to provide a better future.  With lots of effort, Carmen has been able to work her land and make it productive.  She raises coffee, a product that she later sells for greater prices to buyers in her area.  They wait for her products because of its good quality.  What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops, and she does it with great enthusiasm.  She’s been doing this for six years and she considers the most difficult part to be transporting the products from her farm to her location, because the sacks are heavy and they tire her out very much.  In the future she wants to buy fertilizer to maintain her crop and continue to produce good coffee products.

This will be second loan thorough MFP and she is happy about the financial support she is getting.  It will allow her to complete her work.  She will use the 1,500 PEN ($575) from this loan to buy fertilizer, maintain her crop, and continue to obtain good coffee products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Cliente de 46 ans, celibataire avec et mère d'un enfant ,en 1993,  elle se lance dans la vente des chaussures pour enfants , ayant remboursée avec succès ses differents prêts, elle se décide d'en prendre un nouveau autre pour élargir son activité, elle élargie son activité en ajoutant  des robes et des chaussures pour enfants  des baby boots, des sandales en cuir , des baskets et des robes des filles , des habits pour garçons.

Sa stratégie est de choisir des habits de bonne qualité et vendre a des prix  abordables.Son commerce lui a procure beaucoup de bienfaits, puisqu'elle se prend en charge, elle paye les frais d'écolage de son enfant .
Pour l'avenir , elle a des grandes ambitions et avoir son propre magasin.
texts.en:
Yolande is a 46-year-old client, unmarried, and mother to one child. In 1993 she began selling children's shoes. Having successfully reimbursed her different loans, she decided to request another one to expand her business. She is expanding her business by adding dresses and children's shoes, baby boots, leather sandals, sneakers, girls' dresses and boys' outfits.

Her strategy is to choose good quality clothing and to sell it at affordable prices. Her business has brought her many benefits, because she takes care of herself and she pays her child's school fees.

For the future, she has the big goal of having her own store.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes  and dresses and clothes for kids

loans.name: Mariah

texts.en:
Mariah is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Mariah has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mariah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child.  Jackline sells clothes in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of 4 years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

She is requesting her third loan from KADET Ltd. of 40,000 KES.  She plans to use the funds to purchase more clothing for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will pay back the loan and support her family.

Her dream is to open a large clothing boutique and have a successful, happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela es una emprendedoras que ha luchado por seguir sus sueño de tener su propio negocio con el apoyo de  su hijo iniciaron este negocio, también porque necesitaban generar ingresos a la familia. Ella ya es clienta de la Fundación León 2000, en el cual es una persona perseverante y ganas de superación, con el prestamos anterior invirtió en el negocio de las ventas de botellas. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar gallina, cuajadas y envases de vidrio entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Santos Gabriela is an entrepreneurial woman who has fought for her dream of having her own business. With the support of her son, they set up this business, as they needed to generate income for the family. She is already a client of Fundación León 2000, in which she is persistent and always tries to exceed herself. 

With her previous loan she invested in her bottle selling business. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens, cuajada (curds) and glass containers, amongst other products.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cuajada and glass containers, amongst other products.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene es un hombre de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años y una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es el cultivo de lechuga.
Él es emprendedor, independiente y muy constante. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ caracterizada por el comercio informal y por la feria los días jueves y domingo, donde –se dice- se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta un tractor.
Rene es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo con piso de cemento y techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el cultivo de lechuga, que es sencilla de cosechar y se puede realizar en cualquier momento del año, no requiere muchos cuidados  y la más buscada es la lechuga de huerto, “trabajé como coordinador de cultivo dónde aprendí el oficio…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque la lechuga de carpa es demandada. La ventaja de su negocio es que su huerto cuenta con carpa, la desventaja es la falta de material de cultivo como, tierra, abono y semillas. Su sueño es mejorar su producción y contratar operarios, él desea comprar material de trabajo para cultivo de lechuga en carpa. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rene solicita un préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para cultivo de lechuga en carpa.

loans.use: para comprar material de trabajo para cultivo de lechuga en carpa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to increase the number of broilers to 400 chicks

loans.name: Naz Bobo

texts.en: Naz Bobo, daughter of M. Karim, was born in 1962 and now lives in District 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married to M. Saleem and has 3 children. She has a tailoring and knitting business at home. At first it was hard for her family to enjoy a good living because they had financial problems and her business was also very weak, but then she heard about micro financing and she thought about taking a loan to enhance her business. She has finished 4 loan cycles  and now wants to take a 5th cycle. With this money she wants to buy more fabric in order to produce more clothes of a better quality which she can sell in the market for a better price to earn more profit. She says "when you make better clothes with better quality your demand increases at the market which provides a good opportunity to increase your business. I am happy with the loans and looking to go ahead with it in the future."

loans.use: To buy fabrics, a machine, needles, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul was born in 1939. He is a monogamist and has eight children. What stands out as a challenge in Paul’s life now, is the sickness of his son who is a university student. What has wounded his heart so much in all his life was the death of his son who had just graduated from the higher teachers training college and was about to start work. Paul has been a beneficiary from GHAPE for six years, faithfully paying back his loans.

He wants this loan now to improve his pig farm. He believes this will be a success because he already has the technical know-how to handle the business. This has been his business for all these years. He provides the waste from the pigs to his community to use as manure. He also sells pork meat to his community. The profit from this business will improve his life and he will construct a house for himself. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Paul would like to buy piglets for his pig farm.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan G. is married. He and his wife, Eve, live in Vinogradovo, in the Transcarpathian region of western Ukraine. He owns a café located in the central market of Vinogradovo which is a very favorable and busy location. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have had a positive impact on the growth of Ivan’s business. Using loan capital, he remodeled the interior of his café and purchased new equipment and dishware. Ivan has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, his gross income is about $1000 - $1600 a month and his monthly net profit is about $400. Ivan is a very punctual, hard-working business owner.  

Ivan is requesting a loan to purchase more beverages (juices, fizzy drinks, mineral water, etc.) and groceries for his café. He believes the loan will help him better serve his customers and please different tastes. We are confident the that reasonable prices, delicious food and friendly customer-service that Ivan offers will ensure the success of his business and help him fulfill one of his long-term plans – to open a second café in his little town.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for cafe

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. is running a small business in the market of Magburaka, in Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same town.  The couple work together to make ends meet.  Previously Kadiatu was engaged in selling onions and some vegetables.  With her previous loan, she diversified her business by including tomato paste, cooking oil, rice and curry powder.  At forty two years of age, with three children, her dream is to provide them with the best education.  She said  she would like a loan of $175 to allow her to  purchase the business items on wholesale to make more profit.

loans.use: Diversification of her business to increase her family's profits.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet has a simple, but well-run, clinic where she sells over-the-counter medicines. She also attends to other patients' needs. In small villages, health services are sometimes difficult to come by, so persons with some understanding of the villagers' conditions are needed.

Annet is a very caring, compassionate woman. She is 35, married, with one child. She also cares for 4 orphans. She has operated her clinic for 10 years and has been in her lending group for the past 6 years.

With her loan, she plans to buy more medicines, beverages, and a fridge. Monica is a very committed individual who has a good sense of business. She hopes to one day buy a plot of land and construct her own home.

loans.use: To buy more medicines, soft drinks, and a fridge.

loans.name: Abdumalick

texts.en:
Abdumalick B. lives in Mastchoh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. He is a serious and strongly motivated borrower. He is eligible for an increased loan amount because of the stability of his business and its increasing profits. He breeds and sells livestock and operates a dairy. He would like to purchase a pedigreed bull for breeding purposes and a cow for the dairy. He plans to expand the assortment of products he sells: pasteurized milk, buttermilk, sour cream, cottage cheese, and so on. He is asking for a loan of $700 to buy this livestock, which will allow him to expand his product line and increase the family's income.

He would use part of his profits to build an additional room in his home.

loans.use: To buy a bull and a dairy cow

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en: Maruf A. lives in Spitamen and is married with 2 children. He has been the client of the MicroInvest since 2007 and they recommend him as a reliable client. Mr.A. is experienced and engaged in the sale of building materials. Now he would like to open a store to sell iron/metallic fabrics and is requesting a loan in order to be able to do so.

loans.use: to open a store

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu L. is 40-years-old and a mother of four children. Her family lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1995, she has been selling paper waste that is recycled into tissue paper. Her loan request of  $450 will allow her to purchase more paper waste and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase paper waste for resale to a tissue paper manufacturer

loans.name: Kosol

texts.en:
Mr. Kosol P. and his wife, Narin Yin, have been married since 2000. They have two children; one daughter and one son, one of whom studies at the local school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kosol has been a Motor Remoque taxi driver for seven years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City and back. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years.

Mr. Kosol is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $600 to replace an old trailer with a new passenger trailer for his motor taxi business and for repairing his house.

loans.use: For replacing motor taxi trailer and repairing house

loans.name: Amélie

texts.fr:
Born on 5 January 1970 in EKPE in the south of BENIN, Mrs. Amélie A. is married to Emmanuel KOUTON. She is the mother of 3 children (Djerry is 13, Kamayolle is 8, and Krismel is 5). All her children are studying, and are in the care of their parents. Having lived in COTONOU for more than 20 years, Mrs. Amélie A. is a seamstress by profession, but at the same time also has a job selling haberdashery products in YENAWA, a populous area of COTONOU. She obtains her supplies most notably from the large neighbour to the east, NIGERIA, and also from TOGO. Since the quarter is close to the largest market in BENIN, the neighbouring population, specifically the seamstresses, come in large numbers to buy from her. The massive demand for these products leads her to ask for her fourth loan, in order to respond to the expectations of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 5 janvier 1970 à EKPE  au sud du BENIN, dame A. Amélie est mariée à KOUTON Emmanuel. Elle est mère de 3 enfants ( Djerry 13ans, Kamayolle 8ans et Krismel 5ans). Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et sont à la charge de leur deux géniteurs. Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 20 ans, dame A. Amélie est couturière de profession mais elle mène parallèlement à sa profession  la vente de produits de mercerie à YENAWA un quartier populaire de COTONOU. Elle s’approvisionne notamment chez le grand voisin de l’EST, le NIGERIA  mais aussi au TOGO. Le quartier étant proche du plus grand marché du BENIN, les populations environnantes précisement les couturières viennent massivement acheter chez elle. La demande massive d’autres produits l’amène à solliciter son quatrième crédit afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of phoenix thread, 60 rolls of poplin, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun P. is married with five children and works selling fish at a market. On average she can typically make around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband has worked as a fisherman and a farmer growing rice crops and vegetables since 1980, earning about $5 per day as well. One of her children is employed by a garment factory, making about $70 to $80 each month and the rest of her children are enrolled in school. Mrs. Chhun P. has applied for a loan from KIVA to purchase more fish for her business.
( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chhun P. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Hildebrand

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco is 51 years old, lives in the neighbourhood ‘Laureles Sur’ in Managua, and is married. His wife is a housewife and together they have 2 children, 10 and 15 years old, who are studying in secondary school.

Francisco is a contractor and together with his hired help, they carry out construction projects. He has been working at this business for 25 years and this has given him the necessary experience carry on in this field. He requires the loan to purchase tools and the necessary accessories to use in construction. He would like to build up his business, establish a small company, and provide stability and education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y junto a ella tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 15 años quienes se encuentran estudiando la educación secundaria.

Don Francisco es contratista, junto a su personal realizan proyectos de construcción. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 25 años tiempo que le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para estar en este negocio. Necesita del préstamo para comprar herramientas y accesorios necesarios para usar en la construcción. Desea poder onsolidar su negocio y poner una pequeña empresa y proporcionarle estabilidad y educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To acquire construction tools and accessories

loans.name: Gabriela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gabriela is a 21-year old youngster, who is married and has three small children. She lives in the Edgard Munguía neighborhood. Her husband is in sales, and they both put forth a great effort to help the family get ahead.

Gabriela runs a general store from her home, having started eight years ago selling candy. She has managed to grow her business substantially. She is asking for a loan to invest in her enterprise, wishing to buy more merchandise so she can vary the types of product she has to offer to customers. She hopes that with this business, as well as the support of her husband, they will be able to provide an education for their small children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es una joven que a sus 21 años ya está casada y tiene 3 pequeños hijos, habita en el barrio Edgard Munguía. Su esposo se desempeña como auxiliar de ventas y ambos ponen todo su empeño para poder sacar adelante a la familia. Gabriela tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, hace 8 años empezó vendiendo golosinas y ya su negocio ha crecido mucho. Está solicitando el crédito para inversión de su negocio, desea adquirir más productos para aumentar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Espera que con este negocio y la ayuda de su esposo pueda sacar adelante a su familia y darle educación a sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to be able to provide a greater variety of product to her customers.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr:
Matar B. is one of the first members of the Jammy Xaleyi de Imbec village bank in Thies. He has 14 years' experience in selling groceries. He has a little store located near his home and has already taken out and repaid several loans through the village bank. He is requesting this loan with a view to bolstering his inventory of grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

matar B. est l'un des premiers membres de la caisse de jammy xaleyi de imcec de thies.il a une expérience de 14 ans de vente de denrées alimentaires.il a une cantine située près de chez lui et a eu à contracter plusieurs crédits au sein de la mutuelle .c'est dans le but de renforcer ses stocks qu'il demande un nouveau pret.

loans.use:
bolstering his grocery inventory

vente de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Gloria Aracely

texts.es:
Gloria empezó el negocio de la repostería para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, ya que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar y se dieron cuenta que no les alcanzaba con lo que su esposo ganaba, y ya que ella es una mujer muy emprendedora decidió empezar su propio negocio de repostería hace 6 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima suficiente, ya que la demanda actual sobrepasa su capacidad de producción
texts.en:
Gloria started the bakery business to help her husband with the expenses because their children started school and they realized that what her husband earned was not enough. Because she is a very enterprising woman, she decided to start her own bakery business six years ago. She needs a loan for US$250, that she will repay in three months, to buy sufficient raw material because the current demand surpasses her production capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a wife of A. D. and lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of one son, who is 2 years old.

Shazia baji's husband makes sharp wire - barbed wire - which is used to cover fencing around gardens and the tops of houses. The purpose of using sharp wires is to protect the building from robbers or animals.

Shazia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. Shazia baji is applying for a loan so her husband can buy iron to make more sharp wires.

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 42 years old and married to Mr. Sunny O. who is a teacher and they have five children. She sells secondhand shoes and clothes. Rosemary also mends clothes for local people. She needs the loan to purchase more second hand shoes to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Saadia Evangelina

texts.es:
La Señora Saadia Evangelina Pérez Caballero tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Evangelina tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella su hija mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y trabaja en Managua, su otro hijo de 20 años de edad cursa el 2 año de la carrera Ciencias Actuariales Financieras y un niño de 12 años que cursa el 6 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como técnico en la especialidad de maní, sus deseos son  de seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que ellos continúen adelante y sepan defenderse para el día de mañana  no tengan necesidades.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, la actividad económica a al que se dedica es la venta de sabanas, Doña Saadia inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza con media docenas de sabanas que decidió instalar un mostrador en la pulpería de su mama para que cuando los clientes llegaran a comprar pudieran apreciar su trabajo mas tarde una señora de somotillo llegaba a la pulpería y le pedía encargos de sabanas y es así como Ella va incrementando en su trabajo y al paso del tiempo se ofreció la distribución de sus productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo  ya que necesita tener surtidos los colores de las sabanas y necesita realizar las compras en los departamentos de Chinandega y Managua por lo que necesita comparar las telas y texturas de la sabanas para dar mejor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Saadia Evangelina Pérez Caballero is 49 years old, is married and has three children who are dependent on her. Her daughter is 27 years old and works in Managua, her older son is 20 years old and studying his second year of an Actuarial Business Sciences degree, and her younger son is 12 years old and enrolled in the sixth grade of primary school. Her husband works as a technician in the peanut business. She hopes to continue helping her children so that they keep making progress and know how to look after themselves, and so that in the future all of their needs are met. Saadia has run her own business selling sheets for 10 years. She started the business on her own count, with half a dozen sheets that she put on display in the small grocery store run by her mother so that when customers came into the store they would see her merchandise. Later a woman from the town of Somotillo came into the store and placed an order for sheets, and in this way Saadia started growing her business and over time she increased the distribution of her products. The loan is for working capital, to purchase sheets in a selection of colours. She needs to go to Chinandega and Managua to compare the fabric and texture of sheets and offer the best quality product to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mr. Ket Kheav Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ket K. is the president of a village bank in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. There are thirteen people in the village bank, all of whom live in the same village.

Mr. Ket K. and his wife, Mrs. Aum Neang, are grocers who own a small store in the local market. Since they have a lot of customers who have many demands, they want to expand their business. Mr. Ket K. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries for his inventory. He hopes to increase his income and to provide a better life for his children. 

Mr. Ket K. is 46 years old and the father of seven children, three of whom are workers in different positions, while the others attend the local school. 

Mrs. Srei Em S. did not come to the village bank meeting to get the loan, but her husband came, so he is presented picture, instead of his wife.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for his inventory.

loans.name: Benkadi (Bonne Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Saramaya II  (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 2 enfants. Elles résident dans des familles polygames dans le quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais la plus dominante est la vente d’habits pour enfants, des chaussures en plastique et la vente du bois de chauffe.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 1an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 douzaines d’habits pour enfants quelques paires de chaussures en plastique et 1 vingtaine de chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe.
 Elles s’approvisionnent soit sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) ou dans les villages environnants. Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (tel le marché de Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 17 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles envisagent devenir des grossistes.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi of the association Saramaya II is made up of four women who are on average 27 years old and have on average two children. They live in polygamous families in the neighborhood of Hamdallaye in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They practice different trades but the main one is the sale of children clothing, plastic shoes, and the sale of firewood for heating. They have collaborated with the institution Soro Yiriwaso for one year. This is their second solidarity loan (group loan). The previous loan was fully reimbursed.

They are planning on using this loan to buy two dozens children outfits, a few pairs of plastic shoes, and twenty cart loads of firewood for heating.

They stock up either on the spot in Sikasso town (third administrative region of Mali) or in the neighboring villages. The goods are sold retail and most of the time for cash at the markets in the town of Sikasso (such as the market of Médine and the large town market), and in the neighborhood. They sell to customers made up of women and men. They hope to each make a profit of 17 000 FCFA per month. They will use it to provide for their families’ needs and invest the rest in their businesses. They would like to become wholesalers.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children clothing, plastic shoes and firewood

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Mr. Hieng S. is a villager in Trapaing Khda Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Yorn Chroeb, sells firewood to help support the family. They have five children who are all attending the local school. Although they try to work hard, they cannot provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Hieng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and hopes to increase their income after selling the cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Fia

texts.en: Fia E., 41, is married with 6 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the production and selling of Samoan handicrafts and products. These are sold as souvenirs. She sells her products at the Fugalei market and to the general public, 5 days per week. She has had 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Fia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This money will be used to improve her business, her home and to meet her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy tools use for her craft.

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.ru: Замирахон работает преподавателем в школе. Это отнимает массу времени и только по выходным дням она занимается мелким предпринимательством – куплей продажей косточек от абрикосов. Бизнес мелкий, но приносит доход. Замирахон 47 лет, замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Замирахон слышала про МикроИнвест и решила обратиться за получением займа и собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Zamirahon works as a school teacher. This takes up the majority of her time and she works on her entrepreneurial venture only on the weekends – purchasing and selling apricot pits. The business is small but it makes a profit. Zamirahon is 47 years old, is married and is raising three children. She found out about MicroInvest and decided to turn here for a loan – she plans to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Faatoaga

texts.en: Faatoaga Oge is forty-five years old and married with three children.  She has six years of experience in the banana plantation business. She sells to the general public four days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $50.  SPBD loans are Faatoaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer, a weed eater and a plant sprayer.

loans.name: Mr. Sophal Uy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of twenty-four members is located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province, and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Sophal U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife, Mrs. B. Sary, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow vegetables.

In their growing, they face an obstacle because their field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mr. Sophal U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. hoses, and he would use the rest of money to cultivate rice. He is 45 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is a construction worker while two others are farmers; two are enrolled in the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy hoses and  cultivate rice

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
"Farming entails a lot of hard work," says Gina F., the 31-year-old of mother of two children. "My husband and I have been tilling land since the start of our marriage. It is hard work, but this has been the only thing that sustains our family."

Gina is requesting a loan of Php 14,000. She will use the loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and well as pesticides and other farm necessities.

She hopes to be able to improve their harvest with her loan. She would like to thank CEVI for helping her to sustain her livelihood.

CEVI provides not only loans but training sessions and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of fertilizer and well as pesticides and other farm necessities.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Kim

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị Kim (821040410) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To earn a living, D. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing and shoes in the local community. D. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, D. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. D. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jireth Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario jireth esta integrado por tres personas,  vecinos de la colonia obrera,  y han trabajado juntas, se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo.
las actividades que ellas realizan son las siguietes
    
la señora dilcia P. A. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor abelardo  ventura, tienen 4 hijos, dos de ellos viven en los estados unidos y dos estan con ella. ya estan graduados y trabajan.
su casa es construccion de ladrillos de adobe repellado con color blanco y rosado ella tiene un negocio en casa de variedades venta de abarroteria y zandalias, ropa. dilcia necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio.
 
carmelina L. J. vive en union libre con el señor catalino lopèz,  tiene 60 años de edad, no tienen hijos que dependen de ella.
dedica a la venta de cocos y una chiclera que tiene desde hace 10 años en la colonia obrera necesita el prestamo para comprar 500 cocos,confites y galletas por mayor tambien vende naranjas.
 
leonicia C. Z. es madre soltera, depende de ella solo un nieto de 14 años de edad, ella tiene 53 años de edad,  su casa esta construida de ladrillos de adobe repellado color blanco tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa y solicita el credito  para compra manteca,frescos,huevos, agua en bolsa etc.
texts.en:
The supportive group Jireth is made up of 3 people, neighbours of the workers colony. They have worked together and known each other for a long time. The activities that they do are the following: Señora Dilcia P. A. is 45 years old, and lives in a partnership with Señor Abelardo Ventura. They have 3 children, 2 of whom live in the United States and 2 with her. The children are now graduates and work. Her house is made from adobe bricks painted white and pink. Dilcia has a business in her house selling various groceries, sandals and clothes. She needs a loan to supply her business. Carmelina L. J. lives in a partnership with Señor Catalino Lopèz. She is 60 years old, and doesn't have children that depend on her. She sells coconuts and has a street stand which she has had for 10 years in the workers colony. She needs this loan to buy 500 coconuts, biscuits and also to sell oranges. Leonicia C. Z. is a single mother. She is 53 years old, and has a 14 year grandson that depends on her. Her house is made from adobe bricks painted white. She has a small local store in her house and is seeking credit to buy butter, juices, eggs, bottles of water etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, coconut, lollies, biscuits, oranges, butter, juice, eggs, bottled water and boots.

loans.name: Ohene Yesu Group

texts.en:
Mary is fifty-six years old and divorced with three children. She is a food vendor preparing and selling beverages in the mornings in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ohene Yesu’, which means King Jesus. Mary is seated in the middle of the group photograph.

The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Martha Daysi

texts.es: Martha Daysi Martínez González tiene 45 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a su negocio porque compro una máquina de coser, ya que anteriormente su Mama le enseño el oficio para salir adelante. Actualmente Martha labora como docente, pero debido a sus pocos ingresos decide incursionar en la costura. En sus desafíos se encuentra el tiempo, ya que muchas veces tiene encargos y nos lo puede realizar porque tiene que asistir a su trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo como tela, hilos, tijeras y agujas. En sus sueños esta el proporcionarle mejoras vivienda para que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor lugar para vivir.
texts.en:
Martha Daysi Martínez González is 45, and she has two dependent children. She is a seamstress, and she has been in this business for over three years. She started her business because she bought a sewing machine. Her mother previously taught her the craft of being a seamstress in order to get ahead. Martha currently works as a teacher. But, due to the low income she receives, she decided to venture into sewing. Finding the time to sew is a difficulty for her. Many times she has orders that she cannot work on because she has to go to work. The loan is for working capital to buy fabric, thread, scissors, and needles. Her dream is to make improvements on her house so that her children can have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: N. Karomat is a 63-year-old woman who has been working the land for twenty years. She is a strong physical and spiritual woman and, each day, she and her husband work diligently to make sure that they take good care of their crop. Their biggest source of income is the fruit of their labor; they grow onions, wheat and watermelons. Karomat is proud of the quality of her crops and of her knowledge. While waiting for the best moment of production, she is requesting a loan in order to maintain her crops, holding off on the harvest until the market indicates that it is the best time to yield the biggest profits. Karomat’s dream is to acquire more land and produce more crops in the future because the land that she loves and has been a part of her life has allowed her to move her family forward. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, including ammonium sulfate, and herbicides

loans.name: Ndèye Amy

texts.fr: Ndèye Amy N. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce d'arachide et en meme temps de l’embauche ovine. elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité, Ceci pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Amy N. is a 29 year old young woman who is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells peanuts and at the same time she fattens sheep. She wishes to increase her business in order to contribute better to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling peanuts and also fattening sheep

loans.name: Lutchemie

texts.en:
Lutchemie L. has been married for four years and is the young mother of a 1-year-old child. She tills a rice field in her hometown.

Like her fellow farmers, Lutchemie aspires to a good and abundant harvest. She joined CEVI and immediately adapted to its policies and thinks the monthly meeting does not bring hassle to the farmers. She requested a loan of Php 6,000 which she will use for additional farm inputs. This loan will help her and her family to lighten their way of living.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Kwassi Mawutodji

texts.fr: Cette jeune fille vend des cartes de recharges dans une baraque située au bord d’une route internationale, dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2005 ; cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle aime son commerce et accueille bien ses clients, ce qui fait qu’il y a des gens qui préfèrent toujours acheter des cartes chez elle. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a pas non plus aucun enfant à sa charge. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharge cellulaires Togocel et Illico. Elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour rembourser son prêt à temps.

loans.use: Achat de cartes de recharges cellulaires

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
