Mary S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Mary is 25 years old and is married to a business man. She has 5 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to renovate her house that has stayed with broken windows and doors for so long. She would one day like to rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She sells household items like basins, thermos flasks, kitchen trays, trolleys, plates, cups, knives, and spoons, among other products, in her stall. She has been in this business for three years. Alice earns extra income by supplying food, such as maize, to schools and hospitals. 

She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 45,000 to add more maize, utensils and shoes to her inventory. She says that her business has grown since joining Faulu, and she hopes to expand her business further and acquire land. She describes herself as hardworking, innovative and informed.

loans.use: Buy products for her inventory

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L., nicknamed "Vangie," lives at Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcya. She and her husband, George L., are blessed with five children. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, they strive to improve their living conditions and to ensure the schooling of their children.

Her husband works in the Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) to earn his living, while Vangie is engaged in running a sari-sari (general store) to supplement her husband's income. She wants to increase her business's income, but her capital is not sufficient; thus, she wants to borrow from Kiva lenders a loan amounting to Php 6,000 in order to strengthen her capital and improve her small business.

loans.use: To use as capital for improving her small sari-sari store

loans.name: Pony

texts.en:
Pony M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Pony is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Um Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-three people who live in Braimbei Mom village in TaK. province make up the village bank group and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Yom U. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keom Chab, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family.  Mrs. Yom U. is a mother of four children two of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura J. is from the village of Rizal Santiago City. She is 58 years old, is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Maura owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Maura has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maura joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maura is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Eriselda

texts.es: Ana Eriselda A. R. de 43 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 14 años, el cual estudia educación básica. Ana posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encargar de elaborar prendas de vestir para mujeres hombres y niños. A lo largo de los años Ana ha ido mejorando su trabajo, y obteniendo mayores reconocimientos de las personas, ya que estas piensan que Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se encuentra frente a su máquina de coser dispuesta a hacerlo lo mejor posible, y entregando todos los pedidos a tiempo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales como telas, hilos y agujas, de manera que cuente con mayor cantidad de productos para la elaboración de la ropa la cual se vende mucho más en estos meses del año, ya que los niños empiezan su año escolar, para Ana su hijo es lo más importante, es por esto que trabaja mucho para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Eriselda A. R. de 43 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 14 años, el cual estudia educación básica. Ana posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encargar de elaborar prendas de vestir para mujeres hombres y niños. A lo largo de los años Ana ha ido mejorando su trabajo, y obteniendo mayores reconocimientos de las personas, ya que estas piensan que Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se encuentra frente a su máquina de coser dispuesta a hacerlo lo mejor posible, y entregando todos los pedidos a tiempo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales como telas, hilos y agujas, de manera que cuente con mayor cantidad de productos para la elaboración de la ropa la cual se vende mucho más en estos meses del año, ya que los niños empiezan su año escolar, para Ana su hijo es lo más importante, es por esto que trabaja mucho para seguir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de telas, hilos y agujas.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 30 años que tiene sus metas bien trazadas, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Abelardo y sus dos hermosos e inquietos hijos; Verónica de 10 y Anthony de 8 años.
Todos los días, desde muy temprano, trabaja los terrenos agrícolas que arrienda para sembrar papa, arveja y flores (gladiolos) de diferentes colores, con la ayuda de algunos operarios que contrata. Su esposo se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros con su propio auto. 
A Yolanda le gusta dedicarse a la agricultura (desde hace 10 años) porque obtiene ingresos económicos provechosos que le permiten vivir cómodamente, también puede pagar una adecuada educación para sus hijos en la ciudad, pese a vivir a una hora con 20 minutos de distancia.
Como es una mujer emprendedora y conciente de que puede alcanzar sus objetivos con perseverancia, para el futuro anhela construir una casa en la ciudad para que sus pequeños no se cansen viajando, entretanto ella instalaría una tienda de venta de tubérculos y arveja, y para trasladar sus cosechas hacia el mercado piensa comprar un camión.         

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y considera que está progresando conjuntamente con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que viene solicitando, comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arveja y un saco de fertilizantes para obtener buenos productos en esta nueva campaña agrícola.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 30, has very well set out goals in life. She lives with her husband, Abelardo, and two beautiful, restless children: Verónica, 10 and Anthony, 8. Every day, from very early on, she farms leased lands to grow potatos, peas, and different colored gladiolas; she has a few hired hands that assist her. Her husband provides public transport services in his own car. Yolanda likes farming; she has done it for 10 years, because she earns good income that allows her to live comfortably. She is also able to afford a good education in the city for her children, even though they live an hour and 20 minutes away. As an enterprising woman and conscious that she can reach future goals with hard work and perseverance, she hopes to build a house in the city so that her little ones won't get so tired traveling. In the meantime, she will set up a store to sell tubers and peas and, in order to transport her crops, she is thinking about buying a truck. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels that she, together with her fellow communal bank members, is making progress. She will use the 1500 new soles requested to buy two sacks of pea seed and one sack of fertilizer in order to obtain better crops this next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela P. is from the village of Purok Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Rosela owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling beauty products like whitening lotion, perfume and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married with two grown daughters and lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. She is a small entrepreneur who sells women’s lingerie and swimsuits in the central mall called “Prikarpattya”. Her vending location is famous for its nice selection of merchandise and affordable prices. Tetyana is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in this trade for 14 years. Currently, her monthly income amounts to 8,000 UAH.
Tetyana is requesting a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase assorted women’s lingerie in order to boost sales. She used to work at a factory but she was downsized and had to look for another source of income to support her family, which is how she ended up as a market vendor. Today, her business is the main source of income for the family. Tetyana is hoping to make enough savings to buy an apartment some day for her elder daughter.

loans.use: To purchase assorted women's lingerie

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania tiene 32 años, actualmente vive con su prometido y tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la majestuosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tienen su casa propia.

Aunque creció en una casa hecha a base de quincha y barro, no significó que la vida no le iba dar la oportunidad de progreso. Desde hace 10 años viene trabajando en un puesto dentro de una escuela de menores; vende comida rápida, golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, etc. Generalmente trabaja sola y se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, ya que le brinda buenos resultados, suficientes para solventar sus necesidades familiares. Para el futuro espera construir su casa de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y asegura que estos créditos he han traído muchos beneficios. En efecto, se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente, además se siente satisfecha y contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal.

Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar más productos para su puesto, ya que con ello tendrá mayor variedad de productos qué ofrecer a sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Epifania is 32 years old and currently lives with her fiancé and 3 school-age children. They reside in the majestic Ayacuchana jungle, specifically in a place called "Quimbiri," where they have their own home. Although she was raised in a house made of wattle and daub, life has still given her opportunity to advance. For 10 years she has worked in a retail store selling fast food, sweets, cookies, soft drinks, etc. She generally works alone and feels satisfied with her work. It has already given her enough money to pay for household necessities. In the future, she hopes to build a house of noble material, with the goal of improving her children's standard of living. This is her third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She assures us that the loans have brought her many benefits. She is committed to making her payments on time, and she feels satisfied and content to be a member of her communal bank. With this loan, she plans to purchase more products for work; therefore, she will have a greater variety of products to offer to her more-demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Friba Eqbal Group

texts.en: Najeba is the daughter of M., the leader of the four-person Friba Eqbal group. She is married and the mother of four children. They live in Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to take a loan for her son who is single and lives at home. He has a general store and the whole family benefits from the income it generates so he wants to enlarge it. His mother, Najeba, has requested a loan for her son. She is happy that she has got this chance to help his progress.

loans.use: to increase his  inventory

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene 39 años, separado, vive solo, tiene una hija, Nayeli de 8 años, a la que siempre va visitar y por quien trabaja tan duramente. Hace un tiempo que se dedica en la venta de pintura para pared, asimismo brinda el servicio de pintor de brocha gorda en exteriores e interiores. Es así que trabaja en su taller que se encuentra a dos horas de su casa, es por ello que debe despertarse muy temprano para llegar a tiempo a su trabajo. Paralelo a este trabajo, también se dedica en la venta de colchones, por lo que le ayuda a tener un ingreso adicional a su economía. Los contratos son buenos y las ventas también es por ello que se siente muy contento. En un futuro espera tener un gran local donde pueda dedicarse en la venta de éste último producto, ya que lo considera más rentable, por el momento desea seguir trabajando en la venta de pinturas y con las ganancias que obtenga pueda cubrir la educación de su hija con el fin de que sea una profesional. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará andamios que le ayude a pintar los exteriores y una parte comprar colchones para que pueda iniciar su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 39 years old, separated and lives alone. Nayeli is his 8 year old daughter who he always goes to visit and for whom he works so hard. He has been working as a wall painter for some time now. He offers his services as an advertisement painter for both interior and exterior work. He works from his studio which is located two hours from home and therefore must wake up very early to arrive to work on time. In addition to this painting work, he also sells mattresses for additional income. Contracts are good and so are sales which is why he is very happy. In the future, he hopes to have a great place where he can engage in the sale of its latest product [mattresses], since he considers it more profitable. In the mean time, he wishes to continue working on selling his paintings as the earnings can cover his child's education to become a professional. This is his first loan with MFP and he agrees to be punctual with all payments. The requested loan will be used to purchase scaffolding which helps the exterior painting and part buy mattresses so he can start his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy painting supplies and buy mattresses to start his new business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: LA SR. CELINA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO LAS PALMAS, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE MARCOS Y PUERTAS QUE SU ESPOSO LO FABRICA EN SU CARPINTERIA, LLEVAN VARIOS AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD SU ESPOSO ES CARPINTERO Y ELLA TAMBIEN LE AYUDA EN LA CONSTRUCCION DE MUEBLES, TIENE 1 HIJO PEQUEÑO, EL CUAL JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO LO ESTAN CRIANDO, ELLA LE AYUDA EN LA ECONOMIA, SU DESEO ES TENER UN PUESTO PROPIO EN LA CIUDAD PARA VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS, YA QUE TIENEN QUE DISTRUIBUIR ENTRE LOS MAYORISTA LOS CUALES LE PAGAN MUY POCO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARAN MADERA PARA LA FABRICACCION DE SUS PRODUCTOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Celina lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of the town of El Torno, about 40 km. from the city of Santa Cruz. Her business is the sale of doors and frames, which her husband makes in his workshop. They have been in this business for several years. Her husband is a carpenter, and Celina also helps with the construction. They have one young son. Celina’s wish is to have a place in the city to sell their products. As it is, they have to sell wholesale and so the prices are low. With the money from this loan, they will buy wood for the fabrication of their products. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lumber for carpentry shop

loans.name: Sokhhim

texts.en: Mr. Sokhhim K. is a 32-year-old married man who lives in Preaek Pang village, Kandal province. He is a vegetable seller while his wife, Mrs. Mom Chea, is a pork rice seller. With both businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. Since vegetable selling is going well, Mr. Sokhhim K. wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables. This couple has two children, who are too young to study or work. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay household expenses that they have in their home, health expenses, and improvements to the house – change the electrical system

loans.name: Boldsaihan

texts.en: Boldsaihan S. is 21 years old and lives with his parents in Hovd province, in western Mongolia. He and his family live in their own house. His father works as an engineer in a local meteorology center, while his mother sells household products at a local market. He started his PC game business in 2009 in the basement of an apartment with eight new personal computers. His daily earnings now exceed 30,000 to 50,000 MNT. Boldsaihan is a modest and hard-working man who is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a car for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
This is 63 year old Krishna Kumari B.. She is married and has 2 children aged 30 and 25. In 1980, she established her agriculture business, and works 7 days a week and 8 hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW, which she used to increase the investment in her agriculture business. In the future, Krishna Kumari plans to increase her income from agriculture. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To increase investment in agriculture.

loans.name: Wenceslao Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Wenceslao es de profesión arquitecto, tiene una familia de 3 miembros, su esposa se dedica a la venta de productos de temporada, con el prestamo tiene pensado comprar material de construcción por cantidad como: fierro ,cemento, madera, azulejos y una mescladora, sobre todo estos materiales que son  los que más suben de precio en el mercado, ya que se dedica a realizar contratos con obras vendidas, tambien tiene planes de ahorrar para abrir una constructora junto a su hijo que tambien se encuentra estudiando arquitectura y que el este tiempo se encuentra capacitando con su papá, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Wenceslao is an architect by profession. His family has three members. His wife sells seasonal products. He plans to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: iron rods, cement, lumber, tile and a cement mixer especially because these items are the ones whose prices increase the most in the marketplace since he enters into contracts with sold projects. He also plans to save in order to open a construction firm with his son who is also studying architecture and is currently training with his father. He is a responsible and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 31 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Ronald de 30 años, que es obrero en una fábrica y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan en un populoso barrio al  norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado ha laborar en distintos oficios, y luego que se junto con su pareja, se le ocurrió emprender un nuevo negocio para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad, y en sociedad con una amiga se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos, dice que la labor debe ser constante, pues desde muy pequeños los polluelos requieren de esmerados cuidados para lograr crecer sin dificultad. Al principio fue fácil, pero a medida que aumentaba estos animales tuvieron que trasladarlos a un espacio más amplio. Le gusta mucho el negocio de comercialización de pollos, pues éstos crecen rápido y en solo un mes ya los pueden vender. Pero lo que no le gusta es subir el cerro donde esta ubicada el galpón, pues es algo dificultoso, ya que ella adolece de los riñones. Y como es una mujer emprendedora tiene grandes sueños para ampliar este negocio, y uno de ellos es comprar un terreno para aumentar la cantidad de pollos, y así mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas, ya que desea seguir trabajando en busca del progreso, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá ampliar su negocio. Ana tiene planeado invertir este crédito solicitado en la compra de alimento balanceado y vitaminas para brindarles a sus polluelos el mejor cuidado, de esta manera espera venderlos a mayor precio y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and lives in her own house. She lives in the company of her 30-year old husband, Ronald, who is a factory worker, and her 2 small children. Together, they live in a populated neighborhood north of the city.

Since she was young, she has worked in different jobs but after marrying her husband, she decided to start a new business to help with the household expenses. Now, in association with a friend, she works raising and selling chickens. She says that the work must be constant because from the time that they are very small, the chicks require a great deal of care so that they grow without any difficulty. At the beginning it was easy, but as the number of animals increased, they had to take them to a larger space. She likes selling chickens very much – they grow quickly and they can be sold in just a month. However, what she doesn’t like is going up the hill to where the barn is located, as it is difficult since she has backaches.

Since she is an enterprising woman, she has big dreams to expand this business and one of those dreams is to purchase a piece of land to increase the number of chickens and, in that way, increase her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, since she wants to continue working in search of progress. In addition, she is very grateful for all of the people that made this loan possible, which will allow her to expand her business. Ana plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of balanced diet and vitamins to provide better care to her chicks. This way, she hopes to sell them at a better price and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her chicks

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio. Por la falta de oportunidades ella tubo que invertir sus ahorros en unas cabinas telefónicas y artículos de computadoras. La mama le ayudo con una parte de casa para que pueda construir y ubicar su pequeño negocio. 

Ella ofrece servicios de llamadas a nivel nacional con una tarifa muy baja, también vende todo tipo de artículos en su pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. Ella  esta preocupada y le quiere dar una mejor vida a su hijo por eso quiere con el préstamo mejorar su casa comprando cemento, pinturas y otras cabinas telefónicas. En el futuro quiere tener un cyber y amplia su negocio
texts.en:
Rosa lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio. Due to the lack of employment opportunities she had to invest her savings in phone booths and computer equipment. Her mother helped her with part of the house she could use to build and set up her small business. She offers national phone call service at a very low rate and also sells all sorts of things in her small locale. She works from very early in the morning every day. She worries because she wants to provide a better life for her son. This is why she needs a loan to improve her house buying cement, paint and some additional phone booths. In the future, she’d like to have an Internet café and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, paint and telephone booths.

loans.name: Edwardo

texts.en:
Edwardo B. is from the village of Centro 2. He is 59 years old. Edwardo is single. To make a living, Edwardo owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing wedding and gown rental services to local community members. Edwardo has been engaged in his business for more than 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edwardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwardo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edwardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignments of drugs

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Byambadorj G. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house inside a fence in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His older son, age 10, attends a local secondary school while his younger son is in kindergarten and his wife works as a salesperson in a company. 

Byambadorj operates a transportation business. Using his own truck, he manages a coal, firewood and timber trading business in his town. He purchases his materials from the countryside and brings them back to the capital of the province for resale. He began his business in 2000, and since then, he has gained much experience as a truck driver. He says, “I am planning to buy a larger, fuel-efficient truck with a hauling capacity of 5-10 tons”. 

Byambadorj is requesting a 2,100,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more coal and wood at wholesale prices from mining operations and the countryside to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and wood

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Chhoun S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and one young child in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker, making US$2.50 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$3 of profit a day. Chhoun S. wants to take out a loan of US$800 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Юнусов Рахматулло житель города Душанбе. Ему 53 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Жена домохозяйка. Работает мужским парикмахером. Благодаря своему многолетнему опыту в этой области, у него много клиентов. Кредит просит для приобретения инструментов и аксессуаров, чтобы иметь возможность получить больше дохода.
texts.en: Y. Rahmatullo lives in the city of Dushanbe. He's fifty-three years old, married and is a father to three children. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. He graduated from high school, and works as a barber. Because of his many years of experience in the field, he has a lot of clients. He's requesting a loan to acquire a variety of instruments and accessories in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To acquire a variety of instruments and accessories

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev R., 40 years-old, is requesting a loan of US $1,000 in order to purchase electronic equipment for one of her children to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. R. is a housewife and her husband is a driver for a private company, earning an income of US $5 per day. 

R. is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for the garment factory industry. The family has to spend US $120 on food, US$ 20 on electricity supply, and US$ 30 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase electronic equipment to start a business.

loans.name: Karin Group

texts.es: Jessica L. es una de las integrantes de la alcancía comunal Karin conformada por siete miembros los cuales todos radican en el distrito de Lurigancho – Chosica. Una alcancía con grandes valores  y dedicación en cada puesto de trabajo en los que se desempeñan, así se caracteriza este grupo comunal. Jessica L. de 36 años de edad tiene 2 hijos que a un depende de ella por lo cual decidió hace ya cuatro años abrir un salón de belleza, El cual le ha dado mucha estabilidad económica para ella y para su hogar, ella comenzó en este negocio a raíz de que recibió el apoyo de su esposo pudiendo así abrir un salón de belleza en su propia casa. A su vez también venden productos de belleza hace no más de dos años, este trabajo le a podido dar satisfacciones como la financiación de la educación de sus hijos y mejoras para su casa. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en productos de belleza y mejoras  para su local de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jessica L. is a member of the Karin community bank.  The bank has seven members who all live in Lurigancho - Chosica district.  All of the members of this group display great courage and commitment in the businesses that they carry out.  The community bank is characterized by these traits.

Jessica L. is 36 years old and has 2 dependent children.  Four years ago she decided to set up a beauty salon.  This business has provided herself and her household with a lot of financial stability.  She started out in this business with her husband's support.  She was able to open a beauty salon in her own home.  Jessica L. has also been selling beauty products for two years.  This work has enabled her to pay for her children's education and to make improvements to her home which has been very satisfying for her.  She will invest this loan in buying beauty products and making improvements to her work premises.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Sabanor Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Sabanor” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed J. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. This forty-five-year-old is married to a businesswoman.  They have four children. Mohamed has been a businessman for many years, selling chocolates, sweets, mints, sardines, books, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current inventory.

loans.use: To buy products at wholesale price to resell

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamreun S. (in the photo) is a widow with eight children: three sons and five daughters. Five are married, one is a teacher, one has full-time employment and another attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chamreun is a silk weaver. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter, who is a teacher, to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Neou

texts.en:
Kung Khim, age 37, is a married woman who has given birth to two children. To make a daily profit, she works as part of the internal staff of a private organization in Kompong Cham province. She has been working in this sector since 2000, and has a fixed salary every month. 

She has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer, earning around $2 a day to help with the family's expenses. In order to make extra revenue, Kung Khim is applying for her loan to buy piglets to raise. She will sell them when they are big enough.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 7 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of grandchildren and her late sister’s children.

Rose has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through selling school chalk and renting rooms.

The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 1,000 laying birds and also to build more rental houses. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 32-year-old man, married and father of two, owner of a grocery store. He lives in Beirut. The shop was his father's who opened it in 1975. Nimer is honest and fast in customer service.

This is his third loan. He reports that the previous loans allowed him to improve his social situation and enhance his children's education. He requests a loan from Al Majmoua to buy products for the store such as cheese, poultry, candies and gas. In the future he wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more products for the store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and widowed, with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilma  runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Wilma has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP,  which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods, beverages and instant noodles. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, beverages and  instant noodles

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman N. is 38 years old, married and has three children. From the time he was young, Elman was learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifices, and seeing his family progressing more and more. He sells cattle in the livestock bazaar once every two months. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children. Elman is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN, which will allow him to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Editta

texts.en:
Editta is 48 years old, married and has five children. She is a very hardworking farmer. She started farming as a business in 2000. She also relies on her husband for financial support.  

Editta rears dairy cattle, poultry and turkeys. She also grows maize. She has four casual laborers who assist her on the farm. She hopes to drill a borehole (well) on the farm in the future. She has requested 80,000 KES to buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.
Berna has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works six days a week. Berna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cooking oil and crates of soda. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.|The main business challenge(s) for Berna include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her business goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cooking oil and crates of beer.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora sabina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, tejido de gorras, venta e chocolates, tejido de chompas, carpintería, tejido de awayos, confección de deportivos, tejido en máquina.

La señora Sabina, indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por que formaron grupo en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que inicio hace diez años; este negocio lo aprendió ayudando a su padre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de madera por mayor. Este producto los comprará de la barraca y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la Feria 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo, con la ayuda de su esposo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y  tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The lending group "Amapolas" will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus center  Los Andes. The group is made up of 7 members and is directed by a board headed by Sabina. The members have varied businesses including: weaving cloths, weaving hates, selling chocolates, weaving sweaters, carpentry, weaving awayos (traditional cloths), making athletic shoes, and machine weaving.

Sabina has worked for Pro Mujer for three years and joined because they were starting the group in her area. Currently she has a carpentry business which she began 10 years ago. She learned the trade from her father.

The loan that she will take out now is to buy wood in bulk. She will buy them from the large storage stall and after making the products she will sell them in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays, with the help of her husband. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She lives with her common-law husband and they have two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she reponsds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran is 46 years old and married with two children. Both of her kids are enrolled in a school and getting an education. She is a supportive lady by nature. Besides her household work, she helps her husband in his dairy business.  

They both get up early in the morning, get milk from the buffalo and then her husband goes to the milk shops and community clients to sell the milk. He sells milk at reasonable rates, and that’s why he has good clients in the region. He has been in this profession for the past 20 years. In this number of years, he has got good reputation among his clients.  

Ghafooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to increase the milk productivity and improve his sales. She is hopeful that another buffalo will not only be an asset for his business but also help him in improving their financial condition.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged one and five. He runs a furniture-making shop at Kambi in Kakamega. Peter has been running his business for four years now and has one employee. He hopes to use his loan to purchase timber to further develop his furniture-making shop. He also hopes that in future, he will be able to purchase a vehicle for use in his business. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Saidrahmon

texts.en:
Saidrahmon is a hard-working man. He is married and the father of four children. Saidrahmon tries to maintain good living conditions for his family; toward this end, he engages in selling foods such as sugar, oil, pasta and more. He trades at the central local market in the Shahrituz region. Saidrahmon wants to expand his business and increase his working capital in order to improve his family's standard of living. That’s why he has requested a loan of 8,500 TJS.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito, vive con su esposa y tiene tres hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cultivo de maíz y maicillo, él inicio desde joven a sembrar porque aprendió al lado de su padre cuando era joven.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y pesticidas para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz, este préstamo le ayudara a comprar el abono en mejor precio y dar el cuido necesario al cultivo.
Su mayor sueño en comprar ganado y aumentarlo en sus terrenos, ya que es un mejor negocio y deja mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Benito lives with his wife and has three children.  He works raising cattle and growing corn and sorghum.  He started as a young man, as he learned to grow crops alongside his father when he was young.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and pesticides to apply to his crop of corn.  This loan will help him to buy the manure at the best price and to provide the necessary care for his crops.

His biggest dream is to buy livestock and to increase his land, as this will make for a better business and provide better profits.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides to apply to his crop of corn.

loans.name: Maria Gracia

texts.en:
Maria Gracia is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Maria Gracia is providing motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and to pay for the gasoline for the transportation service.

Maria Gracia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Gracia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Mlandizi Kati Group

texts.en:
Alexia, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who goes to school. She has had a business selling eggs door to door since 2002. She works for three hours from 9 a.m. to noon and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half of the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loans to sell eggs door to door, sell more chapati and mandanzi, and cover household expenses. She has paid all of her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more eggs to sell. (She has special customers where she delivers her eggs.) Her dream is to one day be able to have a shop where she can sell all of her products in one place.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mlandizi Kati," which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Mukaramhan's Group

texts.en:
Mukaramhan is the leader of this group. She is 50 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a daughter and two sons. The daughter is a farmer, the first son works in a cotton factory and the second son works in a cafeteria. In 1999, Mukaramhan saved some money and purchased seeds of cotton. She owns 0.4 hectares of land where she started to grow cotton. By selling some part of the harvest, she earns about 4,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Mukaramhan wants to purchase potato seeds. She wants to start cultivating potatoes. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children.

Marites has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has operated this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy more inventory (including canned goods, snacks, and beverages). Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory like canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena  es casada, tiene 39 años D. edad, tiene 7 hijos 4 D. los cuales estudian, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 3 años D. experiencia con este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo  para la compra D. hilos D. diferentes clases y colores, espe4ra en el futuro tener trabajadores en su negocio.
texts.en: Elena is married.  She’s 39 years old and has 7 children four of which are in school.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She’s a weaver.  She started as an employee and now has three years’ experience with this work.  Her husband, who does the same kind of work, supports her efforts.  She’s asking for a loan to buy yarn in assorted types and colors.  In future she hopes to have employees in her business.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan, 29 years old, sells food and electronic products, earning $10 per day. Her husband repairs electronics, earning $3.30 per day. The couple has one child, 7 years old and in school. Each month, Nhan spends $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses.

Nhan would like to request a loan of $800 to buy electronic products to resell. She wants to extend her business to sell more electronic products because this business can bring in a good income and is less tiring than selling food.

loans.use: To buy electronic products to sell

loans.name: Filiz

texts.en:
Filiz is the youngest of five children. Her mother and father were both tailors and her father passed away at a young age. All of her siblings learned how to sew from their mother and have been able to help support their family. Now, her siblings are all married, but Filiz is single and lives at home with her mother, who is retired. Filiz is a high school graduate and has 10 years of work experience, including working as an accountant, a car painter, and a tailor. 

Filiz decided to start her own business and has found a niche as a costume tailor. This will be her third loan with Maya after beginning three years ago. During that time, Filiz has: tripled her customers; doubled her production volume; increased her annual revenue by 50% in her second year; rented a workshop and employed her sister; set up a website and increased her internet sales; maintained high quality customer service and satisfaction; and designed and made theater costumes. 

With credit from Maya, Filiz wants to develop her business. Her loan will enable her to buy more sewing and embroidery machines that are necessary for her business. She will be able to produce a variety of regional costumes and other kinds of products to meet customer needs and demands. Filiz recently found a new work space and is aiming is to increase her production speed and grow her business.

In the future, Filiz wants to set up a large production shop with products of modern designs. She plans to get a space in the market to be better able to follow brands, prices and developments in the industry abroad in order to eventually sell products under her own brand name and her products abroad.

Filiz has many qualities that have enabled her success thus far. She was easily able to analyze the business sector, find a niche in costume production, and she seems predisposed to trade. She is brave, talented, and not afraid to experiment. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff


Filiz beş kardeşten en küçüğüydü.  Annesi ve babası terzilik yapıyordu.  Babası genç yaşta öldü.  Tüm kardeşleri annesinden nasıl dikiş dikileceğini öğrendi ve ailesinin geçimine katkıda bulundu.  Şimdi bütün kardeşleri evli fakat Filiz bekar ve emekli olan annesi ile birlikte yaşıyor.  Liseyi bitirdi ve on yıllık iş tecrübesi var.  Muhasebeci,araba boyacısı ve terzilik işlerinde çalıştı.  Kendi işini yapmaya ve uygun bir yer bulup kostüm sektörüne girmeye karar verdi.  Maya ile çalışmaya üç yıl evvel başladı ve bu onun üçüncü kredisi.  İşe başladığından bu zamana kadar:

     Müşteri kapasitesini üç katına çıkardı
     Üretim hacmini ikiye katladı.
     Yıllık ciro artışını iki yılda % 50 ye çıkardı.
     İşyeri kurma aşamasına geçti,personel çalıştırmaya başladı.
     Bunun için reklam ve tanıtım yaparak internet yoluyla satışa başladı.
     Kostüm kiralama ile ürün sayısını ve çeşitliliğini arttırdı.
     Makine ve malzeme alımı yaptı.
     Kaliteli hizmetle müşteri memnuniyetini korudu.
     Tiyatro kostümlerini tasarladı ve yaptı. 

Filiz Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile işini geliştirmek istiyor.  Kostüm sektöründe gerekli olan dikiş ve nakış makineleri alacak.  Böylece yöresel ve diğer çeşitli kostümlerinde üretimini sağlayarak, müşteri ihtiyaç ve taleplerini karşılamış olacak.  Son zamanlarda yeni çalışma yeri buldu ve ürünlerini daha hızlı dikerek, ürünlerini geliştirdi. Kendi işinin sahibi olmakla birlikte, büyük bir üretim atölyesi kurup, yeni ve modern ürünler tasarlamak istiyor.
Kendi işinin sahibi olmakla birlikte büyük bir üretim atölyesi kurup yeni ve modern ürünler tasarlamak istiyor.  Pazarda yerini alıp kendi markasıyla yurt dışına ürün pazarlamayı hedefliyor. Filiz Hanım'ın birçok ayırt edici özelliği olduğundan başarılı.Bu sektörü iyi analiz ettiğinden,kostüm sektöründe kendine yer edindi ve ticarete yatkın görünüyor.
Filiz Hanım,cesur ,yeniliklere açık ve yetenekli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy sewing and embroidery machines

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María,  tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y  15 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es ebanista. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en el negocio, el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería donde realiza variedad de productos elaborados con la madera y que las elabora bajo pedido de sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado y tiene que entregar alguna obra. El tiene más de 10 años con su negocio y nunca le ha faltado trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura, pega, clavos y otros materiales útiles para realizar su trabajo.
 
Su sueño  seguir adelante con su negocio y que no falte trabajo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'María del Carmen' community bank meet in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo).  This is the home of the famous Panama hat.  It is a cold-climate city with many natural tourist attractions in the area.  

Here we meet María.  She is 38 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship who are 17 and 15 years old.  They are both in school.  Her husband is a furniture maker.  María has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and is the group's secretary.  She likes it for the help that she receives through the loans.

María is taking out a loan to help her husband in his business.  Her husband has a furniture-making workshop where he makes a variety of products from wood.  He makes his products to order for his customers.  He works every day, from 8.00am to 5.00pm, and sometimes until even later.  His son helps him when he is free and he has work to deliver.  He has been in this business for more than 10 years and has never been short of work.  This loan will be used to buy wood, paint, adhesive, nails and other materials he needs to carry out his work.  His dream is to continue making progress in the business and to always have work.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, adhesive, nails, etc.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Savun and her husband, Sophal, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One is a weaver and the others attend school.   

Savun is a weaver. In addition, she raises pigs at home. Her husband is a house builder. Savun hopes to continue her pig farming by buying additional pigs and feed. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to provide her with capital.

Photo: Savun and her loom.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Marilis Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marilis, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno ya mayor de edad y dos de 15 y 12 años, todos estudian en Universidad el mayor y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es maestro de escuela.

Ella trabaja de maestra  en una escuela de la localidad, pero además de esto también se dedica al comercio, pues en sus ratos y días libres vende ropa de todo tipo, la mayoría de la mercadería la entrega bajo pedido que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación, ella vende a crédito  y cobra cada quince días, la mercadería que vende se la envían  desde Panamá, lleva con este negocio por más de 18 años y le va muy bien ya que la mercadería que vende es de muy buena calidad.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y ropa de niños. Es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses.

Su sueño tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza y Progreso” (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets in Montecristi every two weeks.  The town is known for its rich culture and its pre-colonial artistry is known nationally and internationally.  It’s also known for its famous straw hats.

Here we meet Marilis. She’s 49 years old, married and has three children.  One is fully grown and the others are 15, and 12 years old.  The eldest attends university and the younger ones attend school.  Her husband is a school teacher.

She also works as a schoolteacher in town and has a clothing business and sells all types of clothing in her spare time.  Most of her sales are through orders that her customers place in advance.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  Her merchandise is shipped from Panama.  She’s been running this business for the past 18 years and things are going well for her because she sells good quality merchandise.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and children’s clothing.  This will be her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes the quick loans with low interest rates. 
Her dream is to open her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Moreen's Group

texts.en:
Moreen's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Moreen is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells second-hand clothing.

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothing for resale, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land to build a house on.

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Moreen's future prospects by helping her to develop life goals.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Karima's Group

texts.en:
Karima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her son’s cosmetics business. With the loan investment, he will buy cosmetics such as nail polishes, creams, and other products in larger quantities, allowing him to offer more variety to his customers and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for many years, and Karima is hopeful about his success after this investment.

Karima is very supportive and helps her family financially by sewing clothes for her local clients. She is also an expert in hand embroidery. Karima has 5 other children who are illiterate and stay at home. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children.

She has great belief in GOD, and she is confident that the living standard of her family will be improved after the betterment of her son’s business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Karima.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes, creams, and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Gladys Edid

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia El Valle en Cuenca, conocida también como San Bautista de El Valle, parroquia en la que se puede desfrutar de la paz de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Gladys tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que vive es de su  propiedad.

Doña Gladys labora como empleada privada hace un año, en sus tiempos libres trabaja en la venta de ropa y joyas de plata, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 4 años.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de joyas de plata para crecer en este negocio.
 
Su sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of Primero de Enero Communal Bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the El Valle de Cuenca district, also known as San Bautista de El Valle, where you can enjoy the peace of nature.  The people there are pleasant and kind, and maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

Gladys, 26, lives in a common-law relationship from which she has two children, ages 8 and 2.  Her first child, a daughter, studies in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and works driving a truck.  The house in which she lives is her property.

Gladys has worked as a private employee for a year.  In her free time she works selling clothing and silver jewelry, a business she has had for four years.

This is her third loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying silver jewelry to grow in this business.

Her dream is to travel around the world.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry.

loans.name: Gino Andru

texts.es:
Gino is 21 years old and lives in Chincha, Peru. Chincha is a region that has deep roots in Afro-Peruvian culture. The rich culture is complimented by a rich cuisine. Gino particularly enjoys a traditional dish called Carapulcra con sopa seca. He works hard to make ends meet as a single young man.

Gino is a beer salesman and a taxi driver. He works at least seven hours every day, and believes that he has found success because of his charismatic personality and high quality products. He works both jobs on his volition, and in addition to this already busy life, he sometimes works as a computer technician. 

He has requested this loan for personal development—he would like to improve his home by purchasing cement to put on his walls and finishing the installation of water and light. This will give more tranquility and a better quality of life. In six months, he hopes to have better sales and create a growing base of loyal clientele. His ultimate dream is to have his own home and study more technical maintenance.
texts.en:
Gino is 21 years old and lives in Chincha, Peru. Chincha is a region that has deep roots in Afro-Peruvian culture. The rich culture is complimented by a rich cuisine. Gino particularly enjoys a traditional dish called Carapulcra con sopa seca. He works hard to make ends meet as a single young man.

Gino is a beer salesman and a taxi driver. He works at least seven hours every day, and believes that he has found success because of his charismatic personality and high quality products. He works both jobs on his volition, and in addition to this already busy life, he sometimes works as a computer technician. 

He has requested this loan for personal development—he would like to improve his home by purchasing cement to put on his walls and finishing the installation of water and light. This will give more tranquility and a better quality of life. In six months, he hopes to have better sales and create a growing base of loyal clientele. His ultimate dream is to have his own home and study more technical maintenance.

loans.use: To improve his surroundings.

loans.name: Marcela María

texts.es:
Marcela una muy trabajadora mujer de 24 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa para hombre y dama la cual distribuye en el pueblo y sectores cercanos. 

Trabaja diariamente con el ánimo y la ilusión de tener capital para iniciar la construcción de su casa, pero sabe que este es un mercado que debe estar cambiando constantemente y no se puede estancar con lo que tiene por lo que necesita tener capital constantemente.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una nueva línea de ropa para hombre y dama, buscando fidelizar clientes en otros sectores y hacerse conocida en toda la ciudad. 

Para ella es muy importante este crédito pues representara un cambio de mercancía y lo más importante hará valer sus largos desplazamientos que en muchas ocasiones pierde por no tener variedad de mercancía. 

Gracias a los ingresos de esta admirable mujer su familia conformada por sus padres y tíos pueden disfrutar de una cena y de unos servicios públicos.
texts.en:
Marcela is a very hard-working 24 year old woman who dedicates herself to selling men's and women's clothing in her town and nearby regions.  

She works daily with enthusiasm and the desire to have the capital to begin building her own home.  She knows, however, that the market is constantly changing, and thus it can collapse at any time, and she needs to have capital in order to avoid any problems. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new line of clothing for men and women. She hopes to please her customers from other sectors of the city and thus become known throughout. 

This loan is very important for her since it represents a change in merchandise, and the most important thing is to evaluate the long term since many times you can lose money for not having sufficient merchandise.  

Thanks to the income of this admirable woman, her family, made up of parents, aunts and uncles, can enjoy a good meal and public services.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Pierrot

texts.fr: Pierrot est âgé de 43 ans. Il vit en union libre et n’a pas d’enfant. Il est propriétaire d’une petite entreprise de revente de peinture et d’autres articles pour la maison. Il aimerait développer cette activité et augmenter ses revenus. Il demande ce prêt pour acheter un nouveau stock de peintures.

loans.use: acheter un nouveau stock de peintures

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.en:
Kodzo B. was born in Davié in 1976. There, he went to school until the 7th grade. Thinking himself old enough, he no longer wanted to attend school. Instead, he wished to pursue his dream of making shoes, so he trained as a shoemaker. He currently owns his own shop, called «Viens Voir», or Come and See, where he makes men’s shoes and women’s sandals. He is married and the father of a child. Because of the quality of his work, his customer base is growing to the point where he has trouble meeting the demand due to a lack of funds.

Brimming with the will to succeed, Mr. B. is requesting a loan of $850 to re-outfit his shop and to buy work-related materials. He will then be able to open an outlet in the heart of the city of Tsévié. This loan will allow him to increase his profit margin, which will as a result improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur B. Kodzo est né vers 1976 à Davié où il a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de 5ème. Ne voulant plus poursuivre les études car estimant trop âgé, il désire réaliser son souhait qui est de devenir un grand cordonnier. Il apprit alors le métier de cordonnerie. Actuellement, il a son propre atelier où il fabrique des chaussures pour hommes et tapettes pour femmes. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. De par la qualité de ses prestations, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus importante qu’il a du mal à servir car il manque de moyens.

Pleine de volonté, il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour réaménager son atelier et acheter du matériel du travail. Il pourra ainsi ouvrir un point de vente des produits au cœur de la ville de Tsévié. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires ce qui aura pour conséquence une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To outfit his shop and buy work-related materials.

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.en:
María is recently married, and doesn't have any children yet. She became an orphan at an early age, so she was raised by her grandparents who had a mill and so, María learned how to work with it. Three years ago, she was left in charge of the business because her grandparents were elderly and now, the mill is their only source of income. After her marriage, María still had to continue to work the mill because her husband's income was insufficient, and she would like to have a better economic situation. María is already thinking about having her own family and how she would like to give them a good quality of life, just as she would have liked to have when she was a child.

This is why María needs a $475 loan, to keep the mill in shape since it is an old tool in danger of extinction, and she needs to keep it running until she can afford to purchase another one. She will repay the loan within 6 to 12 months and is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

María esta casada pero no tiene bebes aún ya que recientemente se ha casado. María quedo huérfana a muy temprana edad, entonces fue criada por sus abuelos, quienes tenían un negocio de molino y aprendió a trabajarlo y hace tres años atrás ella se quedo a cargo del negocio por que sus abuelos ya estaban muy mayores y por que era su única fuente de ingresos. Luego de su matrimonio tuvo que continuar con el molino debido a que el ingreso de su esposo es muy poco y quiere poder mejorar su situación económica, pensando ya en el futuro cuando tenga familia y poder darles el sustento que ella hubiera querido siendo niña.

Por ello María esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para darle mantenimiento a su molino, ya que es un instrumento en extinción por ser muy antiguo y tiene que mantenerse para que más adelante pueda adquirir otro mientras mejora su negocio, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y les agradece su apoyo.

loans.use: Mantenimiento del molino

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.en:
”Thanks to God and to a lot of years of hard work I have my own house. I’m in the need to build an additional bedroom because my children are growing, and this type of social housing is quite small”. I’m requesting a loan of $1000 for the construction of a bedroom for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo mi casa gracias a dios y a muchos años de trabajo, pero debido a que mis hijos están creciendo me veo en la necesidad de construir un cuarto más; ya que las casas de interés social son muy reducidas” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construction of an additional bedroom for my house

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Business Description

Reina sells clothing and shoes, both from her home and as a traveling salesperson. She has been self employed for 25 years. She services her customers seven days a week, from 7 AM to 6 PM, leaving her home early in the morning to travel to adjacent areas.

Loan Use

Reina is requesting this loan to purchase additional clothing and shoes, as these are the basis of her business. Having additional inventory will allow her to provide more choices to her clients, which will translate into more income. She needs to increase her inventory in order to meet an increased demand for her goods, a reflection of her hard work.

Personal Information
