Our friend Reina is 55 years old and currently lives with her brother and sister-in-law, who support her in her business endeavors and have agreed to let her live with them. Reina states that her hard work has paid off because she's among family. She helps with home expenses as best she can. Her hope is to be able to increase her inventory to better serve her clients and, as a result, increase her income. This, in turn, will allow her to help her brother replace their home's dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Reina se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, conjuntos, pantalones y todo tipo de vestimentas que le ofrece a sus clientes, tanto en su domicilio como fuera de la ciudad. Reina tiene 25 años de experiencia trabajando independientemente. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, saliendo desde temprano de su domicilio y recorriendo los lugares aledaños a la ciudad.

Uso del Préstamo

Reina solicita el crédito para la compra de más ropa y vestimentas que es la base fundamental de su negocio, para así ofrecerles a sus clientes variedades de modelos de ropa y zapatos, de tal modo que pueda generar más ingresos. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener. Reina necesita incrementar su negocio para poder cumplir con su los pedidos de sus clientes. Los mismos que ha obtenido con el diario esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Información Personal

Nuestra amiga Reina tiene 55 años de edad, en la actualidad vive con familiares, su hermano y cuñada quienes la apoyan con su negocio y están de acuerdo en que ella viva con ellos. Reina indica que su esfuerzo es recompensado ya que en ellos tiene una familia. Reina ayuda en el mantenimiento del hogar en lo que pueda. Los anhelos de Reina es comprar mas mercadería para ofrecerles a sus clientes, así se sientan bien atendidos y conformes con los productos que nuestra cliente les ofrece incrementar sus ingresos. De esta manera podrá también ayudar a su hermano en la construcción del piso , porque es de tierra.

loans.use: Reina will buy additional clothing items for resale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia M. Salazar is single and just 22 years old. She is a member of the loan group “Asociación 8 de Septiembre” in Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto. She sews skirts, which is a long family tradition, and it was her mother who taught her how to sew. Sonia buys fabrics, embroiders, and sews according to the requests of buyers. She studies Social Work in the Public University of El Alto. She lives with her mother and 7 other people, which makes life difficult for her. She needs capital to buy more raw materials, with the objective of improving her sales. In this way she can generate income to cover her education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia M. Salazar, soltera y con apenas 22 años de edad, es socia de la Asociación 8 de Septiembre de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella se dedica a la confección de polleras, una tradición familiar que viene de mucho tiempo atrás, fue precisamente su madre quien le enseño el arte de la confección. Sonia compra telas, borda, confecciona y vende a requerimiento o pedido. Actualmente Sonia estudia en la Universidad Pública de El Alto, en la carrera de trabajo social, vive en casa de su madre junto a 7 personas más, lo que hace difícil la vida para ella. Precisa de capital para incrementar su materia prima, con el fin de mejorar su venta y de esta manera generar ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de estudio.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for sewing skirts, which generates the income she needs to pay her education expenses

loans.name: Ngu Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus is a hard-working father of five children who has faced a lot of challenges in his family including the death of his first son, joblessness and poverty.

This challenged him to start the business of welding, poultry and rabbit rearing. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), he plans to continue in the same line of business and use the profit to pay school fees for his children and buy them food.

He plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and rabbits and pay workshop rent

loans.name: Moinh

texts.en: Mrs. Moinh T., age 22, is a housewife.  Her husband is employed at company and also works as a motor-taxi driver, earning about $5 each day in revenue.  They have two children who are too young to attend school yet.  She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a plot of land to grow crops to feed her family.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Ashura's Stereo Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 40 years old. She is married and has five children, ages 21, 18, 16, 15, and 11. She owns a cosmetics shop, which she opened in 1983. Her shop is open from 10am to 4pm daily.

Ashura hopes to receive a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in tailoring, beauty salon services, as well as soft drink and food sales.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is a small business owner from Bogorodchany, a small town in western Ukraine. She has a business selling women’s clothing, shoes and purses. Her business currently has two locations, a little store in the central part of Bogorodchany and a second sales location she recently opened nearby. This is Lesya’s sixth year of operation. Her business continues to do well and provides a large part of her family’s income. Lesya is married and has two sons.

Lesya has requested a loan of $200 to help purchase a new supply of inventory. She’d like to buy a selection of women’s pants and shirts to retail. Financial assistance that Lesya has received in the past has had a huge impact on her business. We are happy for another opportunity to help her operate a successful enterprise.

loans.use: To increase inventory of women’s pants and shirts

loans.name: Joha's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Joha is a 35 year old married woman with three children, ages 15, 10 and 7. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 63 and 50. Joha owns a small shop, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Leah, who sells cloth.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Hadhe Clarice

texts.es:
Mrs Hadhe is a member of the Carmen Cabrejos Community Bank, located at Carmen Jr. Cabrejos No. 656, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for approximately $110, Hadhe started a business recharging fire extinguishers. At present, in addition to recharging them, she sells fire extinguishers.

Hadhe gets up at 7 am every morning to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. She then spends the rest of the day, until 8 pm, running her business. With this loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, Hadhe is planning to buy 10 fire extinguishers and 10 bags of powder extinguishers to sell to her retail customers.

Hadhe is very happy and very proud of the fact that single-mindedly she went ahead with her plans to look after her family and she is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hadhe pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Carmen Cabrejos No 656, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos. Hadhe. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de recarga de extintores. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta y recarga de extintores, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 extintores y 10 sacos de polvo para extintores. Hadhe esta muy contenta, por que esta convencida que salió adelante por convicción propia viendo las necesidades de su familia ahora esta orgullosa de ella misma y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 fire extinguishers and 10 bags of powder extinguishers for retail sales

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is a distiller of a local drink. He is married and has 4 children. Business is doing very well, and he wishes to increase production and sales.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink

loans.name: Folo Lomago's Group

texts.en:
Siufaga is one of the most populated villages of Savaii Island. This group from Siufaga was formed at the beginning of April 2008 and is now one of the largest groups in the programme. These ladies work to support their families and their organization. They all work independently, most at fishing and plantation farming; some members are helped by their husbands (fishermen and farmers).

The group earns $140 tala (US $58) profit every week after all expenses, enabling them to quickly pay on their first loan and they are looking forward to their next loan for renovating their houses and paying their children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural and fishing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Rosa started her business when her husband passed away in order to keep active and not depend economically on her daughters, the youngest of whom was still in school. She began selling cosmetics about 5 years ago. Thanks to her efforts, she has gained regular clients, which has enabled her and her daughter to get ahead.

She needs a loan of US$350, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise. With your help, Rose will continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Rosa inició el negocio cuando fallecio su esposo ante la necesidad de mantenerse activa y no depender económicamente de sus hijas ya que la menor de ellas aun estaba estudiando. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 5 años ella se dedico a vender cosmeticos, gracias a su esfuerzo fue haciendo clientes frecuentes lo que le ha permitido salir adelante a ella y su hija.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia.Con tu apoyo Rosa seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tetteh

texts.en: Tetteh D. sells is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car.  He is married, but his wife's income as a trader is not sufficient for Robert and his 6 children. Demand for his service is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira inicio el negocio por la falta de dinero y que no le ayudaba el papa de sus hijos con la manutención de los pequeños. En aquel entonces su necesidad principal era la salud de su hija menor por que tenia pegado el labio con la encía y se necesita una operación, aunado que tenia que darles de comer a sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la casa. Entonces ella encontró en la venta de zapatos una fuente de ingresos que le permitía generar ganancias y no descuidar a sus hijos. A través del tiempo a adquirido muchos clientes y ha crecido su negocio, no solo separa en los mercados con su carro para vender, sino también en su casa vende y ha acondicionado un cuarto para negocio. Ahora sus hijos están mas tranquilos por que no les falta casi nada y esta juntando para la operación de su hija,

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar estantes para exhibir sus productos y más mercancía. Con tu apoyo Elvira saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Elvira started her business for lack of money and because she was not receiving financial support for her children from their father. At that time, her priority was the health of her youngest daughter, who had a deformity and needed an operation, even though she needed to feed her children and pay household expenses, too.

Elvira discovered a source of income in shoe sales, which allowed her to make financial gains without neglecting her children. With time, she has acquired many clients and has grown her business. She not only drives to the market to sell her products, but she has outfitted a room in her house to sell from home. Now, her children are more calm because they lack almost nothing that they need and are facing her daughter's operation together.

Elvira needs a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase shelves to display her products and to buy more merchandise; she will repay the loan in six months. With your help, Elvira can achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shelves and merchandise.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru A. is 38 years old. He is married and has two adorable children. 

Nuru has been breeding cattle since 2004. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. He is quite experienced in choosing the animals, and he knows how to breed them and look after them.  He gets up every morning at 5 A.M. to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable income for his large family. 

Nuru is planning to add to his livestock by purchasing one cow and two calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD. Nuru thanks you for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is married with a child. Esther is 38 years old and she sells clothes, shoes, and bags. Esther has her shop open 7am to 7 pm daily. She travels to Cotonou to buy her goods--a journey of about 3 hours from Lagos State.

Esther is a LAPO client. Esther attends to her customers politely and this has drawn more customers to her shop. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to buy more clothes, bags, and shoes to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags, and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sr. Auxiliadora tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio tierra prometida, madre soltera con dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad  ambos están estudiando.  Trabaja como dependienta de una distribuidora y comercializa ropa usada,  por cuenta propia desde hace cinco años tiene el negocio de ropa usada. Sus planes para la familia es brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor, construir su casa. Sus planes en vista de negocio es incrementar las ventas de ropa con nuevos productos y abrir su propia variedad en cual pueda obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is 37 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of the Tierra Prometida. She is a single mother with two children: a 14-year-old and a 13-year-old, both of whom are studying. She works as a saleswoman for a distribution company and markets used clothing. She is self-employed and has been selling used clothing for five years. Her plans for her family are to offer her children a better future and to build a house. Her plans in regards to her business are to increase clothing sales with new products and to open her own store in which she will be able to bring in more income.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal C. lives in Odam Raiy village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Him Seng Hat, sell cassavas and fish in the local village. They need a motorbike to transport their products. Thus, Mrs. Sophal C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike. The motorbike will reduce the amount of money they have to spend on transportation. Mrs. Sophal C. is 35 years old and the mother of a three-year-old child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hillary

texts.fr: Hillary U. est un jeune homme qui tient depuis 3 ans à Lomé, un magasin de pièces détachées. Agé de 34 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfats. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients et aussi accroître la taille de son activité, Hillary désire avec ce crédit alimenter son magasin par de nouveaux produits.
texts.en:
Hillary is a young man who has had a store selling spare parts for three years in Lomé. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of two. In order to meet the needs of his customers better and also to expand his business, Hillary would like to use this loan to supply his store with new products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Daima

texts.en:
Daima has owned a small shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years. She is a member of Jiinue group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business from 12am to 10pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Daima is married, and has two children: ages 12 and 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon T., 28, sells fish in the local market in Siem Reap province. She is married and has four children who are still living at home. Her husband works as a farmer. She typically makes about USD $5 each day, and would like a loan to expand her husband’s cultivation. In order to increase profits, she is asking for a loan of  USD $1000 to purchase land and fertilizer. (Her husband is pictured at their home)

loans.use: To purchase land and fertilizer

loans.name: Lubajja Traders (B) Group

texts.en:
Abdul is the father to 18 children, all from the same wife! He and his wife support these children with a fish-mongering business, a poultry business (mainly run by his wife) and a small farm. Abdul has been in the fish-mongering and farming businesses since he was a teenager.

Although he knows how to grow other products, these days Abdul primarily grows coffee, beans, maize and matoke (green fruits that look like bananas). He usually works the land alone, but occasionally he employs people to help him during planting or harvesting. Since his oldest child is now 40, his children are his day-to-day source of help in running his businesses.

Abdul is requesting a loan of 500,000 USH to make a large purchase of fish for resale. Someday, Abdul would like to open a retail shop where he could sell his fish, products from his farm, and other retail items.

loans.use: Purchasing a large stock of fish for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is 58 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks and rechargeable phone cards. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch S. lives in a medium-sized wooden house located in Kompong Tom Province, in Cambodia. Here he uses a plot of land to grow a rice crop. Beside this, he raises pigs in a stall next to his house as well as holding a job as a local carpenter. His wife is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals, cares for the children and helps him in the business as well. The family have four children: two are married and the other two are single and are employed at different jobs.

The rice farming season is coming and the family is lacking capital to grow rice this season. Therefore, Mr. S. would like a loan to pay for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the farmland

loans.name: Наргиса

texts.en: Худойкулова Наргиса – молодая девушка ей 22 лет. Образование у нее  средне – специальное. Наргиса занимается переработкой пряжи и продажей шерстяных вещей. Наргис по специальности швея. На полученный займ она хочет купит пряжу. Свой товар она реализует на рынках Ошоба и Аппон торговать, ей помогает мать. Наргис имеет достаточный опыт работы в этой сфере. После окончания  средней школы она начала занимается, переработкой пряжи так это приносит не плохой доход.

loans.use: производство и пряжа насков

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
S. Nguyễn Thị (1014060440) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 4 adult children.  To make a living, S. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  S. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2001, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  S. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saydith

texts.es:
La señora Saydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, y tiene 02 hijas gemelitas pequeñas que aun dependen de ella y son el motivo y razón de su gran esfuerzo.

Saydith, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su pequeño negocio de venta de algunos abarrotes, bebidas y hielos, ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes que son principalmente sus amigos y vecinos, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando algunos abarrotes como: Javas de huevos, paquetes de papel higiénico y golosinas como galletas, caramelos y chicles. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, para así satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Saydith, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas, como también a otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente y contar con sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Saydith belongs to "Banco Comunal "Mujeres para el Futuro II", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martín, Department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, has 2 small twin daughters who depend on her and are the cause and reason for her great effort.

Saydith is an efficient lady who, when having the necessity to generate her own income, decided to start a small business selling some groceries, beverages, and ice. The business is located in her house. She started little by little and now she has improved and has a variety of products for her clients, who are mainly her friends and neighbors so they find what they need. At the moment she is continuing with the same business and she tells us that she is doing very well.

With the loan of S/1,000.00 she will invest in buying some groceries such as eggs, packets of toilet paper, and sweets such as cookies, candies, and chewing gum. Part of the money will be invested in buying different brands, flavors, and sizes of soft drinks to satisfy and offer better service to her clients. Saydith feels very satisfied with what she has accomplished. She is grateful to Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for having helped her establish her business and reach her goals and dreams as well as other women who wish to grow businesswise and count on their own income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries and beverages

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
K. Phạm Thị (1123060683) is a 30 year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 1 school-aged child. To making a living, K. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. K. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (about $141 US) a month from these activities.

In 2003, K. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. K. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. K. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 5th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Vecinas está conformado por  Yuritza Rebeca R. R., Pabla Lorenza R. M. y Ángela del Carmen G. Ríos. Todas ellas habitan  en la comarca de Cofradía que es una zona rural que se encuentras entre Tipitapa y Nindirí.

La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Yuritza Rebeca R. R. que a sus veintiún años comparte las labores de ser madre, estudiante y dueña de un negocio. Esta joven tiene cinco años de trabajar en el negocio de la ferretería todo comenzó cuando su padre empezó a trabajar fuera de la comarca y ella se quedo administrando el negocio.

Actualmente tiene una ferretería muy prospera, surtida  y no tiene competencia ya que es la única en la comarca. Su meta principal es terminar sus estudios universitaR. y ampliar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Pabla Lorenza R. M. de 38 años de edad quien tiene quince años vendiendo ropa, cosméticos y prendas de oro. Ella tiene tres hijos menores de edad que están estudiando. Mientras la señora Ángela del Carmen G. Ríos  de 36 años de edad tiene cinco años vendiendo ropa  para así poder sustentar a sus dos pequeños hijos.

Este grupo de  ya  han tenido un préstamo con adim con los cuales lograron incrementar su materia prima y sus clientes. En la actualidad ellos necesitan de ingresos para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
The group “The Neighbors” is comprised of Yuritza Rebeca R. R., Pabla Lorenza R. M. y Ángela del Carmen G. Ríos. They all live in the Cofradía region, a rural zone between Tipitapa and Nindirí. The coordinator of the group is Yuritza Rebeca R. R., who at 21 years old, shares her work with her mother, is a student and owner of a business. This young woman has been working in hardware for 5 years, beginning when her father started to work outside the region and she was left in charge of the business. Today she has a stocked and very prosperous hardware business as it is the only one in the region. Her primary goal is to finish her university studies and expand her business. The other members of the group are 38 year old Pabla Lorenza R. M. who has been selling clothing, cosmetics, and gold jewelry for 15 years. She has three small children in school. Mrs. Ángela del Carmen G. Ríos is 36 years old and has been selling clothing for 5 years in order to support her two small children. This group has had a loan with ADIM with which they were able to increase their raw materials and customers. Today they need funding to acquire a greater quantity of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of construction materials such as nails, screws, sandpaper and other supplies

loans.name: Slayman

texts.en:
S. is a 39 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. S. has been working as a taxi driver for eleven years. S. requested a loan of 2200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and purchase new car seats. This is his third cycle and he has always on time. 
S. is special in his work because he knows how to treat his client and has a clean car. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and used to work as a driver. S. decided on doing his business because he didn’t want to work for someone, he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a school van.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car and purchase new car seats.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells foodstuffs like tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc. she is 38 years old and married without a child. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex Kimani, a 37-year-old father of one child, is married to Lily Njeri, who is a house wife. The family lives in Kongowea, Mombasa. For eight years Alex has run a leather work shop in Kongowea, a location that has enabled him gain many customers due to the busy Kongowea market.

He learned of KADET during a marketing exercise and he is now accessing his first loan, which he plans to invest by purchasing shoe-making materials, thus diversifying his business. His future hopes are to expand his business and become a major supplier of shoes and leather materials.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing shoe-making tools.

loans.name: Marcia Francisca

texts.es: Marcia Francisca C. R. tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tiene 53 años de edad. Marcia tiene 2 hijos, y todos estudian por el mayor sacrificio que realiza Doña Marcia. Su negocio se dio porque ella decide vender refrescos por lo que tuvo bastante influencia de clientes, y le genero ciertas ganancias y decide invertir un poco más en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como golosinas, jugos, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jabón entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lobilina

texts.en:
Lobilina is a 39 year old businesswoman. She is married to Manny, a fisherman in their village. Lobilina is grateful that, through her husband’s business, they are able to have free viands sometimes. She hopes that they’ll continue helping each other to achieve what they aspire for their children. The couple are blessed with two children, Christian and Dian, both of whom are still studying. They live peacefully in the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. 

Lobilina makes a living through her fruit and vegetable vending business. She has been in her retail business for three years; from selling, she generates an income of PHP 3,000 per month. She hopes that her business will further grow so that she can meet the needs of her family, especially her children. She wishes to borrow PHP 4,000, with which she will add some items to the store in order to earn more income.

loans.use: purchasing new items to sell

loans.name: Dorscilah

texts.en:
Dorscilah has a food kiosk in which she sells foodstuffs and tea and other drinks. She is 33 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 17. She has been in business for 15 years and says her kiosk is sustainable. She is now requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to expand her business by adding inventory of cereals.

Thanks to Faulu's teachings, Dorscilah says she has become a visionary lady. She also describes herself as hardworking and hopes to grow her business to comfortably provide for her family, herself and her business.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia E. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 49 years old. Herminia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP average a month for these activities.

In 2008, Herminia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield and fertilizers like manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Herminia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield and fertilizers like manure

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jane R. is from the village of Ramona, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 28 years old. Mary Jane is the leader of a four member group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Jane is single. To make a living, she owns a business in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP for every crop she harvests.

In 2007, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa C. is 38 years old and lives with her father and two children in the Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger." Her son and daughter, ages 17 and 15, both attend a local secondary school and help their mother in their spare time. Her father has cancer and lives with them as he is receiving treatment. 

Ariunaa manages a clothing trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She sells a wide variety of men's and women's clothing to her many customers. Ariunaa started her business in 2006 and has built a stable operation over the last three years. She has a loyal customer base who like the stylish clothes she sells. 

Ariunaa is focused on the future and hopes to further expand her product line in the near future. She also plans to begin teaching at a local secondary school to supplement her income. "If I get a teaching job, I will hire (a) salesperson to handle the day-to-day operations of my clothing business," she said.

Ariunaa is a hardworking and open-minded businesswoman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to import clothing from China to sell in her business.

loans.use: To import clothing from China

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is from the village of District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old, married, and has six adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a restaurant where she serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $220 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as working capital. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es: Flor Del Carmen C. G. de 50 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo de 68 años de edad. Flor posee una tienda en la cual se venden productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad, así mismo posee una tortillería, negocio en el cual vende tortillas todos los días, razón por la cual obtiene ganancias diarias. Debido a que su esposo es jubilado, tanto Flor como él dependen en gran manera de estos negocios, y es así como se dividen el trabajo, mientras flor hace las tortillas, su esposo está atendiendo la tienda, de esta manera trabajan en conjunto, animándose uno con el otro a seguir adelante y a esforzarse para poder contar con una vejez digna y tranquila en la que no les haga falta nada. Es por esto que Flor solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos, así mismo comprar maíz al mayoreo para obtenerlos a menores precios, lo cual generará mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Flor Del Carmen C. G. is 50 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, Department of La Libertad with her husband, who is 68 years old. Flor has a store in which she sells food and basic needs products. She also has a tortilla shop in which she sells tortillas every day, allowing her to make a daily profit. Since her husband is retired, he and Flor rely heavily on these businesses. And this is how they divide the work: while Flor makes the tortillas, her husband minds the store. They work together, in this way, encouraging each other to carry on and to put forth the necessary effort to ensure a proud and tranquil old age that lacks nothing. For this reason, Flor is requesting a loan. Through the loan she will be able to purchase larger quantities of perishable goods and wholesale corn at lower prices, which will give her a larger profit.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Loreta's Group

texts.en:
Loreta A. is 57 years old and from the village of Casalatan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Loreta is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and vegetables in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2006, Loreta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mylyn's Group

texts.en:
Mylyn C. is from the village of Singson. She is 28 years old. Mylyn is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mylyn C.'s group.

Mylyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mylyn owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mylyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mylyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 29 años, ella cree que en la vida sólo se sale adelante con valentía y coraje, por eso trabaja arduamente junto a su esposo, Jacinto de 39 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Esta familia vive en su acogedora casa propia.   

Desde hace 9 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a cultivar café, maíz y plátano, y para ahorrar en el transporte, las épocas de cosecha contratan operarios por mes y se van a radicar a la chacra donde ella prepara los alimentos muy temprano y ayuda a su pareja en sus labores agrícolas para avanzar con rapidez.
A Dina le gusta disfrutar de la tranquilidad del campo, sin embargo le parece difícil trasladar sus productos hasta los mercados de abastos o los acopiadores, pues recorre un camino distante y peligroso.
Aunque este oficio le parece sacrificado, es muy rentable porque gracias a las utilidades que obtiene puede brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es por ello que para el futuro piensa cultivar café en mayor cantidad para incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y asegura que pagando puntualmente cada cuota se demostró a ella misma que con perseverancia todo se puede. Así también le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, donde aprendió a sociabilizar con otras personas que no conocía, por eso se muestra contenta al sentir que tiene una grande y hermosa familia. 

Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita comprará dos sacos de abono, dos mil quinientas plantas de café de la variedad “Catemur”, muy solicitada por producir granos grandes y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old and believes that one only gets ahead in life with valiance and courage. This is why she works arduously alongside her husband, Jacinto, who is 39 years old. They have three children and this family has a home of their own. She’s been raising coffee, corn, and bananas for the past nine years. To save on transportation, they hire monthly operatives during the harvest season, and they travel to the farmland where she prepares the food very early in the morning and then helps her husband with the farm work in order to finish quickly. Dina likes the tranquility of the countryside, but she finds it difficult to transport her goods to the marketplaces, suppliers, and storehouses. The trip is long and dangerous. Even though it’s a sacrifice, it’s very profitable because, thanks to her skills, she is able to give a good life to her children. This is the reason that she is planning to increase her coffee production, so that she can increase her income. This will be her second loan through MFP and she guarantees that she will make each payment on time and prove that everything is possible with perseverance. She likes working with a communal bank, where she learned to socialize with other people whom she didn’t know before, and she is happy to have this large and beautiful family. She will use the money from this loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) to buy sacs of fertilizer and 2,500 coffee plants, of the “Catemur” variety. This variety is very sought after because it produces large and better quality beans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 42 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Vive en la ceja de la selva ayacuchana, en la  localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Desde hace 10 años tiene un disco centro donde vende CD’s para todo público, anteriormente tenía una botica. Aunque nunca se imaginó que su actual negocio lo llevaría a ver tan buenas ganancias por la venta de sus artículos. Es por ello, que quincenalmente compra nuevos CD’s en grandes cantidades y de toda las variedades, pues con ello logra captar a sus clientes de manera rápida y oportuna. Actualmente tiene dos locales en puntos estratégicos de su localidad y cuenta con una persona que se hace cargo de uno de ellos.
En el futuro piensa ampliar su cartera de clientes incursionando en la venta de ropa y artefactos electrodomésticos, para que así pueda satisfacer la amplia demanda de sus clientes.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y agradece los beneficios que le otorgan, es por ello que cumplirá con sus cuotas establecidas; también agradece la confianza de su banco comunal y el buen manejo que llevan entre todos los integrantes.

Con el dinero que solicita comprará más CD’s clásicos y contemporáneos, según los gustos y preferencias de sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Juan is 42-years old, married and has three children. He lives at the edge of the Ayacuchana jungle, in the area of Quimbiri, where he lives in his own house. For ten years now, he has had a music store where he sells CD’s for all audiences; before, he had a pharmacy shop. He never imagined that his current business would bring such good profits for selling his products. For this reason, every two weeks, he buys new CD’s in large quantities and in a varied assortment to attract his customers quickly and at the right moment. He currently has two locations strategically located in the area, and has an employee that tends one of the stores. In the future, he plans to increase his customer portfolio by expanding into the sales of clothes and home appliances to meet the wide demand of his customers. This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the benefits provided; for this reason, he is committed to fulfill the established payments; he is also grateful for the trust from his community bank and the good management by all its members. With the money from the loan, he will buy more classic and contemporary CD’s for the varied tastes and preferences of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Kyogaya Women's Group Of Jinja

texts.en:
N. Betty has been operating her tailoring and bar business in Wakalenge, Jinja, for the last twenty-five years. Her good customer care attributes have been her stock in trade over these years. The 42-year-old happily married mother of six is gleeful at the success she has registered, despite her earlier reservations.

Before venturing into her current business, Betty was employed by a high-profile textile factory. It is from here that she learnt her seamstress skills. She points out that the education of her children is a milestone she always cherished to achieve. In this time of running her own business she has minimally broken the back of that dream.

With this loan Betty wants to buy more drinks for her bar and also buy sewing machines.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines and drinks for her bar business

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es: La Sra. Guillerma  nacio en Laibato provincia Campero de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el 10 de enero de 1973, ella esta casada y tienen 1 hijo que le ayuda en la siembra de sus productos, toda la familia se dedica a la agricultura, y se apoyan entre ellos. Hace 15 años que la señora compro su parcela en Rural 2 de Mayo, son 4 hectareas  La  señora actualmente esta sembrando papa, poroto, y tambien tiene  muchos productos que ella cosecha y lo vende en el mercado central de el torno. Con el dinero del Credito comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa ya que es su temporada de siembra,  La cliente esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo que le brindaron en la otorgacion del credito, son personas trabajadoras con ganas de salir adelante desean mejorar la condicion de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermina was born in Laibato, Campero province of the city of Cochabamba, on 10 January 1973. She is married and has a son that helps her with her farm chores; the entire family is in farming and help each other out. Fifteen years ago she bought a 4 hectare lot in Rural 2 de Mayo; she farms potato, poroto (kidney beans) plus a lot of other products that she grows and sells in El Torno’s central market. She will use the funds to buy potato seed because the potato planting season is beginning. She is grateful to the institution for the help it provided in granting the loan. They are hard-working people with much desire to get ahead in life and improve the living conditions of their whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seed.

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a wife of H. B. and is a resident of Multan, which is famous for its sweetmeats. She owns a small, two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years.
A very talented lady, Maqsoodan operates a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from different cities, such as Lahore and Faisalabad, and sells them to clothes shops. Now she receives orders from her neighbors as well and earns a good profit from them. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
Maqsoodan's husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has five years of experience and now his shop is renowned among his customers. He earns approximately 15,000 PKR from his grocery shop, which is a big support to his family. Maqsoodan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s grocery shop so he can purchase groceries in bulk and increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He and his siblings work to help support the family. He has been working in the agriculture industry for the past 15 years. In 2000, he started working on his own by purchasing a tractor to plow the lands in his area. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase an additional part for the tractor which would ease his work.

loans.use: To purchase an additional part for a tractor

loans.name: Pavlina

texts.en:
Pavlina is a widow with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov. Pavlina sells sweets, noodles, dried fruit, cheese and meat in one of the local marketplaces in her hometown called “Bilotserkivets." She owns two vending kiosks and basically works without any days off. Pavlina started this grocery sales business five years ago. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory.  

Pavlina is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase the merchandise she offers for sale at the marketplace. She is hoping to increase her income as a result. Pavlina has been a widow for 16 years. She has endured many hardships and struggles. She works very hard to give her children a better life. Pavlina is planning to use a portion of the generated income to pay for her daughter’s college fee.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar lives in Lahore, which is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. She has given birth to two children. Her daughter is studying and her son is an electrician. Her husband is involved in the business of renting bikes. He lets out motor bikes on rent for specific periods of time to earn money. Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new motor bike to expand his business. Shamim herself operates a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from the famous markets of Lahore, named “Ichara” and “Anarkali”, and sells them to members of her community on good profit. 

Shamim hopes that a new motor bike will be a good addition to her husband’s business and it will increase his income to a good extent.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for 'rent a bike' business.

loans.name: Wanyange Tusubiira Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
For three and a half years, 41 year old Harriet W. has operated her charcoal business in Wanyange-Jinja.  This business combined with her commercial motorcycle business has been providing all the financial ways and means on which she and her family have been surviving. Being that she is widowed, living only by her wits was unacceptable. Harriet originally started work in a trade reserved for men and that is timber cutting. 

Today, this mother of four school aged children earns 50,000 shillings a week with her business. With proceeds from this loan, she says she wants to purchase more bags of charcoal that she will later resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of charcoal for resell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José C. V. es un señor de  58 años de edad, que vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.
Don José se ha  dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura,  pero la cría de cerdo  para engorde ha sido uno de sus principales actividades en la cual ya tiene 10 años de experiencia. El y dos socios más están construyendo la porqueriza más  grande de la comunidad.

Por ahora Don José  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢615 000 (seiscientos quince  mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condicione s de cuido e Infraestructura de su porqueriza. Con este préstamo espera alcanzar su meta de tener 150 cerdos para engorde y aprovechar el buen precio que tiene el producto en este momento, para así aumentar las ventas y  mejorar sus condiciones económicas. 

Don José es socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Sexto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
José C. V. is a 58 year-old man who lives with his wife and son in the Costa Rican community General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón. Their community is known for its location in the General's Valley. The area's principal economic activities are livestock, agriculture, and commerce, with the latter having grown significantly and offering new opportunities for work. José has worked in agriculture his whole life, but he has ten years of experience raising and fattening pigs, which has been one of his principal economic activities. He and two partners are in the process of building the largest pig pen in their community. For now, José would like a microloan of ¢615,000 to buy more pigs and improve the care conditions and infrastructure of his pig pen. With this loan, he hopes to reach his goal of having 150 pigs to fatten and take advantage of the current market's high prices for pork, which will allow him to increase sales and improve his living conditions. José is a member of the Association of General Valley Producers, one of the hundred partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his sixth loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pigs and repairing pig pen

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
doña Teresa de Jesus M. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica  a la venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar tambien vende cosmeticos, gracias a este negocio a podido crecer y educar a sus hijos, los cuales   toda via los tiene estudiando. 
doña Teresa se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a vender su producto en zonas foraneas.
Su tiempo libre lo dedica a su familia y a la cria de cerdos.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mas utilidades.
texts.en:
Ms Teresa de Jesus M. is a working woman who sells cleaning products for the home as well as cosmetics. Thanks to her business she has been able to raise and educate her children-all of whom are still studying. Ms Teresa gets up at 5 in the morning to go out and sell her products in distant areas. She spends her free time with her family, and another business for her is to raise pigs. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and thus have more opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for the home and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Ma. Angélica V. L.  adquirió una vivienda de interés social y desea poner protecciones para que este mejor protegida y dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Para poder realizar su proyecto ella necesita comprar material y que se le instalen. Su esposo y ella trabajan para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
María Angélica V. L. got a publicly subsidized house and she wants to put up security so that her house is better protected and provide more security for her family. In order to be able to complete this project, she needs to purchase material and for them to install it for her. She and her husband work to cover the costs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add security to her house

loans.name: El Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Quesillo está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes han sido beneficiadas tanto por los préstamo y como por las capacitaciones lo cual según comentan han aplicado para sacar adelante sus negocios. Una de ellas es Rosa Carolina L., coordinadora del grupo, comerciante de ropa desde hace siete años. El negocio lo inicio por medio de un préstamo el cual por su esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y desarrollándose.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Gladys María V. desde hace siete años tiene una tortillería y Anielka Azucena P. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio en el 2004.
texts.en:
The El Quesillo group is made up of three hard-working women who have greatly benefited from their loans and training, and as they discussed they have applied for a loan to get their businesses ahead. One of these women is Rosa Carolina Lopez, the group coordinator. She has been a clothing merchant for seven years. She started her business with a loan, and with her hard work it has been growing and developing. The other group members are Gladys Maria V., who has had a tortilla store for seven years, and Anielka Azucena Pavon, who has a small grocery store which she opened in 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Cecelia Nyame Na

texts.en: Cecelia Nyame Na O. Q. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.  Cecelia sells rice and beans at Elmina. Her husband is a farmer.  Cecelia uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Cecelia will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecelia plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more rice and beans for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a member of Quotet group in Faulu Kenya. She sells handbags for a living. She also does hair dressing for extra income. Currently, she doesn’t have a permanent business premise for hair dressing but she hopes to open a salon in the future. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access capital. She has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more handbags.

loans.use: To buy more handbags.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Habitat, Brgy. Cantil-e, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Food Vending businesses. Her husband Eugenio P., who is 35 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 8 to 16 years old. 

Marivic joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marivic has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store  so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Marivic P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 35 years old, married and the father of eight, aged between 3months and 21 years, with five attending school. He has been a mixed farmer for more than fifteen years.  He sells maize, tea leaves, tomatoes, vegetables at the local market.

He has requested this  loan of Kshs. 55,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow which will earn him income to pay school fees and provide milk for consumption for the family.  In five years he aspires to have expanded his dairy farming to the extent of having 30 litres of milk per day. 

The challenge he is facing is transport to the market. He appreciates Juhudi for supporting him financially and requests more training.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, labor

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 40 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 12 to 19. She is determined to increase the profitability of her business, a small boutique where she sells shoes, soaps and cosmetics. She has been running her business for four years, and works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Marie Claire has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying more products to sell to her customers. She believes this loan will allow her to meet that goal by attracting new customers and meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more products to sell

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: El sr. Marcial vive en la zona de pacata baja vive en el domicilio de sus papas se dedica a la pintura desde muy joven el trabajo como ayudante hoy en día es maestro y contratista en decorado de interiores y exteriores es su principal fuente de ingreso  el es soltero necesita el crédito para para aumentar su capital para realizar trabajos de obra vendida y compra de andamio en nuevo en la institución y con el crédito kiva el cliente se fue muy  satisfecho, es muy trabajador y responsable en un futuro desea casarte y tener su familia, pero ahora trabaja para ahorrar y así poder dedicarse a contratar personal para el pintado de casas.
texts.en:
Marcial lives in his parents' home in Pacata Baja.  He is a painter.  He started in this business at a very young age as an assistant.  He is now an expert painter and contractor who provides interior and exterior decorating services.  This is his main source of income.

Marcial needs this loan to increase his capital so that he can do his work and buy new scaffolding.  Marcial is very satisfied with the institution and with his Kiva loan.  He is a very hard-working and responsible man and in the future he would like to get married and start a family.  However, right now he is working to save so that he can start to hire staff to paint houses.

loans.use: To buy scaffolding for painting buildings

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.   

Madina has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Madina   sells her products at the market by means of wholesale as well as retail.   She also generates additional income through a grocery shop.

Madina has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Madina include the rainy season, transportation, and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only, buy a plot of land to build her own house, and educate her children up to university.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old.  She is married and supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. 

Marites has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. 

Marites is borrowing PHP 18000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. 

Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fazri

texts.en:
Fazri is a 40 year old man. He is married to Ruth, a 38 year old lady. From his marriage, Fazri has been blessed with 2 children, namely Gloryanti, 16 years old who is in the 1st grade of senior high school, and Imanuel who is in the 2nd grade of junior high school. Fasri and his family live in Oesao Village.

Fazri generates money by working as a motorcycle mechanic. He started this business using initial capital of IDR 500,000. He bought simple mechanical equipment while he uses his house as a repair shop. By using inadequate tools, Fazri needs more time to repair a motorcycle. Usually, Fazri needs about one week to repair 1 or 2 motorcycles. The income is usually spent on rice, side dishes and other daily needs. 

Fazri wants to set up a repair shop which is more strategic. However, he also needs more mechanical equipment to support him in doing a better job. According to Fazri, adequate equipment is very essential to the progress of his business. Fazri is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to purchase the mechanical equipment. He really hopes that he can improve his business well.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine Wanjiku, 51-year-old single lady who is a pastor, also farms and sells dynafarm products. She has been in the business for a period of six years, earning an income of KES. 12,000 per month.

This will be Josephine's third loan from KADET LTD, having repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the entire loan amount to buy more dynafarm products to sell. Josephine hopes to venture further into farming and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more dynafarm products for sale

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio tiene 56 años está casado con la Sra. Adela, tienen dos hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, viven en casa propia.
Atanacio se dedicaba antes a la compostura de zapatos, hace más de 15 años, es uno de los pioneros de la zona, hoy día cuenta con una despensa desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, la cual es atendida por él y su cónyuge, cuentan con una clientela formada. Atanacio es una persona muy reconocida en la zona por la buena calidad de sus productos.
El necesita el crédito para la compra de mercadería en general como arroz, fideo, azucar, productos lácteos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Atanacio is 56 years old. He is married to Adela and they have two children who are grown and independent. They live in their own home. 

Previously, more than 15 years ago, Atanacio worked making shoes. He was one of the pioneers in the area. Today he has a grocery store, which he has had for approximately 10 years. He and his wife work there, and they have regular customers. Atanacio is well known in his area for the good qualities of his products. He needs the loan to buy general merchandise such as rice, pasta, sugar, and dairy products, among others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (rice, pasta, sugar, and dairy products, among others).

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 48-year-old married woman with 7 children. Her oldest child is 20 years old. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice crops. Rosie does her best to keep the farm productive. She sells her harvest to the market.

Rosie's loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: This is 45 year-old Saidu K..  He is married, and has 4 children ages 2, 7, 9, and 12 years. In 1996, Saidu established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self employed so that he can have a sustainable means of providing livelihood for his family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Saidu requires a loan in order to buy bales of used clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Saidu plans to buy larger quantity of used clothing and supply other traders in used clothing. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothing for his business

loans.name: Makhizar

texts.en:
Makhizar S., age 58, works with her husband and sons, purchasing and reselling sheep. She and her husband have two children. Makhizar would like to request a loan of 700 AZN in order to purchase additional animals to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. 
 
In the future, Makhizar would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase more sheep and increase her income further. She and her husband plan to use the increased income to fund the renovation of their house. 

She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep and fodder

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene un pequeño horno donde se dedica a elaborar pan y queques y también es rentista jubilado. El crédito lo requiere para comprar una maquina amasadora y la cancelación de tramites para el funcionamiento de la misma. Vive en casa propia, la misma esta ubicada en la zona Nuevos Horizontes en la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito es procesada a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Juan has a small oven where he makes bread and cakes.  He is also a retiree with a pension.  He needs a loan to buy a kneading machine and to pay some fees related to his business.  He lives in his own home, which is located in the Nuevos Horizontes neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  He is married and has 2 children.  This is the second time that he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine for his business making breads and cakes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a widowed mother of six children, all of whom are in school, lives in Uganda where she has operated a business selling clothes for the past seven years, working six days a week. Betty, who sells her products in a shop, has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of African attire (bitenge).  Betty’s business challenges includes seasonality, transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and to build her own rental house.

Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more African attire.

loans.name: Lucila Luciana

texts.es:
La Señora Luciana es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad le hace hermosa su gente, su cultura, tradiciones, la belleza de su naturaleza y arquitectura, también es conocida como cuna de grandes deportistas, tiene una variada gastronomía que cautiva a propios y extraños.
 
La Señora. Luciana tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 27, 24, 21, 20, 18, 15 y 6 años de edad, dos de sus hijos son casados e independientes, su segundo y cuarta hija trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su quinta hija estudia en el colegio y también trabaja, su sexta hija estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
