Doña Luciana labora en el taller de su esposo, fabrican artículos de hierro forjado como rejas, cruces y artesanías, llevan en esta actividad 20 años y trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como hierro, sueldas, pintura, etc. para el taller.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luciana is a member of the Renacientes community bank.  She lives in El Vergel sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is made beautiful by its people, its culture, its traditions, and the beauty of its nature and architecture.  It is also known as the birthplace of important sports people.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine which captivates locals and visitors.

Luciana is 45 years old.  She has seven children aged 27, 24, 21, 20, 18, 15 and 6.  Two of her children are married and live independently.  Her second and fourth daughters work and help her financially.  Her fifth daughter is in high school and also works.  Her sixth daughter is in high school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school in the city.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic by profession.  They do not own their own home but rent.

Luciana works in her husband's workshop.  They make products from wrought iron such as bars, crosses and handicrafts.  They have been in this business for 20 years and work from Sunday to Sunday.  They do not work fixed hours.

This is Luciana's second loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying raw materials such as iron, solder, paint, etc. for her workshop.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder, paint, etc.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es: La Sra. Anita  es divorciada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Sagrada Familia” grupo  conformado por 16  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Anita  trabaja desD. hace 5  años en una bodega instalada en su casa se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes es decir leche azúcar, arroz, también venD. dulces, galletas, caramelos, etc.  este trabajo surge a raíz D. su divorcio ya que ella se quedaba sola con sus hijos y tenía que mantenerlos pero su motivación para salir adelante fueron sus hijos es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar  adelante a  su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos es así que, sus hijos van al colegio  y se compro artefactos y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida , con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería (leche, azúcar. Arroz, dulces).Sabemos que Anita cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Ms. Anita is divorced, has three children, and is currently a member of the "Sagrada Familia" ("Holy Family") communal bank, a group comprised of 16 members who work in various types of commerce. Anita has been working for five years in a bodega [small grocery store] installed in her house. She sells groceries like milk, sugar, and rice, as well as sweets, cookies, candies, etc. This work arose from her divorce, as she was left alone with her children and had to support them. Her motivation to keep moving was her children, so she worked very hard to get her family ahead. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has achieved better economic results, which is how her children are able to attend school, how she can buy things, and above all how her family has a better quality of life. She has requested a new loan with the goal of continuing to grow and in order to buy merchandise (milk, sugar, rice, sweets). We know that Anita will meet her goals through a lot of work and effort, and that the loans through Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, milk, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Dominick

texts.en: Dominick is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children between 2 and 10 years old. Dominick has been running an electronic goods sales business for the last 3 years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. Dominick hopes to use his loan to further develop his electronic sales business. He hopes to transform his small business to a wholesaler. He also sees himself owning a plot of land on which he will build a house for his family. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase electronics

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
44-year-old Connie is a married woman with 3 children. Her children are 21, 17 and 13 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Connie is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Connie works hard to make their farm productive. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel for the tractor they use at the farm.

In the future, she hopes for their business to be stable. She also hopes for her children to finish college and be successful in their own fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “El Arbolito”, conformado por 11 integrantes. El nombre que le pusieron al grupo representa el crecimiento paulatino que ellas desarrollan en el grupo; así como una planta que crece hasta convertirse en un árbol.
Carmen es casada y tiene tres hijos, dos ya son adultos e independientes. Ella se dedica hace 8 años a la compra y venta de artículos usados, negocio que le genera muy buena rentabilidad, tanto así que ha conseguido armar su casa y ampliarla adecuadamente para su familia. Antes, Carmen buscaba trabajos eventuales como servicio de limpieza o lavando ropa, pero su esposo le hizo ver que podían trabajar juntos y generar más ingresos. Así es como Carmen decide meterse de lleno a este negocio y a la vez reforzar los lazos de pareja con su esposo.
Dentro de sus metas más próximas, está el adquirir una “Mototaxi” (Motocicleta adaptada para brindar servicio de movilidad con pasajeros) para ponerlo a trabajar; también quiere ampliar su negocio a fin de tener un almacén donde guardar sus excedentes de mercadería.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is president of the Community Bank "El Arbolito" ("The Sapling"), which consists of 11 members.  The name they gave to the group represents the gradual growth with which they are developing in the group, as well as a plant that grows into a tree.

Carmen is married and has three children, two of whom are grown and financially independent.  She has spent 8 years buying and selling used items, a business that generates good profitability for her, and through which she has managed to build a home, and expand it and for her family.  Beforehand, Carmen looked for odd jobs cleaning or washing clothes, but her husband saw that they could work together and generate more income. This is how Carmen decided to get herself into this business while strengthening her relationship with her ​​husband.

Among her immediate goals is to acquire a "Mototaxi" (a motorcycle adapted to provide transport service for passengers) to put to work.  She also wants to expand her business and have a warehouse to store her surplus merchandise.

loans.use: to acquire a "Mototaxi" (a motorcycle adapted to provide transport service for passengers)

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and has two children, one of whom works.

Ahmad has owned a women's clothing shop since 2000. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy a generator, a split air conditioner and an aluminum counter with a chair. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a generator, a split air conditioner and an aluminum counter with a chair.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 48 years old and has been a tricycle operator for seven years. He was married and blessed with three children, but unfortunately was unable to make it last (they were separated). Now, he is earning to support himself through operating his tricycle every day. He usually earns about PHP 400 daily which he uses to buy food for himself.

He is requesting a loan amount of PHP6,000 to buy new tires and paint for his tricycle. He wants to provide better transport customer service in order to increase the number of his customers, as it will boost his daily income. He hopes to improve his living as he pursues working.

loans.use: to buy new tires and paint for his tricycle

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 50 years old and has been in the business of buying and selling of corn and rice for 20 years. It has served as his way to uplift their poor living conditions. Despite of his age, he pursues his business to achieve success in terms of money. 

He states, "Money by this generation is very powerful. You can buy all earthly things if you have a lot of money. But I am scraping a lot of effort just to earn a better profit. Hopefully, our Creator will help me in achieving my dream so I can also extend my help to the needy person as Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc. doing”. 

With the loan amount of PHP 5,000 this will be a big factor to improve more of his business. He will be going to buy a new weighing scale as an instrument used for purchasing and selling his products.

loans.use: to buy a new weighing scale as an instrument used for purchasing and selling his products.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El señor Cirilo es origen de la comunidad de Thoqo Rancho Alto de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba  actualmente casado con 6 hijos a cargo de ellos.
Prácticamente la actividad económica a que se dedica del señor Cirilo es la agricultura, la producción de tubérculos y cereales en su comunidad de Thoqo Rancho Alto, que está ubicado de a seis kilómetros al norte aproximadamente de la localidad de Tiraque.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono organico y semillas, el objetivo del cliente es incrementar su producción agrícola al año siguiente, y así de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Cirilo is from the community of Thoqo Rancho Alto in the province of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba.  Currently he is married and they are responsible for six children.

Practically, the economic activity he's involved in is agriculture, the production of tubers and cereals in his community of Thoqo Rancho Alto, which is located approximately six kilometers north of Tiraque.

The loan he is requesting is to buy agricultural supplies, such as organic fertilizer and seeds.  His objective is to increase his crops next year, and so improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Lucia Milerna

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Lucia, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y  dos de 16 y 10  años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. Está en el Banco Comunal  8 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios que le brinda la institución.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que realiza el crédito para ayudar su marido con los gastos que representa mantener un hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas y pollos de granja pero además de esto el crédito también lo utiliza para los cultivos del cual se encarga su marido, él tiene sembríos de  melón, sandia y ciertas verduras como habas, frejoles entre otras cosas. Trabajan todos los días ya que ella además de cuidar  su hogar y a sus animalitos también le ayuda de vez en cuando en el campo a su marido.  Cuando sus productos están de cosecha los comerciantes llegan hasta sus sembríos  y llevan los productos que compran a entregar al mayoreo.
P>
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes, comida y medicinas para los pollos e insumos  agrícolas.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro” meets every 15 days in the September 30th neighborhood of the canton of Rocafuerte (Portoviejo). This place is known for its delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and known throughout the entire country.

Sra. Lucia lives in this place. She is 48 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. One child is an adult and the other two, ages 16 and 10, are attending school. Her husband is a farmer. Lucia has been with the Communal Bank for eight loan cycles and enjoys the benefits that the organization has provided.

Lucia is a determined woman who is obtaining this loan so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She raises native chickens but she will also use this loan for her husband’s crops. He grows melons, watermelons, and certain vegetables such as different types of beans and other products. They work every day. In addition to taking care of the house and her animals, Lucia also helps her husband in the fields. When their products are ready to be harvested, the merchants will come to buy their crops so that they can be delivered to the wholesale market.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers, farming supplies, feed, and medicines for the chickens. Lucia’s dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, farming supplies, poultry feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 51 years old and married. She has four children. To generate an income, she sells fruits and vegetables. She buys at the public market and then sells to the people in her village. She offers the produce house-to-house because she doesn't have a stall in the market.

Monica is now asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy tomatoes, cabbages and eggplant to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and boost her profits. In the future, she wants to keep making better sales for the improvement of their lives.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 32 years old and is married to a businessman. She adopted one child who is currently in school. She sells shoes and handbags in a store she has been running for 10 years. 

Epiphanie would like a loan to increase her inventory. The profits will be used to pay school fees for her child and to create savings for her future. She would like to see her business prosper in the future

loans.use: To buy more shoes and handbags for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Organizadas” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la comunidad D. Yrybucua D. la ciudad D. Santaní.  Todas las integrantes del comité tienen actividades independientes, pero también trabajan en grupo para poder fortalecer su compañerismo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. trabajar conjuntamente en cualquier actividad. 
Una D. ellas es la señora Yenny. Ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa, la cual está muy bien surtida y equipada, tiene gran variedad D. productos y nos dice que gracias a todo esto es muy conocida en su barrio. 
Gracias a su despensa ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y también cubrir los gastos extras D. la casa. Dentro D. sus proyectos está seguir creciendo y en miras a esto solicita el crédito para la compra D. fideos, azúcar, leche, panificados, verduras y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee "Organized Women" was formed by some neighbors in the community of Yrybucua in the city of Santaní. All the members of the committee have their own businesses but they also work as a group to strengthen their fellowship. The members form a very united and capable group and work together on whatever activity. 
One of them is Yenny. She tells us that she has a store that is very well-stocked and equipped. She has a good variety of products and she tells us that, thanks to this, her store is well know in the neighborhood.
Thanks to her store, she has been able to move her family forward in life and also to cover the extra household expenses. Her projects incluD. continuing to grow her business and, in view of this, she is requesting a loan to buy noodles, sugar, milk, baked goods, vegetables, and other products with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, milk, baked goods, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 50 years old and lives in Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. Josephine has a shop that sells shampoo, canned goods, soap, toothpaste etc. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products such as shampoo, canned goods, soap, toothpaste, etc. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Josephine hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as shampoo, canned goods, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Anabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 22 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos  5, 3 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio realiza el crédito, el vende productos de temporada ya que son los que más se venden, él tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual realiza sus ventas, llevan más de 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar manteles, focos y adornos navideños. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con estos  créditos ella ayuda a su esposo para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Carmen here.  She’s 22 years old, in a common law relationship and has three children who are 5, 3 and 2 years old; the oldest attends Kindergarten.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who is taking out this loan to help with her husband’s business.  He sells seasonal items which are what sells the best.  He has a stand downtown where he carries out his sales.  He’s been in business for more than six years and he does very well.

She will use this loan to buy tablecloths, light bulbs and Christmas decorations.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because the loans help her husband get ahead.  Her dream is that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, light bulbs and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 11, all of whom go to school. 

Scovia runs a food store, and she has been in the business for two years. She has no employees. Scovia heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and through outreach and promotion undertaken by the loan officers. She is requesting a loan of SDG 2500 to purchase more items like sweet potatoes, fresh maize, brooms, and others. Other than this business, Scovia has no other sources of income.

In five years' time, Scovia would like to expand her business and have a good store. Her major challenge is competition in the market from similar food stores, which contributes to her low income.

Scovia says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially its assistance to women, by providing capital to start up small-scale businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба целеустремленная и добросовестная женщина. Она заботливая жена и любящая мать двух несовершеннолетних детей. Он имеет свой бизнес по продаже женской одежды. Она торгует на местном рынке города и имеет трехлетний опыт. Насиба хотела бы получить займ для расширения бизнеса и покупки зимней одежды. Она надеется на вашу доброту и великодушие.
texts.en: Nasiba is a conscientious woman focused on her goals. She is a caring wife and a loving mother of two young children. Nasiba runs her own business selling women's clothing at the local city market. She has been doing this for three years. Nasiba would like to obtain a loan in order to expand her business and stock up on winter clothing. She is hoping for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for her store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 63 years old and is a widow with four adult children. She lives in San Antonio, Siquijor, Siquijor. For the past five years, Milagros has run a sari-sari (variety) store and she earns an average income of PHP 200 daily. She has been an active member of PMPC since 2010.

Milagros is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery stocks for the business. She has borrowed previously from PMPC and hopes to generate more income to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchaes additonal grocery stocks

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose Antonio habitante de Com. Mira Valle trabaja en conjunto con su mama y un hermado en su unidad de produccion, en la que realiza actividades pecuarias, manejo de su pequeño inventario ganadero y tambien actividades agricolas establecimiento de cultivos de granos basicos, tuberculos, actividades que se convierten en su principal fuente de ingreso para el bienestar de su familia, necesita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de vaquillas lo cual le permitira incrementar su inventario y mejor sus fuentes de ingreso a mediano plazo, con la realizacion de esta actividad pretende mejorara sus niveles de vida, cuenta con buenas referencias en su localidad, por ser una persona progresiva y de buenas costumbres.

loans.use: Compra de vaquillas

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 47 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, no logro estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a realizar los quehaceres de la casa y también a veces trabaja como empleada doméstica, no tienen hijos y en su casa solo vive con su pareja y su hermano.

Juan, trabaja en la agricultura, siempre ha cultiva sus propios alimentos como maíz, frijol y otros granos básicos, además ayuda a otros agricultores con estas actividades; sus padres desde pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y también se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos. 

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, porque disponen de un terreno que podría servirles para mantener sus animales y de esa manera tener una mayor posibilidad para obtener otros ingresos y además aprovechar los desperdicios de cultivos para alimentar el ganado.

Juan, sueña con reparar algunos daños de su vivienda y hacerla más segura.

loans.use: para comprar una vaca.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.en:
Mrs. Akoua B. was born on March 3, 1977 in Badou. She is married and has three children. Not having had the chance to continue her secondary education, she engaged in trading small household items. Unfortunately, her husband, a taxi driver, no longer has a car, and his irregular income does not allow him to meet the needs of the household. Thus, more than 80% of the household expenses rest on his wife, who also needs to finance the growth of her business. As a result, misery has settled on this household where, paradoxically, there also reigns a good marital atmosphere. Very courageous and dynamic, she benefitted from a loan of $150 which allowed her to restart her business. Despite this state of extreme poverty, Akou knew how to manage and repay her loan promptly without incident. This increases her credibility and her good faith. Shee deserves to be supported financially once more.

Mrs. Akoua B. is asking today for a loan of $750 to rent a small shop and to develop her business of selling basic consumption goods. Financing this woman means saving the lives of an entire family in distress.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme B. Akoua est née le 03 mars 1977 à Badou. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études Vsecondaires, elle s’est très lancée dans le petit commerce de table. Malheureusement, son mari, un chauffeur de télé taxi, n’a plus de voiture et son revenu irrégulier ne permet pas de subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Ainsi, plus de 80% des charges du ménage reposent-t-elles alors sur la femme qui dispose aussi de peu de moyens financiers pour faire développer son commerce. Ainsi, s’installe la misère dans ce foyer où paradoxalement y règne une bonne ambiance de vie de couple. Très courageuse et dynamique, elle bénéficia un crédit de $150 qui lui a permis de relancer ses activités. Malgré cet état d’extrême pauvreté, Akoua a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement son crédit sans incident. Ce qui augmente sa crédibilité et sa bonne foi. Elle mérite confiance pour être encore soutenue financièrement.

Mme B. Akoua sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $750 pour loyer une petite boutique et développer ses activités de vente des produits de première nécessité. Financer cette femme, c’est sauver la vie de toute une famille en détresse.

loans.use: To rent a store to sell basic consumption goods

loans.name: Aspiah

texts.en: A. is 25 years old and married with one child aged 2. She sells household goods such as rice, cooking oil, and cigarettes. Becoming a member of MBK has been really helpful for her; otherwise, she would have closed her shop. Her husband, Tatang, sells firewood in the market. He can only earn a maximum of $2 per day. She very much needs to get a $50 loan to increase her sales. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Selling household goods

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 34 years old, she is married and is the mother of four sons, who are 16, 12, 10, and 1 years old. Her husband works as a sales person at a business, however, his salary is not enough to cover all the needs of the family. In order to have some extra income, Dorotea decided to begin her own business selling tamales. She really enjoys cooking, and thanks to the high quality of her products, she has attracted many customers who put in orders for banquets and special events.

In order to fill all the orders she has from her customers, Dorotea needs a loan of $375.00. She will use it to buy ingredients to expand her production and to provide good service to her customers. She will pay back the loan over a period of 4 to 8 months. The well being of this family is in your hands. Have no more doubts, decide to help Dorotea.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Dorotea tiene 34 años, es casada y madre de cuatro varones, de 16, 12, 10 y un pequeño de 1 año de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como agente de ventas en una empresa, sin embargo, su salario es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia y para obtener un ingreso extra Dorotea decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo tamales, a ella le gusta mucho la cocina y gracias la buena calidad de los productos que prepara ha logrado tener muchos clientes que le solicitan pedidos para banquetes y eventos especiales.

Para surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, Dorotea necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción y dar un buen servicio a su clientela, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Dorotea.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. C., 41, opened her small tienda (Spanish for a little store) four years ago with her first loan from the Kiva MFI partner, Friendship Bridge. She sells juices, water, crackers, and sodas from her wooden stall at the gate of the local hospital in Nebaj. With this new loan she will buy products to stock her store. Before she got her first loan and opened up the tienda, she used to sell chuchitos (a type of tamale wrapped in banana leaves) on the street.

Juana is married and has five children ranging in age from nine months to eighteen years. All the children are physically healthy and the two school-age boys attend school. When they are not in school, they work with other members of the family in their corn fields. Although Juana never learned to read or write, she speaks both Spanish and her native tongue Ixil.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase stock for the store.

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en: Hamidu is married with eight children.  As a blacksmith he has to work hard to buy food and other essentials for his family.  He makes hoes, cutlasses, and buckets, and sells them to the local farmers.  Hamidu also employs two workers to assist him with the production of tools and pays them on a daily basis.  With his previous loan, he was able to buy some scraps and tools.  For him to develop his business further, he needs more tools and materials that can be obtained locally.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $250

loans.use: To obtain more materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Elitza

texts.en: Elitza N. lives in the village of Medkovetz. She works in a dairy farm in the village, but she wants to buy a cow for herself so that she can start a cow breeding business. She is not married and she lives with her parents. She is requesting $750.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Mrs. Tes S., age 49, is a widow who makes her living by selling porridge to the people in her area, earning around $5 each day in revenue.  She has five children that she must support, one who is unemployed and four who are students.  She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her unemployed son to operate a motor-taxi business, which will enable him to earn about $5 per day and contribute to maintaining the family and paying for his siblings’ education.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Gudret

texts.en:
Gudret G. is married and has two children. He owns and operates a hardware store in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi.

He has been running this store for the last 10 years. He is currently looking for funding of $1,200 so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Tereza Del Rosario

texts.es:
Tereza S. is a married woman with a son in her charge. She has is known for being a hardworker with a strong desire to have a stable small business to support her family that are in such need.

It has been 10 years since Tereza S. has been running her small grocery store selling various products in the region of El Sauce in Leon. Her sales have been increasing significantly in the past years, since she expanded the business and improved the outlay, and she did so for the simple reason that it is the only income her family earns.

Tereza S. has been working with Ceprodel for two years and she feels very grateful for the loans that have been granted to her in a timely manner, helping her acquire the goods needed for her business and to satisfy the daily demand of her clientele. In her record she has had 5 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Tereza S. es una dama casada y con un hijo a su cargo, se caracteriza por ser emprendedora y con muchos deseos de tener un negocio propio estable para poder apoyar a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

Desde hace diez años Tereza S. se dedica a la venta de productos varios (pulpería) en el municipio El Sauce en León. Sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo por la sencilla razón de que este es el único ingreso de su familia.

Tereza S. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de cinco créditos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shallot K.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her capital stock. Shallot is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 5 children ranging from ages 9 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Shallot makes approximately UGX 49000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Shallot has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy new clothes and the loan was paid back on time.

Shallot is joined in her small group by Florence N. and Jenifer K.. Florence N. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Jenifer K. is currently operating a retail shop business and sewing business and wants a loan to add more stock and also purchase a bicycle.

loans.use: To add working capital to clothing business

loans.name: Victoire Pétria

texts.fr:
Madame Victoire Petrina K. was born on December 21, 1965 in Notse, a town located 100 kilometers from Lome. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She works selling locks of hair (hair extensions) and wigs in her neighborhood and in the Adidogomé market. Ever since her husband passed away, she has been the sole care taker of her two children. Her first loan was for 100,000 FCFA, which she used to improve her purchasing power from her suppliers. Her third loan was for 300,000 FCFA which helped her to purchase a carton of hair extensions and a carton of wigs.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame K. Victoire Pétrina est née le 21 décembre 1965 à Notsè, ville située à 100 Km de Lomé. Elle est veuve avec deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de mèches et de perruques dans le quartier et dans le marché d’Adidogomé. Depuis que son mari est décédé, elle assure seule la charge de ses deux enfants. Les premier et deuxième crédits de 100.000 FCFA qu’elle a obtenus lui ont permis de renforcer son pouvoir d’achat vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs. Le troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter un carton de mèche et un carton de perruques

loans.use: To purchase locks of hair and wigs

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
Mr. William A. lives in the Campo Bruce neighborhood. He is a 49-year-old married father of 4 children ages 3, 4, 10, and 12.

Mr. A. sells CD’s, DVD’s, clothing, and footwear. He now has 5 years of experience. He started selling in the inland region of the country. At first, he did not sell much, but after a while, he was able to gain customers.

He started this business with loans. He will invest this loan in purchasing more products, widening his selection, and increasing his sales. He would like to develop his business, open up a line of credit, and help his children get ahead and obtain good job opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. William habita en el barrio Campo Bruce, es casado y tiene 49 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de 3, 4,10 y 12 años.

La venta del Sr. William es CD Y DVD, ropa, zapatos y tiene cinco años de experiencia, el inició con ventas en los departamento del interior del país, al principio no vendía mucho pero despues de algun tiempo logró tener clientela.

Este negocio lo empezó con prestamos, con este préstamo va a invertir en capital de trabajo para comprar inventario, ampliar sus ofertas y vender mas. Desea crecer y hacer una línea de crédito, sacar adelante a sus hijos y que obtengan buenas oportunidades de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of CD’s and DVD’s

loans.name: Fatimakhon

texts.en:
Fatimakhon K. is 32 years old. She is married and the loving mother of six children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

For more than 12 years, Fatimakhon has been selling vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, and garlic. Her eldest son helps Fatimakhon with the business. Every day, in the early morning, she buys fresh vegetables wholesale from the local farmers and sells them in the market. She is known in the market for her attractive prices, and she has her own regular customer. This allows Fatimakhon’s business to generate a stable abd considerable income for her family

Fatimakhon and her husband love all of their children and are doing their best to ensure them of the best future and to make them well-educated. Her business is now making progress, because it is the season of fresh vegetables.

For this purpose, she requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for 10 months to increase the range of goods she sells. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables that she sells

loans.name: Nicolaza Carolina

texts.es:
Nicolasa is a woman whom, due to the hard economic situation has had to search for various activities that could allower her to earn money for her family. He lives in the annex of Villa Libertad. Her husband is a photographer and they have five children, 4 of whom are dependent on their parents.

Nicolasa dedicates herself to the sale of tortillas and cell phone cards as well as managing a photography studio in which her husband is the photographer. She has 22 years of experience in business, during which she has acquired much knowledge of how to move forward her photography studio.

The loan is necessary in order to purchase contruction materials and build a home in order to improve her living conditions and at the same time provide better attention to her customers. Her plans are to continue to support her children in their studies in order to enable them to be useful contributors to society.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolasa es una mujer que debido a la dura situación económica ha tenido que buscar varias actividades que puedan traerles ingresos a su familia. Habita en el anexo de Villa Libertad, su esposo es fotógrafo y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son aún dependientes de la pareja. Nicolasa se dedica a la venta de tortilla, venta de tarjetas celulares y también administra un estudio fotográfico en el cuál el marido es el fotógrafo. Tiene 22 años de experiencia en sus negocios en los cuales ha adquirido mucho conocimiento de como sacar adelante su estudio fotográfico. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer una habitación para así mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y al mismo tiempo poder darle una mejor atención a sus clientes. Sus planes son seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta convertirlos en personas útiles a la sociedad.

loans.use: Building a home

loans.name: Mirtha, Teofila Y Wilma Group

texts.es:
Mirtha, Teofila and Wilma are members of the Good Luck Community Bank.

Mirtha is 47 years old, married and has two children. She is a sales representative for cooking utensils and surgical supplies, and also sells natural products on credit to friends and relatives. She also runs a convenience store out of her home.

Teofila is 55 years old and single. She sells woven craftwork like tapestries and blankets that she orders from artisans. She purchases the materials like wool and delivers them to the artisans, who then make her orders. She makes her sales at the city markets of Ayacucho, and she also takes her products to Lima.

Wilma is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She sells cosmetics via catalogue to friends, relatives and workers at different offices. She also sells clothing, which she brings in from Lima. The large proportion of her sales is on credit.

Mirtha, Teofila and Wilma are requesting loans of 900 soles ($310) apiece, which they will use to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, sugar, oil, needles, wool, children's clothing and towels.

These three women dream of having their own capital, expanding their businesses and providing better lives for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma son socias del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Mirtha es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Mirtha es representante de ventas de utensilios de cocina en material quirúrgico, también vende productos naturales que vende al crédito a amigos, familiares. Además Mirtha tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Teofila es soltera y tiene 55 años, Teofila vende artesanía en telar como tapices, frazadas, que manda elaborar con artesanos, Teofila compra los materiales como lanas y lo entrega a los artesanos que elaborar sus pedidos, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también lo lleva a la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Wilma es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Wilma vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares y trabajadores de distintas instituciones, también vende ropa que trae de la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas en gran proporción son al crédito.

Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, hilos, lanas, ropa para niños y toallas.

Los sueños de Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma son tener capital propio, ampliar sus negocios y brindarle todo lo mejor de sus hijos.

loans.use: Mirtha, Teofila and Wilma are requesting loans of 900 soles ($310) apiece, which they will use to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, sugar, oil, needles, wool, children's clothing and towels / Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, hilos, lanas, ropa para niños y toallas.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is 24 years old. She is a wife and the mother of one kid who is now schooling. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been selling yams for the past seven years to support her family. Yams are one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets.

Abena takes delivery from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to better serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kid in school. Abena is a member of a community group called Dorcas Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more yams directly from the farmers

loans.name: Bunavsha.

texts.ru: Пиракова  Бунавша живет в городе Нурек. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ей 33 года и уже 4 года она занимается торговлей. Арендует магазин . Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение новых прилавков.Сделав, небольшой ремонт Бунавша создаст для клиентов хорошие условия и тем самым сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Это даст возможность получить дополнительную прибыль. Погасит кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bunavsha P. lives in the city of Hyrek. She is married and has 2 children. She is 33 years old and for 4 years she has been involved with trade. She rents a store and trades groceries. She wants to receive a loan and use it to obtain new booths. This accomplished, she plans to have some small renovations and this will improve the quality of the store to her clients, and attract new client. This will allow for more revenue, she plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new booths

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is separated with two children; she lives in Musang, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. With this loan she plans to purchase supplies for her shop "Mami Coco". She will purchase country cocoyams, macabu cocoyams, spices, potatoes, yellow yams, palm oil, groundnut oil, and maggi sauce. She plans to contribute 50,000 CFA ($100 USD) of her own savings towards this business plan.

This is Anna's fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004.  She now has a good market site that brings in many customers. She purchases her goods from suppliers she has found over the years who provide her with the best prices. She also ventures into the rural "bush" areas to get some of her supplies. She now has many regular customers that trust her and her pricing.

With the profit from this loan, Anna plans to buy a plot of land and build herself a home.  She will also continue to educate her children. She hopes that her loan and others will bring development to her area and community. The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, potatoes, palm oil, groundnut oil, yellow yams, and maggi sauce

loans.name: Cidlia

texts.es:
La señora Cidlia es socia del BC “CORAZON DE JESUS” y vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de de útiles de oficina, adornos y pasamanería, complementa su negocio con la venta de cosméticos de la marca Esita. Su negocio está ubicado en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará   productos en oferta como colonias, talcos, desodorantes, esmaltes, cremas, cuadernos, gomas, cintas maskintape y otros útiles que necesita para surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Cidlia tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes y quienes la ayudan a atender el negocio. Su meta es surtir más su negocio y contar con su propio local.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cidlia is a member of the Corazon de Jesus (Heart of Jesus) Village Bank in the city of Dorado in San Jose de Sisa, San Martin, Peru. She sells office supplies, decorations, and braids and tassels for drapes and upholstery. She complements her business by selling Esita brand cosmetics. Her business is located on one of the central city streets. With this $325 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy products that are on sale like colognes, powders, deodorant, nail polish, creams, notebooks, erasers, masking tape, and other supplies which she needs to stock her business and have what's necessary to satisfy the demands of her customers. Cidlia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Her children are still in school but help her to attend to clients at their business. Her goal is to better stock her business and eventually have her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cologne, powders, deodorant, nail polish, creams, notebooks, erasers, tape, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Zareena Nasir Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Zareena Bibi and I reside in a city named Vehari, Pakistan.  I own a two-room brick house in this city where I and my family have lived for the last 30 years. 

My husband name is N. H., and he has a quilt selling business.  He has been selling quilts for the past 8 years.  

I have three kids: one daughter and two sons.  My elder son works with his father and sells quilts in other cities.  Both of them buy the quilts from a famous city, Multan.  My younger son is 16 years old and my daughter is 5 years old.  I perform my duties as a mother and as a wife as well.  

Along with these responsibilities I perform my duty as a woman also.  I believe in myself.  I make the warm quilts with my hands and hand them over to my son.  In cities, people have the tendency to buy handmade items.  I made three quilts in a month.  My effort returned to my family in the shape of good income. 

My family is very happy with me, which makes me more confident.  I am applying for a loan to buy warm quilts along with materials (cotton and thread) for making quilts. 

I am a group leader of a few more members in my locality.  Zahida Baji and Ameena Baji each want a loan to buy quilts to resell.  Shahla Shahzadi Baji wants a loan to buy calling cards to resell. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making warm quilts

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal "Naciones Unidas" esta conformado por 15 socios los mismos que se encuentran en su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos, los socios se encuentran representados por la señora Eva. La mayoría D. los socios se dedican a actividades como atención D. tienda D. abarrotes y pulpería, venta y elaboración D. prendas deportivas, orfebrería y artesanía D. joyas, atención D. kiosco D. dulces y refrescos,  venta D. ropa para niños, venta D. embutidos, atención D. bazar librería, bordados computarizados. todas residen en la misma zona, todas las socias se conocen hace mucho tiempo y tienen la confianza D. trabajar en este tipo D. agrupaciones. El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. capital, compra D. equipos y herramientas para su diferentes rubros, y a la compra D. materia prima e insumos para la producción.
texts.en:
The "United Nations" communal bank is maD. up of 15 members who are in their fourth loan, having demonstrated responsibility and fulfilled their payments. The members are represented by Eva. Most of the members have activities such as taking care of grocery or convenience stores, sale and manufacture of sports clothing, jewelry making, candy or soft drink stands, sale of children´s clothing, sale of cold cuts, stationery store, or machine embroidery. All of them live in the same area, have known each other for a long time and trust working in this type of group. The loan will be used to increase their working capital, buy equipment and tools for their different lines of work, or buy raw materials or supplies for production.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chakiratou-Laï

texts.fr:
A.  Chakiratou-Laï est née le 07/08/1982 à Porto-Novo la capitale politique du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous mineurs. Elle gère officiellement une cabine téléphonique dans laquelle des cartes de recharge de tous les reseaux du Bénin sont mises en vente. Elle commercialise également des tissus et des colliers. Elle va généralement s'approvisionner à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Sa clientèle est constituée par les habitants de son environnement. Pour mieux les satisfaire, elle sollicite un prêt d'un montant pour réhausser le niveau de son activité. Lequel crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner considérablement pour pouvoir faire face à sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s'accoître. Son lieu de vente est situé au quartier Midombo juste à proximité de la clôture de l'Ecole Primaire Publique.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Chakiratou-Laï A. was born on August 7, 1982 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, who are all minors. She officially manages a telephone booth, where rechargeable phone cards of all the networks in Benin are offered for sale. She also markets fabrics and necklaces. Her goods are acquired generally in Tokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. Customers are composed of people living in her area. To satisfy them better, she is requesting a loan for boosting her level of business. This loan will enable her to acquire considerable supplies in order to address her ever-growing customer base. Her sales outlet is located in the Midombo district, very close to the fence line of the public elementary school.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone card for any network

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a clothes seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She is part of the Ilolo group loan (group code 2003). Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Yusta is 30 years old, married, and has six children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun M., 40, lives in a rural area of Pursat Province. She is a widowed mother who has four children; three of them are single and go to school, while the other one is married and lives separately. She currently sells Khmer noodle to her neighbors in the village. She frequently sells the noodles in the early morning, from 7 a.m. to 11 a.m.

As another income source, M. also raises pigs in a small stall next to her house. She is applying for a loan to buy five piglets to raise, and to upgrade her pigpen.

loans.use: To buy five piglets to raise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. sells bunches of plantains while her husband works as a commercial driver. She is 52 years old with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more bunches of plantains to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantains to sell

loans.name: Onyebuchi

texts.en:
Buchi has a chemist shop where he sells medicines. He has the only chemist shop in his community. The demands for his medicines are high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.

Buchi hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Buchi is 27 years old and single. He is an active LAPO client. He says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Geremias

texts.en:
Geremias, 43, is now a widower. Geremias and his children currently live in San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. His eldest child is Marrisdine, 15, then Kein Paul, 11, and Geremias A. Jr., 7. All his children are studying and he hopes to support them in their studies through college.

Geremias has operated a tricycle transport business for four years. He would like to obtain a loan so that he has enough capital to pay for maintenance of his passenger tricycle. He is requesting to a loan of PHP 4,000. He hopes that his request will be granted because his transportation business is very helpful for his family. This is the only source of income and he hopes it will be successful. He knows God will always be there to support him so he always includes his family and their success in his prayers.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is a 45-year-old petty trader. She is married with four children. She lives with her husband and the children at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Suhum for two years now. With income from her business, Elizabeth pays school fees for all her kids in junior and senior high school. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business.

Elizabeth has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kid’s complete schooling. She belongs to the village bank ‘Nkunimde’ which means victory.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia G. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Letecia is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Saviour Group

texts.en:
Akosua is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She is a petty trader. She sells utensils, rubber and plastic products. Akosua is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Saviour’. She is the one standing in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: María Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 38 años de edad, está casada hace 12 años con Isabelino que tiene 57 años de edad. Ambos tienen  un solo hijo que actualmente tiene 10 años y aún va a la escuela.
Matilde posee una boutique que funciona en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad de Itá mientras que su esposo es arquitecto de profesión. 
El negocio de Matilde funciona desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, pero anteriormente ya se dedicaba a la venta de todo tipo de prendas de vestir pero en forma ambulante. 
Actualmente su negocio le genera muy buenas ganancias debido a que cuenta con una clientela bien formada que está constituida principalmente por docentes y asalariados de la zona que le compran a través de las diversas asociaciones que funcionan en la ciudad. 
Cuenta con una gran variedad de prendas de vestir de todo tipo, de muy buena marca y calidad por lo que sus productos son muy bien aceptados por su clientela. 
Gracias al esfuerzo y al trabajo, tanto de ella como de su esposo, han logrado hacerse de todas las comodidades para un buen vivir, poseen casa y vehículos propios además de poder darle la oportunidad a su hijo de llevar un buen nivel de vida. 
En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías tales como: jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones, etc. con el fin de surtir aún más su negocio.
texts.en:
Matilde is 38 years old and has been married for 12 years to Isabelino who is 57. They have a ten-year-old son who is in school. Matilde owns a centrally-located boutique in the city of Itá and her husband is an architect. Matilde has operated her business for about 5 years, but previously she sold all types of clothing but as a traveling salesperson. Her business currently generates a good profit because she has a well-established clientele made up largely of educators and employees in her region who buy from her through various organizations in the city. Matilde offers a variety clothing, of well-known brands and high quality, and this is why her products are very popular with her customers. Thanks to her effort and hard work, as well as that of her husband, they have made a comfortable life. They own their home and vehicles, and are able to provide a good standard of living for their son. They request this loan to purchase additional merchandise such as jeans, shirts, tee shirts, trousers, etc. to be able to provide a greater assortment of clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jeans, shirts, tee shirts, pants to expand inventory.

loans.name: Tope

texts.en: Tope is 38 years old and married with three children. She is a hardworking woman and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She has fish farm and also sells fresh fish and has been in business for the past eight years. Tope’s focus is to expand her business and she is doing all she can to pull her family to a higher level financially.Tope is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase fingerling to sell and thereby meet customer’s needs. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase fingerling (baby fish)

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Vidalina es casada, tiene 71 años y 12 hijos, Vidalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, helados, también tiene teléfonos públicos. Además Vidalina y su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta D. madera.
Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, gas.
Los sueños D. Vidalina son comprar un carro y terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vidalina is a member of the Inti Community Bank. Vidalina is 71 years old, married, and has 12 children. She runs a store out of her house where she sells general groceries, produce, meat, ice cream, and she also has public telephones. In addition, Vidalina and her husband buy and sell lumber. Vidalina is requesting a loan of 1,800 soles ($625) to invest in buying rice, sugar, pasta, and gas. Vidalina's dreams are to buy a car and to finish the construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, and gas for her store

loans.name: Sobhiye

texts.en:
Sobhiye is a 31-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a mini-market since 2008 in her town where she services the neighboring villages.

Today, Sobhiye is requesting to borrow $1200 to purchase additional merchandise in order to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo C. Cáceres tiene la edad de 47 años. Don Reynaldo tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, los que ofrece en su vivienda, el trabaja con ciertas herramientas rusticas, por lo que siempre recibe ayuda de sus hijos.  El dio inicio a este negocio por que no tenía suficientes ingresos para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario.    El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de materiales, madera y herramientas. Su deseo es mantener su negocio activo su negocio ya que actualmente es muy difícil.
texts.en:
Reynaldo C. C. is 47 years old. Mr. Reynaldo has 3 children and they all study. His economic activity involves offering his carpentry services. He has dedicated more than 20 years to this business, which he offers from his house. He works with certain rustic tools and he always receives help from his children. He started this business because he did not have sufficient income to provide the necessities for his family. With this loan he intends to buy materials, wood and tools. He wants to maintain the activity level of his business, which currently is very difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials, wood and tools

loans.name: Akumu

texts.en:
Akumu J. is currently in the business of selling potatoes, like sweet and Irish potatoes, that have been imported from Uganda. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell.  Akumu is 46 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has five children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a rental house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Carmen” esta representado por la señora Erika y conformada por 13 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta D. tarjetas para celulares, atención en fotocopiadora, elaboración y venta D. pan D. Arroz, venta D. ropa y zapatos, venta D. leña y atención en salón D. belleza.  En cuanto a la competencia es alto en su ámbito D. trabajo, por lo que las socias ven la necesidad D. mayor capital para poder competir en el mercado esta es una D. las razones por las que desean el finaciamiento para poder adquirir mayor mercadería, insumos y herramientas para poder crecer y llegar a su segunda razón que es su familia y el bien estar D. la misma. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los integrantes del grupo ya tenían experiencia en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, pero están agradecidos por el gran apoyo económico y la confianza otorgada por nuestra institución ya que D. ello depenD. el futuro D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “El Carmen” is represented by Erika and maD. up of 13 members who carry out different activities such as selling cosmetics by catalogue, mobile phone cards, photocopying, making and selling rice bread, selling clothes, shoes and firewood and assisting customers in a beauty salon. The competition is very high in their field of work, which is why the group´s members acknowledge the necessity to increase their working capital so they can compete in the market. This is one of the reasons why they are applying for a loan so that they can purchase more merchandise, supplies and tools to increase their business, the other being to contribute to the wellbeing of their family. The group already have experience taking out loans in other similar institutions to Fundación Agrocapital. They are grateful for the great economic support and trust which has been granted to them by this institution, as the future of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya de l’association  Benkadi Wolemekin sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 27 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers pour aider leur mari. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de fruits et légumes et  bien d’autres articles divers. Les articles divers sont achetés à Bamako, les fruits et légumes sont achetés sur place et dans les villages environnants et sont revendus sur place à Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles comptent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group, part of the Benkadi Wolemekin association, are married women. Their average age is 27, and they have three children each on average. With their husbands and children, they belong to large traditional extended families. They live in the town of Diolla in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. To help out their husband, they trade in a variety of items. They are known for their ties to their families and their neighbors. They belong to Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to put their business on a firmer future footing. Currently, they are on their second group loan. The first one was paid back with no problems. With the next loan, they plan to buy fruit and vegetables in bulk in nearby villages and to buy other miscellaneous items in Bamako. Everything will be sold in Dioïla. Their customers are both women and men. They hope that they will each make 25,000 CFA a month. Part of their earnings will be reinvested in the business, and the rest will pay day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla D. is from the village of Sta Rosa. She is 39 years old. Perla is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Perla earns approximately 4,000 whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2007, Perla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Perla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim U. is a villager in Kor village in Takeo province, and she is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. San Kosal, sells garlic in the local market. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Nim U. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start breeding pigs. Mrs. Nim U. is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start breeding.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam S., 28, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. She is also assisted by her husband in planting rice.

Soam S. has given birth to two small kids, who are still not enrolled in school. Soam S. was not available for the photo, so her husband is pictured instead.

Soam S. is applying for a loan to order buy mature rice from farmers to resell to gain income.

loans.use: To buy mature rice to resell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia V. is from the village of Z3, Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Virginia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Virginia operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of dry goods in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Z3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is one of the towns of Kyrgyzstan which is famous not only for its fish and its historical background, but also for its citizens, who are hardworking, self-confident people. One of the examples is Gulzat A.. She is a well-educated young lady. After graduating from the university, she worked in the bank as a financier for many years. Everything was fine, but since the ambitious mind wants success, as it always does, she was not satisfied with her salary and left the job. 

Then she attended a sewing course. Later on she borrowed 20,000 KGS ($445) and opened up a rented pavilion. Now she sews curtains and makes national crafts. At present, she is thirty-six years old and married. She has a daughter, age sixteen, who attends the local school. Her husband works in a plastics factory in the capital. 

Now her profits per month are about 9,000 KGS ($200). She wants a loan to buy fabrics to expand her assortment, because in March she is going to another city to trade. With the money that she would earn, she wants to buy domestic appliances.

Bubukan C. is a married woman whose husband is a pensioner, but has enough strength to help his wife in her business. In 1997 they began to fatten and sell sheep. With the money earned they married off their son and expanded their number of sheep. They began this business with 2,000 KGS ($45) and now their monthly profit is about 15,000 KGS ($335). With the loan they want to buy nine sheep for 2,000 to 2,500 KGS ($45 to $55) each. 

Bakytbek C. is a married man, forty years old. His wife works as a credit manager. He has two children and the elder one attends school. He works in forensics (death investigation) as a dispatcher, and his salary is 6,000 KGS ($134). He is planning to provide education for his children and buy a car as well. With the loan he wants to buy hay.

Rahat A. is a thirty-six year old married woman. She saved some money, approximately 35,000 KGS ($778), with which she bought materials and sewed them using patterns. Her husband does not work now. Her profit per month is about 10,000 KGS ($225). Also she has a daughter who studies at the university and she paid her tuition of about 18,000 KGS ($400). By getting a loan she would expand her assortment of fabrics in order to work in another town.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of a 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.
