To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to expand assortment of curtains

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 53 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling Fern C (a vitamin C food supplement) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: Blanca Rita tiene 56 años. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ha obtenido por lo que ha demostrado ser una muy buena cliente. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 depende de ella. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que es la principal fuente de ingresos de su hogar, esta mujer es una persona muy admirable pues el espíritu de alegría que ofrece a sus clientes es algo que los atrae. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, pan, leche, pollo entre otros productos. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio para ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Blanca Rita is 56 years old. This is not the first time she has received a loan since she has proven to be an excellent client. She has four children, but only one is a dependent. Blanca has been managing a store for more than 14 years and this business is the main source of income for her household. She is a person who is greatly admired for her cheerful spirit that helps to attract her customers.

Blanca is requesting this loan to use as operating capital to purchase candy, detergents, bread, milk, chicken, and other products. Her wish is to improve her business by expanding it.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchadise

loans.name: Lisely

texts.es:
Lisely, de 25 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus suegros a su esposo, Vidal de 30 años, quien trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro. Lo que más desea es brindarle una buena educación a sus dos querida hijas, Celeste y Antuanette.

Desde muy joven se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para tener un sustento económico, puesto que a los 15 años ya era madre y tenía una hija qué mantener. Fue así que su cuñada, con el afán de ayudarla, la contrató como ayudante en el puesto de comida que tiene en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde ahora trabaja sirviendo los platos y apoyando en todas las labores de la cocina.
Lisely disfruta mucho de cocinar y no desaprovecha las escasas oportunidades que le brinda su cuñada, cuando le pide que cocine y se encargue del negocio. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos los comensales al mismo tiempo. 
En los próximos meses planea implementar su propio puesto de comida, ya que siente que es hora de tener su negocio propio.

Este es el quinto préstamo al que accede Lisely con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará las mesas y sillas que necesita para su propio puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Lisely, 25 years old, is a hard-working, cheerful mother. She lives in the house her in-laws left to her husband Vidal, 30 years old, who transports passengers in his motorized trishaw. Her fondest wish is to offer her two darling daughters, Celeste and Antuanette, a good education. From early on she saw it was necessary to work to make a living, since by 15 years old she was already a mother with a daughter to support. Her sister-in-law, wanting to help her out, hired her as an assistant in her food stall in the city market, where Lisely now works serving customers and helping with all the kitchen duties. Lisely really enjoys cooking and takes full advantage of the few opportunities her sister-in-law gives her when she asks her to cook and take care of the business. She's been working in the food stall for six years, and what she finds most challenging is attending to all the customers at once. In the next few months she plans to set up her own food stall, since she feels it's time to have her own business. This is Lisely's fifth loan with MFP and, just as she did with her previous loans, she intends to pay it off in full and on time. She's very respected in her village bank, since she's the most active, committed member. She will use the 800 soles requested to buy the tables and chairs she needs for her own food stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her future food stall

loans.name: Ghulam Sediq

texts.en:
The man who is in the picture is Ghulam Sediq, the son of G. M.. He is 35 years old and married, and is the father of four children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a very honest and talented man. He is a high-school math teacher and he is very happy with his whole family.

Ghulam Sediq has a friend whose name is Ajmal Rasooly. Ajmal has a small retail shop in city of Kabul, but he has some problems with his business. He needs a loan of 14000 Afghani to expand his shop and he needs money to invest in his shop more. Therefore, Ghulam Sediq wants to take an individual loan for his friend (Ajmal Rasooly) to start and expand his shop.He wants to purchase sanitary products like, powder, soap and eatable things like,cola,energy driks and so on.
Finally, he would like to thank Kiva, its lenders, and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: for purchasing sanitary products and beverages

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William B. N., tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado, y tiene tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 19,16 y 12 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan.Además, desea reparar el corral y terminar de ponerle el techo.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don William también trabaja desde hace muchos años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
William B. N. is 45 years old, married, and has three children who are his top priority. Their ages are 19, 16, and 12. His loan will be used to buy cattle to raise for both meat and milk production. He wants to maintain the cattle properly in order to obtain the best possible price when the time comes to sell them. Additionally, he wants to repair his corral and finish putting on a roof.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don William has been raising cattle for several years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle & make repairs to a corral

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: EL SR. FELIX  NACIO EL 21 DE FEBRERO DE 1950 EN CHUQUISACA, CASADO CON DOÑA MARIA  CON 3 HIJOS TODOS MAYORES DE EDAD YA INDEPENDIENTES. HACE 20 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU TIERRA EN RANCHO NUEVO A 10KM DE LA CARRETERA DE TIQUIPAYA DONDE TRABAJA EN AGRICULTURA, EL TRABAJA HACE 3 AÑOS CON EMPRENDER Y TODO SUS PRODUCTOS LO SACA A VENDER AL MERCADO DE EL TORNO SIEMBRA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS PERO ES TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA DE PAPA Y PARA ESO SOLICITO CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS, ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA SIEMBRA Y VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Felix was born on February 21, 1950, in Chuquisaca. He is married to Doña Maria and they have three adult children who are independent. For the past 20 years, he has owned farmland in Rancho Nuevo that lies 10km from the Tiquipaya Highway. Felix has worked with Emprender for three years. He grows a variety of products and sells them at the market in El Torno. The season for planting potatoes has arrived and he is requesting a loan to buy seedlings. Felix is a hard worker and his wife helps with planting and selling their products. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seedings

loans.name: Sueños Exitosos Group

texts.es: GLORIA LETICIA T. ES LA PRESIDENTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO SUEÑOS EXITOSOS.  INICIA SU VENTA HACE 3 AÑOS EN SU ALDEA A ORILLAS DE LA CARRETERA ALQUILANDO, HOY DIA ESTA EN SU CASA Y LAS VENTAS HAN AUMENTADO.  SU COMPAÑERO  DE GRUPO ES CARLOS QUIEN ES DUEÑO DE UNA VIDRERIA Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION E INSTALACION DE VENTANAS  Y  TAMBIEN OFELIA QUIEN  VENDE BLUSAS DE TELA DE MANERA  AMBULANTE  EN SU LOCALIDAD.  HAY MUCHAS METAS  Y ELLOS DESEAN EL CREDITO PARA PODE AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO LO QUE LES PERMITIRA PODER SURTIR MEJOS SUS NEGOCIOS Y HACER QUE SUS INGRESOS MEJORES, ESO BENEFICIARÀ A SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
Gloria Leticia T. is the president of a support group called Suenos Exitosos ("Making Dreams Come True"). She started in sales 3 years ago, working along the side of a toll road in her town, but she now operates the business in her house and her sales have increased. Her fellow member, Carlos, owns a glass business and earns a living making and installing windows. Another membr, Ofelia, works as a street vendor in her town, selling blouses. Each member has a goal in mind and they are applying for loans to increase their working capital so that they can supply their businesses, increase their incomes and help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Katupyry, se conformó en noviembre de 2009, actualmente están  desarrollando el 3° ciclo del programa comité de mujeres.
 Este comité pertenece a una de las zonas rurales de Encarnación,  por lo que todas las integrantes son oriundas de zonas muy humildes  y  desprotegidas alejadas de la ciudad es por ello que las mismas se sienten muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que les brinda el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Rurales  ya que les brinda la oportunidad de que la gente conozca los trabajos que realizan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias.
En las zonas donde viven estas señoras hay poco movimiento económico por ellas deben viajar hasta el centro de la ciudad para ofrecer sus productos como por ejemplo, leche, yuca, queso, verduras frescas, maíz, maní, chipas, grasas, y otros productos que las mismas elaboran para vender.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa a A. quien se dedica a la venta de leche.
Ella posee varias vacas lecheras, y para mantenerlas debe dedicar varias horas al día al cuidado de las vacas ya que su marido trabaja un día entero como agricultor.
La actividad lo realiza en ocasiones con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes también estudian.
Ella todos los días se levanta muy temprano para el ordeñe de las vacas ya al amanecer ya lo debe tener listo para la venta desde su casa  o trasladarlo hasta la ciudad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas ya que desea construir fletes para ordeñe que facilitara bastante su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry Women's Committee was formed in November 2009 and is now developing the third cycle of its Women's Committee program. This group belongs to one of the rural zones of Encarnación so all the members are from very humble, unprotected areas outside of the city. Because of this they feel very grateful for the opportunity offered by the Committee of Rural Women program which provides them with the chance for people to know about the work they do day after day to help their families get ahead. In the area where these women live, there is little economic activity so they need to travel to the center of the city to offer their products such as milk, yuca, fresh vegetables, cheese, corn, peanuts, tortillas, oil and lard, and other products that they produce for sale. One of the members is Ms.Teresa A. who works selling milk. She has several milk cows and to care for them she must work several hours each day taking care of the cows since her husband works the entire day as a farmer. She sometimes does the work with the help of her children who also study. Every day she gets up very early to milk the cows since by early morning she must have everything ready for sale from her house or to take to the city. She requests the loan for the purchase of wood since she wants to construct milking stalls that will greatly facilitate her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale for retail sale, like cleaning items, books, sewing items, food items, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima N. est  âgé de 39 ans qui exerce du commerce d'équipement sportif dans la période hivernale avec le championnat de football amateur qui regroupe tous les quartiers de la ville de Mbour . Ainsi pour les besoins d'activités de vacances il a créé un restaurant qui va réunir tous les amateurs et supporters d'équipes de football  .A cet effet Monsieur N. sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités et générer des gains pour sa survie et celle de sa famille surtout durant ces périodes de grandes vacances
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima N. is 39-years old. He runs a business in the wintertime selling sports equipment for the amateur football championship that involves all the neighborhoods of the city of Mbour. For holiday activities, he opened a restaurant to bring together all the amateurs and fans of the football teams. Mr. N. is requesting a loan to help him strengthen his activities and earn revenue in order to support himself and his family, especially during these vacation periods.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Bishnu

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Bishnu D..  She is married and has 3 children aged 12, 6, and 4 months.  In 2005, she established  her agirculture business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase vegetable seeds and materials.  In the future, Bishnu plans to send her children to school.  She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: vegeatable farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Avon cosmetics (lipstick, nail polish, makeup, body cream)

loans.name: Puna

texts.en:
Puna K. is 36 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Puna has three years of experience in this business.  Puna needs a loan of WST 1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to further improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Puna joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Puna's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Verbina

texts.en:
Verbina Y. is from the village of Kalangahan, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Verbina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Verbina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Soley

texts.es:
Soley Castellon R. quiere a sus 35 años  convertirse en toda una microempresaria por medio de su taller de Costura.
Ella vive en canalete una comunidad rural en Alajuela, desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la confección de ropa interior y de ropa de vestir formal.  Con sus ventas a logrado hacer que su negocio sea reconocido en toda su comunidad, por eso ella quiere un préstamo de ¢600 000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para comprar una máquina de coser Overlock y demás materiales que necesita para lograr una mayor producción en su taller y convertirse al fin en una microempresaria.
Doña Soley  es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica, este será su cuarto Préstamo.
texts.en:
Soley Castellos R. is 35 years old and she wants to be a business woman, to have a tailoring shop. She lives in Canalete, a rural community in Alajuela. For the past three years she has been making under garments and formal attire. Through her sales she has managed to make a name for herself. She requires a loan in the amount of 600 000 (six hundred thousand) colones to purchase an Overlock sewing machine and materials that she needs to make larger quantities of clothing in her shop. Her goal is to become a small business owner. Soley is a member of Community Bank Canalete, one of the 100 organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and basic tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced. She is a market entrepreneur from Berdyansk. Ludmila sells shoes, sandals, flip flops and other footwear items. Ludmila started her business four years ago. Presently, her turnover capital is about 18,000 Grivnyas. Her income is less than 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Ludmila understands the value of customer service – a quality which sets her apart from many other business owners. She is attentive and polite to her customers and tries to give them each her individual attention, which is why she has many loyal customers. Ludmila has requested a loan of 3,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is planning to purchase additional merchandise and sell it at a reasonable price.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 47 years old, married and blessed with six children. He makes a living as a welder and metal fabricator, producing covers for doors and gates. He started this business in 1998 and, thanks hard work and help from Faulu Kenya, has been able to expand his small company. He hopes to open another location in the future, and has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy materials, such as iron sheets, that he needs to run his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as iron sheets

loans.name: Vafa

texts.ru:
Vafa H. 33 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i jivet vmeste s semyoy. Vafa yavlyayetsya IDP personom , ona pereselenec iz Agdam, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione.

Vafa uje 5 let kak otrkila svoy salon. Ranshe ona rabotala pomoshniccey v salone svoyey teti. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye. U neyo mnoqo kliyentov i poetomu ona xochet uvelichiv pomesheniye chtobi tam ona moqla vzat na rabotu yeshe odnu rabochiyu chtob uspevat so vsemi kliyentami.
texts.en:
Vafa H. is 33 years old. She is not married and lives with her family. Vafa is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Agdam and now lives in the region of Absheron.

It has been five years since Vafa has opened her beauty salon. She used to work as an assistant in her aunt's beauty salon. At this time she needs 2000 AZN to increase the area of the salon. She has many customers and this is why she wants to expand so that she can hire one more employee to attend to all her customers.

loans.use: To expand the salon area

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S., aged 38, is a tailor at Mathare north specializing in making covers for chairs, beds and tables. She is married to Joseph Irungu who is a salesman and together they have one daughter — Sharon, aged 16 and in high school. Mathare north is a slum area and Rose’s customers are mostly ladies of low income. She has been running this business for six years and her monthly income is Kshs 11,400 which adds to her husband's income.

Rose was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. With the Kshs 80000 loan, She plans to purchase covers, fabrics, and threads. She will also use Kshs 15000 from the loan to open another shop in the same area. If this loan boosts her business she will open a much bigger workshop to train, and later employ, other women so that they can also support their families.

In the future, Rose plans to start a tailoring college to empower young ladies from Mathare slum to use their skills to earn income and be independent.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and threads and open another shop.

loans.name: Léopoldine J.

texts.fr: Mariée, Léopoldine a à charge 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle est coiffeuse de profession depuis environs 8 ans. Parallèlement à la coiffure, elle commercialise des mèches, des sacs, des chaussures et des produits cosmétiques. Elle compte parmi ses clients les habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Pour ses activités, Léopoldine s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Tokpa, le plus grand marché du Bénin et au Togo ou au Nigeria, deux pays frontaliers au Bénin. Elle sollicite et obtient un prêt à FINADEV afin de constituer un stock plus important et plus varié afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. Son mari prend en charge la majeure partie des dépenses de la famille, mais elle y participe également. Ainsi, avec le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit, elle pourra mieux prendre soin de sa famille et d'elle-même. Elle souhaiterait avoir sa propre maison de distribution de gros de ses produits dans les jours à venir.
texts.en:
Léopoldine is married and raising two children, both in school. She has been a professional hairdresser for eight years. Along with hairdressing, she also sells hair extensions, handbags, shoes, and cosmetics. Her clientele is made up of people from her neighborhood and passersby. 

Léopoldine buys her business inventory from wholesalers in Tokpa, the largest market in Bénin, and also in Togo or Nigeria, two countries which border Bénin. She has requested and is being granted a loan from FINADEV so that she can significantly expand and diversify her stock so as to better satisfy her customers. 

Her husband is the major breadwinner for the household, but she also participates in supporting their family.  Thus, with the additional income generated by this small loan, she will be better able to care for her family and herself. She would like in future to have her own wholesale business selling her product line.

loans.use: purchase of boxes of hair extensions and other cosmetic products

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 55-year-old Touch N.’s daily routine. Touch N. and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell around her community. They also buy baskets from other weavers and sell them at a profit. They have done this since 1985. Touch N. is an older mother who has two children who live in their own homes. Touch N. will be using her loan to invest in her business to buy more baskets to sell.

loans.use: To buy more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Genaro

texts.es:
El Senor Carlos S., tiene 33 anos de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 20 anos, originario de la comarca Namanji en Esteli.
Dede los 10 anos de edad, ayudaba a sus padres en las actividades agricolas, estudiaba en una humilde escuelita, cerca de su comunidad, llamado Los Morguetas, estudiaba solamente por 4 horas al dia. No pudo seguir con sus estudios para dedicarse completamente ayudar a sus padres, pues no teniana los suficientes recursos.
A los 16 anos su Papa le regalo 1/2 manzana del terreno para que se ayudara con sus gastos, pues ya se habia casado, y empezo a trabajar en sociedad con un amigo, y asi estubo por al rededor de 4 anos, pero durante ese tiempo ahorro dinero y compro mas terreno y sembrando.
Luego invirtio en la compra de un Pozo y otros materiales agricolas, para mejorar su produccion. Apoya a sus hijos para que estudien y se preparen, y en vacacione ellos le ayudan con las actividades del negocio, pero el desea que mejor ellos se preparen  salgana adelante.
Realizo el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas, para la siembra de Cebolla y Chiltoma.
Su Meta es tener su casa y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos S. is 33 years old, married and has 3 children.  He has been farming for more than 20 years and is originally from Namanji region in Esteli. 

Carlos started helping his parents with their farming at the age of 10.  He studied in a humble, small school near his community called Los Morguetas.  He only studied for 4 hours a day.  He couldn't continue with his studies because he had to help his parents full time as they didn't have enough financial resources.

At the age of 16, Carlos' dad gave him 50 square meters of land so that he could help him with his expenses as he had gotten married.  He started to work with a friend and he worked that way for around 4 years.  However, during this time he saved money and bought more land on which he grew crops.

Later, Carlos invested in buying a well and other farming materials to improve his production.  He supports his children in their studies and during their school vacations they help him with his work.  However, he believes it is more important that they prepare themselves professionally and get ahead in life.

Carlos is requesting his loan to buy farming supplies for his onion and sweet pepper crops.  His goal is to own his own home and to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.en:
B. Zarifjon is from Gafurov, Tajikistan.  Working with his father, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise characteristic of this region. He is the father of 3 children, whom he cares for and has the responsibility of educating.  Zarifjon is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. For this reason, he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income. With your help, Zarifjon will be able to make his business succeed and support his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand business

loans.name: Omaro

texts.fr:
Monsieur Omaro Koné  est âgé de 29 ans,  marié et père d’un enfant, il est polygame et vit chez son père avec sa famille dans le quartier Hamdallaye  de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école du à des raisons sociales, c’est ainsi qu’il embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père depuis son jeune  âge et l’exerce pour lui-même il y a 6 ans.  Il est très bien sollicité par ses clients. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mr Koné a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est son  premier prêt individuel, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 7 téléphones portables et des pièces de rechange à Bamako. Il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte, au comptant. Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA  pour subvenir à ses besoins,  rembourser le prêt, satisfaire les charges de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans les jours à venir, il envisage d’agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Omaro Koné is 29 years old, married, and the father of one child.  He is polygamous and lives at his father’s house with his family in the district of Hamdallaye, in the city of Koutiala (region of Sikasso).  
He did not attend school regularly because of social circumstances.  This is why he took to working and earning money with his father at a young age. He has been working for himself for six years now.   He is in high demand from his clients. 
In order to satisfy this demand, Mr. Koné applied for a loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  He is on his first loan which he plans to use to buy 7 cell phones and spare parts in Bamako.  He makes his sales, in cash, from his kiosk at the main market in Koutiala to a mixed clientele. With this financing, he plans to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will allow him to meet his personal needs, repay his loan, meet family responsibilities, and reinvest in his business. 
In the near future, he foresees increasing his business activity in order to  attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and spare parts

loans.name: Kalybek

texts.en:
Kalybek A. is 54 years old. After serving in the army, Kalybek returned home and began to work as a driver at the local state farm.  After breakdown of the Soviet Union, Kalybek decided to engage in cattle breeding. He started with the initial capital of 6,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS) and managed to earn about 6,000 KGS in a month. With the revenues, Kalybek was able to improve his living conditions and give good dowries to his daughters.  

Being a very purposeful and positive person, Kalybek works hard to support his family.

Kalybek plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Kalybek is planning to buy a car for his family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Margrete

texts.en: Margrete is currently engaged in a business selling bread and charcoal. She is 25 years old, married with 2 children and both of them go to school. Margrete borrowed a loan to stock more bread and charcoal to sell. With extra profits from the business, Margrete hopes to buy land in the future.

loans.use: stock more bread and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 35 años y está casado con la Sra. Brigida, quien es comerciante y posee una cantina en la escuela enfrente a su casa y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Carlos se dedica al ramo de pintura de obras desde hace más de 15 años, aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien se fue a trabajar en Argentina, después de terminar sus estudios secundarios.
Actualmente posee su propia casa y desde hace aproximadamente cinco años sus trabajos los realiza en forma independiente y con sus propios recursos.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una heladera para su domicilio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old and is married to Brigida, who is a trader and has a canteen in the school in front of their house to help with the household expenses.

Carlos has been a painter for more than 15 years.  He learned the business from his uncle, with whom he went to work in Argentina, after finishing secondary school.

He now has his own home and for the last five years has been working on his own using his own resources.

He will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for his house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 51 years old and is a married woman with eight children. Her oldest child is 36 years old and the youngest is 13.

Sonia has been engaged in fishing for two years. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who catches fish. Sonia sells all his catch to the market. Sonia works hard to support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fishing hooks and nets. This will help Sonia's husband catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol J. is 44 years old and married with five school-aged children. She is from the village of Centro 2. To make a living, Carol owns and operates a butcher shop. Her main source of income comes from butchering and selling poultry in the market. Carol has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Carol joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional chicken meat to sell in the market. This will be the first loan taken out by Carol from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to pay tuition fees for her children. 


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a 33-year-old married man living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He has 2 children aged 4 and 2. 

Ruel runs a rice farming business. He tills his land and prepares it well for cropping. Ruel sells his harvest to rice traders. He works hard to provide for his family and sustain his children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business and earn a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro es un padre de familia de 45 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrtito de Reque, a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía .

Teodoro se dedica hace 10 años a las labores agricolas en sus tierras cultiva donde siembra maíz y camote, es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores que lo comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque de Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor,con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos. Pero quiere intentar sembrar frijol en sus tierras y así amplia sus productos para vender. 

A solicitado un préstamo  de 1800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para empezar a sembrar frijol en sus terrenos y también es para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y su producto, el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo de los pobladores.  La venta de su maíz y camote mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teodoro es conocido por las personas que también se dedican a esa actividad, por ser trabajador y respobsable, con el único objetivo de brindarles a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 45, lives with his wife and children in his own house in the district of Reque, about 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo.  The type of work in this area is mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For ten years Teodoro has been raising corn and sweet potato crops, healthy, vitamin-rich foods consumed daily by the local population.  He sells his crops wholesale and retail at the Moshoqueque Market in Chiclayo.  In order to increase his income he wants to start growing beans to broaden his product range.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,800 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to begin growing beans and buy fertilizer to improve his land and crops.  Selling corn and sweet potatoes has improved his family's lifestyle.

Teodoro is known in the agricultural community as a hard-working, responsible person who only wants to give his children the best opportunities

loans.use: To grow beans and buy fertilizer to improve his land.

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya is 57 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor with her husband. Six years ego Lusya transformed one of her home’s rooms into a shop, where she has been running a general store all these years. Her husband helps her in her occupation and together they solve their family’s needs. 

She has separated part of her shop for selling household goods, which she intends to enlarge. For that addition, she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy shampoos, washing powders, soaps and other merchandise for her household goods department, and also to buy foodstuffs for her food section.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, washing powders, soaps, and other household goods and also foodstuffs for her shop.

loans.name: Galet Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Galet es socia del banco comunal Las Trabajadoras De Manantay del Distrito De Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Son dos años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, Galet se dedica a la confección de sabanas y su esposo es trabajador independiente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 12 metros de tela, 20 metros blonda ancha, 10 metros de elástico.
La confección de sus sabanas lo hace en su casa en horas de la tarde, porque en horas de la mañana realiza otras actividades, además de atender  sus hijos para que se vayan al colegio.
La difícil situación actual del país hace que las familias trabajen todos para  poder  pagar todos los gastos básicos del hogar, gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido emprender un pequeño negocio para el bienestar de su familia.

Notese en la foto un intenso sol que dificulta la visibilidad.
texts.en:
Galet is a member of the “Las Trabajadoras de Manantay”  (The Workers from Manantay) Communal Bank in the Manantay District, Ucayali department.  She is 27 years old, married, and has two children.

She has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for two years.  She makes sheets, and her husband is an independent worker.

She will use the new loan for 1,000 soles to buy 12 meters of fabric, 20 meters of wide silk lace, and 10 meters of elastic.

She makes her sheets at home in the afternoon.  This is because she does other things in the morning, in addition to taking care of her children and getting them off to school.

The current difficult situation in the country makes everyone work in order to be able to pay all of the basic household expenses.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has been able to start a small business for her family’s well-being.

Note that in the photo the intense sunlight making it difficult to see.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Pacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACHA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Magali. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, producción de papas fritas, tienda de barrio, venta de aluminio, tienda de joyería, metal mecánica, distribuidora de medicamento, empastador, tejido de mantas, venta de pasankalla.
 
La señora Magali,  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta y elaboración de papas fritas que viene trabajando hace un año atrás y que aprendió de su suegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cargas de papa y aceite), este material lo comprara de la Ceja del sector riel (zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto), posteriormente lo venderá en los colegios y tiendas de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las amigas.

En la fotografía falta la señora Lucia, ya que ingreso a consultorio
texts.en:
The communal bank "Pacha" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the central office "Santiago II."  This group has 10 members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Magali.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, including: food sales, potato chip production, neighborhood store, aluminum sales, jewelry store, metal mechanic, medicine distributor, bookbinder, blanket weaving, and popcorn sales.

Magali states that this is her first time taking a loan as a member of Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of a loan officer.  She currently has a business making and selling potato chips.  She learned this trade from her mother-in-law, and she has been doing this work for a year.

The loan that she will take will be used to increase her working capital (so that she can buy sacks of potatoes and cooking oil.)  She will buy these supplies in the Ceja neighborhood near the railway (the commercial area of the city of El Alto), and she will later sell her products in the schools and stores from Mondays until Fridays.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as she can; she lives with a partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she enjoys sharing with her friends.

In the photograph the member Lucia is missing because she was in the office.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Ulpatkan's Group

texts.en:
Ulpatkan is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married to a pensioner. Together with her husband she has raised eight children. The youngest son, 13, studies at school and the other children are either married or employed. The children try to support their parents financially, but Ulpatkan still needs money to meet the family needs. 

Together with her husband she cultivates agricultural products. Selling some part of the harvest she earns an additional 4,000 KGS per month. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

In the future Ulpatkan wants to see all her children married and employed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Ketut and the other members of the Darma Sedana group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Ketut  hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only recieve capital but also training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs. Ni Ketut will use her share of the loan to purchase two piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family of four by supplementing her husband's income from his work as a day laborer. Ultimately, Ni Ketut hopes that increased income will enable her to renovate her simple kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants. But you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life in the city. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge market and its trade in livestock — the largest in the country.

Maria is 38 years old and has four children, aged 4, 11, 13 and 15. She had a difficult separation from her husband and now lives with her four kids. She shares her spare time with her children at home.

This is Maria's first Kiva loan. She'll use her loan to invest in more tables and chairs for the restaurant she and her mother run in Santo Domingo. Maria finds the most difficult part of her work is the cooking — she doesn't like it, but her work in the restaurant requires her to do it nearly all day. But buying addition seating for potential customers, Maria hopes she can increase her income and provide herself and her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more tables and chairs for a restaurant.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is single parent with two children. Vilma has a shop that sells items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and more. She has had this business for the past two years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more of these above items.

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 5 years and hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Fidélité Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean is a leader of the community bank named “Fidélité Plus” which is composed of 13 microentrepreneurs. They are united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Jean sells food in the mid-eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 2003. His beginning capital was $50. Currently, through his sales, Jean makes about $15 per day. He plans to use the next loan to purchase two bags of milk to resell in order to increase his income. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having six times received and properly repaid loans. He dreams to someday open a boutique and a drugstore in his area. Jean is 48 years old, married and the father of eight children whose ages range from 8 to 24 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of milk to resell at profit

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is two years now operating her hog fattening business but is still struggling to reach her desired income. She wants to earn more than her usual profit to have support for the education of her two children. Right now she is prioritizing her hog fattening business in order to make her business progress.


For this reason, she is requesting a loan amount of 5000 PHP to buy one hog to raise and hog food and vitamins. She hopes this will provide a better income for the betterment of their current living as well as for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy one hog to raise and hog feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El Sr. Joaquín se dedica al servicio de transporte y  mecánica hace 2 años, el es una persona joven tiene 25 años, Vive en zona del Plan 3000, no tiene hijos. Ya que mantiene a sus padres por la edad avanzada que tienen, su Padre tenia un taller de reparaciones , ahora el joven Joaquín  paso a ser dueño del negocio de su padre que es un taller de Estructura metálicas por eso que se apersono a nuestras oficinas para solicitar el crédito para poder comprar una maquina de soldar y algunas herramientas que le faltan en su taller y así tener mas ingresos para poder sustentar a sus padres, ya que su  vehículo que es su herramienta principal de sus ingresos lo trabaja desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 21 pm.  de la  noche pero ahora quiere alternar para  poner en pie su taller que le paso su padre.
texts.en:
Sr. Joaquín earns his living as a taxi driver and mechanic. He is 25 years old and lives in the area of Plan 3000. He doesn't have any children, but he does support his elderly parents. His father has a car repair garage which Joaquín has recently taken over. He has now approached our institution to ask for a loan to buy a soldering iron and other tools which the workshop lacks. With these purchases he hopes to earn more money to support his parents.

At the moment Joaquín runs his taxi service, his principal source of income, from 6am to 9pm, but he plans to alternate between this job and his father's workshop so he can put it on a sound footing.

loans.use: to buy a soldering iron for his workshop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old, married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gloria has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San is 51-years old and the loving mother of seven children. She was married but her husband passed away many years ago. Therefore, she is diligent and patient, raising her children alone in Siem Reap province. Nowadays she owns a grocery store selling rice, meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) and drinks. She has been involved in this business since 2008. From this business, she typically yields a profit of $6 US per day for financial solvency. 

Two of her children also help support the family by working in different jobs and places. Her daughter is a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh and her son is a motor-taxi driver in the community. Recently her son’s business is not going well because his old motorcycle often breaks down. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. San is seeking a loan of $1,100 from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy a new motorcycle for her son. This is her second loan with Kiva and, with the previous loan, Mrs. Son repaid punctually and has paid off already. In the future, Mrs. Son wants to send her small children to join a class in a local school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to support her son's business.

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en:
Chagnaadorj is 32 years old and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He is a vendor in a private company, which he has been doing for two years. However, his salary is not enough for his family's necessities and expenses, so he is trying to start a new business providing  transportation around the city. 

Chagnaadorj is requesting a loan to purchase a minivan for his new transportation business. According to this plan, the new business will increase his earnings in the future.

loans.use: to cover the payment of his new minivan.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” grupo formado por 07 socios la mayoría D. ellas viven en puente piedra  lugar al norte D. Lima, La Sra. Roberta  se dedico al negocio D. comidas ella empezó como ayudante en el restaurante D. una amiga fue donD. aprendió a cocinar con ese conocimiento decidió abrirse paso sola busco un lugar y empezó con la venta D. comidas, sus consumidores son trabajadores D. transporte  y obreros D. construcción, por mucho tiempo le fue muy bien, con esos ingresos ayudo a su hija en sus estudios, debido su  embarazo reciente a dejado el negocio D. comidas por que requiere  mucho esfuerzo , para no dejar D. trabajar empezara otro negocio que es la venta D. golosinas para ello utilizara su préstamo para comprar caramelos, chocolates gaseosas etc., espera tener éxito para poder sacar adelante a sus  hijos que aun están pequeños y es por quienes lucha cada día.

*Roberta es la primera D. la fila está cargando su bebe.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedoras group has seven members, the majority of whom live in Puente Piedra, to the north of Lima.

Roberta worked selling food.  She began as a helper in a friend's restaurant, where she learned to cook.  With this knowledge she decided to make her way alone.  She looked for a place and began selling food.  Her customers are transportation and construction workers.  This went well for her for a long time.  With this income she helped her daughter in her studies.

As a result of her recent pregnancy, she has left the food business because it requires a lot of effort.  So as not to stop working, she will begin another business, selling candy, for which she will use her loan to buy candy, chocolate, sodas, etc.

She hopes to be successful to be able to get ahead with her young children, for whom she struggles every day.

*Roberta is the first one in the row, holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy sweets, candy, chocolate, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (in the photo) and her husband, Sophal, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have two sons who are attending school.

Sopheap and her husband are fish sellers and also raise pigs at home. Sopheap asked for a Kiva loan to buy feed for her pigs and sold the pigs once they were fully grown. She used the money from selling the pigs to continue her pig farming by buying new circle pigs to raise.

She hopes to apply for another loan in order to continue her pig farming by buying feed for her new circle pig farming.

loans.use: to buy feed her pigs.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan, Mongolia. Her husband sells firewood and coal, and her son is a kindergarden student. She started her mongolian traditional boot making business in 2008. She learned to make shoes from her father and her shoes are stylish and the quality is excellent. Over the years, she has become a trusted supplier to many. Due to a lack of equipment and raw materials, Uranchimeg is not meeting her customer's demands. Therefore, she is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am happy that I can continue my father's work. I think my business has a bright future and I'll do everything I can to make that possible".

loans.use: to buy equipment for her business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Luzminda has a pigpen, and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requests a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Luzminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luzminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Cecelia has a retail shop that sells beauty and home products from Personal Collection. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stock from Personal Collection for resale.
Cecelia is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Personal Collection for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old and single, supporting his mother.  He has been operating a curio shop, selling soapstone carvings from Kisii for the last eleven years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is applying for his second loan of KES 25,000, which he will use to buy more stocks of soap stone carvings for sale.  He paid the previous loan back well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

His hopes are to open up a curio shop for selling the soapstone carved products.

loans.use: to buy soapstone carvings from Kisii for sale.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is from the village of Azatan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – a 15-year-old daughter and two sons (eight and ten years old).  Naira is a trained nurse but due to difficult economic times, she has been farming for the past 20 years.  Naira also helps her relatives with potatoes grown on the family farm.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by 20%.  She is pleased with the terms and conditions of microfinance.  Naira is keeping her debt below 20% of her invested equity in the business.  Naira dreams that her children will receive university educations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wend Pouiré Group

texts.fr: Korotimi, membre représentatif est mariée et à 3 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Elle fait la restauration et a besoin de ce crédit pour renforcer son activité. Elle pourrait avec ce prêt acheter du riz, des spaghetti, de l'huile de bonne qualité stocker pour sa cuisine. Elle pourrait également acheter du bon poisson, de la viande et les différents condiments nécessaires pour sa cuisine. Quand on sait que pour des raison multiple beaucoup de burkinabé mange dehors, on peut dire que korotimi rend un service énorme à plusieurs personnes. Korotimi aimerait agrandir son restaurant à l'avenir et employé plus de personnes car elle travaille actuellement avec un seul employé. Avec le bénéfice, elle va continuer son activité.
texts.en: Korotimi, representative member, is a married mother of three, two of whom attend school. She is in the food-serving business and needs this loan to strengthen her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy rice, spaghetti, and good quality oil to stock for her cooking. She will also be able to buy good fish, meat, and the different seasonings necessary for her cooking. When you know that for multiple reasons, a lot of Burkinabes eat out, you could say that Korotimi is rendering an enormous service to a lot of people. Korotimi would like to grow her restaurant in the future and to employ more people, as she currently works with one employee. With the earnings, she will continue her business.

loans.use: to strengthen her restaurant by having more menu offerings for her clientele

loans.name: Darling

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Darling est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite épicerie. Elle a beaucoup de clients dans le voisinage qui viennent s’approvisionner chez elle. Son souhait est de voir son épicerie se développer de jour en jour. Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter des caisses de saumons et de spaghettis.

loans.use: acheter des caisses de saumons et de spaghettis

loans.name: Sudjayat

texts.en:
Sudjayat is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Seyidli village. She settled with her 3 children in Absheron region Binagadi shosse.
This 53-year-old widow Sudjayat started her business 8 years ago. She cooks the taste national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal, dovga and etc.
 In the beginning of her business she did not have enough money. In spite of her difficulties she did not leave her business. She decided to borrow the loan amount of $1000 to buy the equipments for cafe, which has been rented by her. This business allows her to support to her family. 
Now she applies for the loan amount of $1000 to buy this cafe. She is sure that her good business skills will be very helpful to her in repayingthe loan back. She is very optimistic about the future of her business.

loans.use: To buy the cafe,which has been rented by her

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the four members of the Bocc Diom association, led by. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Located in the rural community of Ngandiouf, at 12km from Pekesse which hosts a big weekly market, the village of Mboul has over 500 inhabitants and lacks means of communication, infrastructures, and road links. Livestock-raising and agriculture are the villagers’ primary means of livelihood.

Our objective is to combat the emigration of villagers to urban areas, and to improve the villagers’ living conditions.

Our business will consist of purchasing cows, raising them, and fattening them in order to resell them in the weekly markets that take place near the village of Mboul.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte : Situé dans la communauté rurale de Ngandiouf, à 12 km de pékésse qui abrite un grand marché hebdomadaire, le village de Mboul compte plus de 500 habitants est reste caractérisé par un manque de moyens de communication, d’infrastructures, de route… Ce pendant, l’élevage est l’agriculture reste les activités les plus favorables des populations.

Objectif : Lutter contre l’exode rural

Améliorer les conditions de vie des populations

Activités : Il s’agit d’acheter des bovins, les élevés en les engraissant puis les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires situés au alentours du village de Mboul»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchasing five young cows, feed, and veterinary care

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine was born in 1948. She is married with nine children. Her toughest challenges have been in her home, and the sickness of one of her children who is suffering from sickle cell anemia. She has benefited from a GHAPE loan in the past, which she paid back. Given a loan of $1,000, she would like to invest in her farm business, selling wood and other food products. She believes it is going to be a success because she already has experience in these areas and just needs capital to expand. She will also be selling prepared food to her community at a reduced cost. This will enable even the very poor to afford a meal per day.  She will use the profit from this business to send her last son to high school, build her house, and settle her other children in businesses.

loans.use: Farming/Selling of Firewood and Other Food Stuffs

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.en:
O. Fatoumata is a 35-year-old single mother. She lives with her daughter in Koumassi, a township in the south of Abidjan. Fatoumata produces and sells various exotic aromatic products in the Koumassi open-air market. She has had this micro-business for about 6 years and has a good reputation among her target customers. Fatoumata’s 8-year-old daughter goes to primary school. She has been able to pay her daughter’s school tuition and fees from her business and is very proud to have been able to do so.

Dynamic and ambitious, Fatoumata wants to expand her business and increase her revenue. She wants to improve the packaging of her products and hopes in future to be able to transfer her business to better, more hygienic premises.

loans.use: to improve the packaging of her products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has 15 years of experience selling personal items and household goods. She was encouraged to start by a friend and her mother-in-law. She has participated in many microbusiness courses, which have helped her to always be responsible with the loans she obtains. She works every day of the week from 7 AM until 9 PM. On the weekends, she travels to the countryside, where she has some customers. Her parents also live there, and they help her out with the business.

Rosa wants this loan in order to be able to offer more products for sale. Flexibility in being able to invest in products is critical for her to be able to make profits. It is much better when Rosa has money to invest in wholesale goods. This will be Rosa’s second time borrowing from Mifex.

Rosa is a single mother. She has been separated for 6 years. She has 2 children. One no longer lives with her and the other works and helps her out. Her wish is to be able to complete her house and to remodel part of it to accommodate her business, and in that way to increase her income.

loans.use: Invest in more products to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad lives in the borough "Las Lomas" in La Paz, the capital city of Bolivia. From a very young age she worked preparing and selling food. With the credit she obtained previously, through Kiva and IMPRO, she added furniture to the area where she currently sells food. She sells primarily to drivers, since she is located right in front of a "minibus" stop.

The new credit is destined to buy ingredients to prepare her food, now since the Bolivian economy has recently been attacked by inflation. She will buy at the high costs, although this won´t have a large affect on the prices of the different meals she sells.

Felicidad is a former Kiva and IMPRO client and with her good history she is approved to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Felicidad vive en casa propia en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona Las Lomas de La Ciudad de La Paz; desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida. Con el crédito que se le concedió anteriormente, via Kiva, amobló la pensión donde actualmente vede comida a los chóferes ya que ella vende justo en la parada de una línea de minibuses. El nuevo crédito que ahora solicita será para la compra de materiales para producir su comida, ahora que el efecto inflacionario está atacando el mercado boliviano, y así comprar a precios que aunque están altos, aun no influirán mucho en sus precios de venta de los diferentes platos que ella cocina. Ella ya es parte de los clientes que pidieron préstamo a través de Kiva. Es cliente antigua de Impro y por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food stand

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly M., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhorn Phroeung, 35, have been married since 1989. They have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are studying in the local school, and the youngest one is at home. Ly’s home is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Ly is a construction contractor and has also done farming since 1992. Currently, he is growing vegetables on a farm a bit far from his home. His wife weaves silk at home. They both work hard to support their children’s studies to the highest possible level.

Ly is requesting his second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. He will use this loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farming business.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farming business

loans.name: Farida's Kitomondo C Group

texts.en:
Farida is married and has three children, ages 17, 13, and 7. She runs a business selling clothes, which she started a year and a half ago. She works from 7am to 8:30pm daily selling clothes.

In the past, Farida took out a loan to increase her inventory. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Farida, who sells rice.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia E. is a mother of two who lives in a very populated neighborhood in the city of Luque. She owns a small convenience store where she sells basic foods like sugar, flour, breads, drinks and yerba mate, a kind of green tea.. With the amount of goods she sells and the good number of clients, she wants to continue expanding her store and the items sold.

It has been three years since Marcia opened her grocery store and it is making enough money to support her children. She would like to see it continue to flourish and is therefore asking or a loan to invest in yerba mate, sodas, wine, bread, and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like dairy, breads, and drinks.

loans.name: Nakanyonyi Da Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine K.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more shelves and stock. Christine is 25 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 3 and 6, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her retail shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Faith N. and Cleofasi A.. Faith N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand to wholesale. Cleofasi A. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase her purchases.

loans.use: To add more commodities to shop

loans.name: Neria

texts.es:
Neria belongs to the “Las Azucenas 2” comunal bank, which is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is the mother of 4 children. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Reyna decided to invest in a business selling food.

She rises every morning at 7:00am to make breakfast for her children and her husband. She then prepares the foods that she makes and sells them.

With this loan of S/. 1,200.00, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, basic food ingredients, beef, fish, vegetables, and soft drinks.

Neria is very happy with her loan from Manuela Ramos. Thanks to them, she happily spends her days with her children at her side.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Fernando Belaunde Ferry S/N del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 4 hijos. Neria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida(Juanes). En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos y salir a vender sus comidas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, víveres, res, pescado, verduras, gaseosas. Neria se siente muy bien con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos gracias a ellos pasa días felices a lado de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the prepartion of the foods she makes

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina B. is twenty-four years old. She is married with a two year old child. She is a member of the  community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another's loans as social collateral.  Faustina manages a business which sells cosmetics like earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes, powders, and other related goods. She sells these by moving around towns and offering her products to strangers because she has not got a shop yet. Faustina believes that with a loan of $175 she will be able to buy good quality standard goods and therefore make more valuable sales to her customers. She also wants to use the loan to buy a greater variety of goods, which will help her meet the preferences of her customers. Faustina believes this increased income will help her come closer to buying her own shop.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes, powders, etc.

loans.name: Bisharifa

texts.ru:
