Bisharifa has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year. She is 56 years old, is married and raises her 5 children. She sells children's clothing. She has been in business for a long time and this makes a significant contribution to her family's budget. She wants an additional loan from Microinvest to help increase her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Бишарифа сотрудничает с Микроинвест уже больше года. Ей 56 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 5 детей. Бизнесом занимается давно и это вносит весомый вклад в ее семейный бюджет. Она и дальше собирается получать займы в Микроинвест для увеличения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To increase business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T., 29, is married with five children. She has 3 years of experience in the chips business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~$41 USD).

SPBD loans are Mary's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use part of the loan for her children's education fees, school uniforms and lunches, and the remainder to pay the electric, telephone and water bills for her business.

loans.use: Mary would like to pay her children's school fees and for her chips business expenses.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mrs. Phann T. is a villager in Sarekakeo Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Men Hok, are farmers who cultivate rice and grow vegetables. Aside from this business, Mr. Men Hok collects palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. The couple have five children; two are employed in the garment factory; the others are attending school.

Although the family has income from many different sources, they still need another business in order to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Phann T. is requesting a loan to start a bed-making business which her husband would manage. She had previously obtained a loan to buy timbers and has fully paid it back.

Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a bed-making business.

loans.name: Dental Group

texts.fr: Le GIE Dental de Kael est localisé à Mbacké dans la région de Diourbel (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Il est constitué de cinq membres dont deux femmes. Le GIE a pour but le développement socio-économique de ses membres. Ses principales activités sont le commerce, l’élevage, l’embouche bovine.Le projet d’embauche bovine se situe en ligne droite  des activités du Groupement. Le GIE fait le commerce de bœuf, de mouton, de chèvre dans la zone de Mbacké. Chaque jour de marché hebdomadaire, un membre prospecte les bonnes affaires, achète le bétail et celui-ci est vendu sur d’autres marchés notamment dans les villes comme Mbacké. Cette activité est très lucrative mais le volant d’argent disponible comme fonds de roulement limite les capacités du Groupement dans son commerce de bétail. L’opportunité qu’offre Kiva dans le cadre du micro-crédit devra permettre de renforcer le fonds de roulement et financer l’achat de plus de moutons et de bœufs.
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group, Dental, of Kael, is located in Mbacké in the Diourbel region (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). It consists of five members of which two are women. The goal of the Economic Interest Group is the socio-economic development of its members. Its principal businesses are in the commerce, raising, and fattening of cattle. This project is line with the association’s businesses. The Economic Interest Group does its business in ox, sheep, and goats in the Mbacké area. Every day at the weekly market, one member prospects good deals, buys the livestock and sells it at other markets, especially in cities like Mbacké. This business is very lucrative but the funds available as working capital limit the capacity of the association in its livestock business. The opportunity that Kiva offers in the realm of microcredit should help reinforce the working capital and finance the purchase of more sheep and ox.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising cattle

loans.name: Sarvinisso

texts.ru: Мусоева Сарвиниссо жительница города Яван. Жительница одного из отдаленных мест Явана. Единственные источники дохода жителей тех мест это сельское хозяйство: земледелие и животноводство. Сарвиниссо домохозяйка помогает мужу заниматься откормкой бычков. В данный момент подготавливается к холодам , а это значит в первую очередь закупить комбикорм. Поэтому она решила получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.У них очень большая семья. Они живут с родителями и имеют пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Savrinisso M. resides in a remote suburb of the city of Yavan. The only sources of income for the residents of her neighborhood are agriculture and animal husbandry. Savrinisso is a housewife. She helps her husband raise bull calves. Preparing for the cold season, the family needs to purchase forage. Therefore they are applying for a loan that they plan to repay in the next 10 months. Savrinisso’s family is very big. She and her husband share their house with their elderly parents and five children.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase forage

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena  es separada, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de  02 hijos ya casados que viven en Lima, vive en el Sector Sihualaya del Distrito de Tinicachi, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.nnEs  socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” – Yunguyo con el primer préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado ovino y porcino para engorde. Anteriormente a los 14 años de edad aprendió a tejer llicllas por que tenía que mantenerse sola, no pudo estudiar porque su madre murió cuando ella nació y su papa solo apoyo a sus hermanos varones, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven. En la actualidad  continúa tejiendo llicllas  y  al mismo tiempo se dedica al negocio de venta de telas que envía a Lima en donde posee un Establecimiento comercial. nnCon el crédito que solicitara de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara 10  rollos de telas para confeccionar casacas, pantalones, buzos, etc.nnSu mayor deseo es tener una casa propia en Puno.n
texts.en:
Elena is separated from her husband and is 49 years old, she has 2 children and lives in Lima, in the Sihualaya sector of the Tinicachi district, province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is a member of the community bank Virgen de Lujanu Yunguyo. With her first loan of S/.300.oo new soles she bought pigs and sheep. She learned how to create llicllas to support herself, as she couldn’t study because her mother died when she was born and her father supported her brothers, but not her, so she started working very young. Currently she stills creates llicllas and she also sells fabrics she sends to Lima where she has a store. With the loan she is requesting of S/.1500.00 new soles that she will pay in 4 quotes, she will buy 10 rolls of fabric to create jackets, pants, sweaters, etc. Her biggest wish is to have her own house in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Andrea Adelina

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es originaria del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León donde se dedica a la elaboración de manjares o cereales para venderlos en su establecimiento en su casa de habitación y de esta manera ganarse la vida para brindarle las condiciones necesarias a sus hijos para que se desarrollen.

La señora Andrea se caracteriza por elaborar deliciosos manjares que son vendidos rápidamente en su localidad por la razón de que a los clientes les agradan estos productos elaborados por las manos de la señora Andrea. De igual manera ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de carne de Cerdo ya que también se dedica a la crianza de cerdo para vender la carne. Hoy en día el propósito por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima para continuar con su negocio y así lograr subsistir.
texts.en:
Andrea was born in the city of León, Nagarote municipality, where she makes snacks which she sell from her home-based shop. Her business enables her to put her children through school.

Andrea prepares delicious home-made snacks which sell like hotcakes. She also has a small butcher's shop where she sells pork from pigs she raises herself. She has requested a loan from Ceprodel to buy raw materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
For the past 6 years, Komil has worked in agriculture and the raising of animals.  He raises cows which he cares for greatly since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses through the milk which he sells in the mornings.  Komil showed us his animals with great happiness as his cows were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock.  

For Komil, it is very important to work his land and raise his animals, which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase another cow so that his wife can make more milk and sell it in the local markets.  That will help his family to generate additional income.  We appreciate your support for Komil’s projects.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.  

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Mrs. Nem H. is a 60-year-old widow and lives in Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She now wants to start a pig-breeding business, but she does not have enough money to deal with this purpose. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Nem H. is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed at different positions in the company while the other is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Oihol

texts.ru:
Эльмуродова Ойхол 8 лет как занимается предпринимательской деятельности. Родилась она в 1966 году, разведенная и имеет 4 детей. Она торгует исключительно женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских демисезонных курточек, пуловер и джемперов, а также большой выбор банных и домашних халатов со штанами. Она закупает свой товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Место ее деятельности рынок «Мубориз» города Гиссар. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. 
Ойхол хочет получить займ 4000 сомони и закупить новый товар.
texts.en:
Oihol was born in 1966. She is a single mother of four. Oihol E. has been in business for eight years selling clothing for women. Oihol purchases her goods at a wholesale market "Kovron" and sells the clothing at her retail spot at "Muboriz" market in Gissar. She has many loyal customers. This loan Oihol will use to purchase new inventory for her store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store inventory

loans.name: Tukae

texts.en:
Tukae has been a business woman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her retail business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Tukae is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty B. is the leader of Zibula Atudde group in Mityana. She is a hard working lady with a retail shop as her business.

This is her fourth loan that she is taking from Pearl Microfinance. Betty is glad to say that before she started getting loans, her income was so low, but now she is able to make a weekly gross profit of 200,000 Ushs.

She was able to increase stock in her shop that is located in Mityana as well as being able to buy more household items that are helpful to her family.

Betty needs another loan to be able to stock her shop with more products.

loans.use: Buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Salama has been a coconut seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 5 hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more coconuts for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Salama is 40 years old, married, and has seven children ages 20, 18, 15, 10, 7, 5 and 4. She also cares for five additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Sharifa, Bahati and Khadija. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for resale to expand her business

loans.name: Kort

texts.en:
Mrs. V. Kort, 40, and her husband, Mr. Pisey Sem, 43, were married in 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children attend school and another one is still young. The family lives in a small village on National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

V. has been a farmer for almost 20 years and she has been cutting grass to sell for cows’ feed for six years. For the past 18 years, Mr. Pisey Sem has been a mason. He doesn’t have enough materials to work so they are requesting a loan of US$400 in order to purchase construction tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Hursanoy

texts.ru: Дехканова Хурсаной- женщина 40 лет. Замужем имеет 2-х детей. Хурсаной занимается, со своей семьёй переработкой пряжи вязанием шерстяных носков. Ей помогают невестка и дочка. Хурсаной реализует свой товар в городе Адрасмане и в городе Худжанде. У неё имеют надежные клиенты, у которых большой спрос. Хурсаной хочет закупить оптом пряжу на полученный займ.
texts.en:
Hursanoy D. is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. Together with her family, Hursanoy is involved in processing of yarn and knitting of wool socks. Her daughter-in-law and daughter help with the business. Hursanoy sells her merchandise in the cities of Adrasman and Khujand. She has reliable clients, ad her products are in high demand. Hursanoy wants to use this loan to purchase yarn wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale yarn purchase

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A., 36 years old, is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a trader. She trades in lace materials, textiles, and clothing materials. Lace material is popular in room and office decorations.

For lack of adequate working capital, Florence has been limited to buying small stocks of lace materials, which she sells through hawking. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the level to which she hopes to expand it. With the loan, she wants to make bulk purchases of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her expected profits to help provide her children with quality education.

She belongs to a village bank called "Adepa," which means "Good Things."

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria A. is from Dipolog City. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children. Desideria works in someone else's business, primarily selling personal products to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Desideria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Desideria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Desideria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: King Of Kings Group

texts.en:
Kwame is forty-three years old. He is married and has five children. He is a farmer/petty trader. Kwame runs a provisions store. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘King of Kings’. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors, and or farmers. They work to help their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Rosita Misksy

texts.en:
Rosita is 29 years old and married with two children. Her husband works as a security guard.  Rosita dedicates herself to the sale of soft drinks and beer as well as clothing and shoes.  

Rosita has been working with Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos for three years and belongs to the communal bank "Las Doncellas." She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in the sale of homemade popsicles. She then continued to expand her business, first moving into the sale of drinks and then into the sale of clothing and shoes. Rosita is pleased to have become more independent with the business she has created using her loans. Rosita will use this loan of 1000 soles to purchase more of the various items that she sells.   

Rosita's goal is to eventually have her own shop for the shoes and clothing that she sells.  She also wants to make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beer, shoes and clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bananas, cookies, sweets, applies, etc.

loans.name: Alozouhoin

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de qualité de toute sorte. Elle vend ses pagnes dans le quartier très vaste de Gbégnédji à Lomé. Elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Son commerce porte sur les pagnes Vlisco, Wax Hollandais et Hitarget. Elle reçoit ses commandes des femmes revendeuses de pagnes de qualité au Grand Marché de Lomé appelées les « Nanas Benz ». Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Vlisco, 10 pagnes Hitarget et 05 pagnes Wax Hollandais.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. She's a traveling saleswoman, who sells quality pagnes (colorful African cloth) of all sorts. She sells her pagnes in Gbégnédji, a vast neighborhood in Lomé. She's well known to many people. Her business concentrates on Vlisco, Wax Hollandais, and Hitarget pagnes. She gets her orders from women, called "Nanas Benz", who resell quality pagnes at the grand market in Lomé. To renew her stock, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

loans.name: Isabelito

texts.en:
Isabelito S., 44 years old, is a rice grower. He has four children who are all studying in school, the eldest being 15 years old. Currently, he tills a hectare of farm that he hopes could provide his family income to buy food and clothing and meet other basic needs.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy farming necessities, to obtain a bigger harvest. The loan will help him grow his income to realize his dreams for his children, which are for them to graduate college and find better jobs.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lidia Donatila

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia R. se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y zapatos, vive en la colonia flor del Campo, tiene 6 años de vivir en dicha colonia, las ventas las realiza de lunes a domingo, no descanza para vender su producto. los fines de semana sale a vender a diferentes caserios y pueblos cercanos al Departamento de Olancho como ser Jutiapa y Salama. viaja en autobus, dicho viaje le dura 3 horas y luego camina media hora para poder llegar al lugar en que vende toda su mercaderia, este viaje es duro pero ahi vende todo lo que lleva, esto hace que el tedioso viaje se convierta en algo productivo.
aqui vende su producto al credito y cuando regresa le pagan su mercaderia, viaja a este lugar cada 2 semanas.
lidia necesita el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa ya que ahorita no le ajustan los que compran, pudiera vender mas en jutiapa y salama. su meta es poder comprar un carro para transportarse a estos lugares y asi llenarlo de mucha mercaderia y vender mucho.

loans.use: compra de ropa para dama y caballero, zapatos de mujer, sandalias.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 35 years old and the mother of four children. She is a hard-working woman, and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells foodstuffs like bunches of plantains. She has been in the business for a long time. Blessing hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín vive en la calle 14 de Junio  de la zona  Pazanqueri de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive en alquiler tiene una hija, a la cual su esposa se dedica al cuidado. 

El trabaja como chofer, todavía debe un 40% de la movilidad con la que trabaja, el esta afiliado al sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, trufi 88.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor y otros accesorios de su vehiculo,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Fermin resides on June 14th Street in the Pazanqueri district of the city of La Paz. He lives in a rental property and his wife is in charge of looking after their daughter.

Fermin works as a taxi driver along Trufi Route 88 and is affiliated with the Eduardo Abaroa Union. His vehicle is out of commission 40% of the time.

He is requesting a loan to repair his engine and purchase accessories for his vehicle. At the moment, constant mechanical failures are preventing him from completing a full work day.

This is Fermin’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates that he is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs & vehicle accessories

loans.name: Nerm

texts.en: Mrs. Nerm V. is 54 years old and she lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 4-hectare rice field. Because this plantation is infertile and far from an irrigation system, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, a water pump, and gasoline to pump water to the field. Her husband, Mr. Kim Yorn, owns a mechanical and rice mill machine which have been hired by the villager. This couple has two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other a student. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a water pump, and gasoline.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Mrs. Saturnina L. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has two adult and two school-aged children. Saturnina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Saturnina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items like canned goods and other supplies

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn M. is from the town of Quezon San Isidro. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ronalyn owns and operates a bakery, selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Ronalyn earns approximately 4500 weekly PHP a month.

In 2009, Ronalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be her first from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
--------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Susan Adhiambo

texts.en:
Susan Adhiambo M. is a former grocery business woman in the market of Rongo, Kenya.  During the tenure of this business she trained at a tailoring institution and in the year 2002 she started her own tailoring business.

She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her stock order lasts a week so she restocks every week.  Her future plan is to venture into the house construction materials business. She would like a loan of Kshs.10,000.

loans.use: Add to her stock of materials.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Mr. Pao P. is 59 years old and lives in Toul Sala village in the Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ly Min, are farmers who own a piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. 

On this plantation, they face a problem because their field does not have enough water to support the rice field. Thus, Mr. Pao P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a watering machine to support the field. 

Mr. Pao P. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is employed in the World Vision organization.

loans.use: To buy a watering machine to support the field

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es:
la señora Gloria de Jesus C. tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de dos hijas, una de sus hijas ya tiene un bebe, viven en casa de un hermano suyo en el barrio suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome Valle.
 
Gloria se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de arreglos florales, tambien hace decoraciones para eventos especiales como bodas, cumpleaños , fiestas en general.
 
su deseo es construir su propia casa para darle un hogar digno a sus hijas y su nieto.
en estos momentos Gloria necesita el credito para comprar mas flores y materiales para decoraciones, quiere obtener mas ganancias para tener un buen capital para empezar a construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria de Jesus C. is 38 and has two daughters. One of her daughters already has a baby. They live in her brother’s house in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome Valley. Gloria makes and sells floral arrangements. She also makes decorations for special events like weddings, birthdays, and parties in general. Her wish is to build her own house in order to give her daughters and her grandson a decent home. Gloria now needs a loan to buy more flowers and materials for decorations. She wants to get more income to have a good amount of capital to begin building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flowers, decorative ribbons, vases, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Josue Francisco

texts.es:
Josue tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona netamente pesquera ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 5 años a la pesca industrial y a la comercialización de pescado. Durante los meses en que las bolicheras se lanzan al mar a pescar anchoveta, el se embarca como tripulante y en épocas de veda comercializa pescado comprándoselo a los pescadores artesanales y revendiéndolo en el terminal pesquero de la región.

Estas actividades le proveen los ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar sus gastos personales y para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. Josue desea obtener un capital fijo para poder seguir trabajando como vendedor de pescado de manera estable, ya que el precio del pescado se viene incrementando en los ultimos meses, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Josue es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador. El se siente comprometido con el desarrollo de su familia por lo que se esfuerza diariamente para salir adelante y seguir apoyandolos, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Josue is 25 years old; he is single and lives with his parents and brothers in the district of Santa Rosa, an area mostly known for its fishery some 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 5 years, he has worked in the fishing industry and in the commercialization of fish. During the months that the small dragnets go to the sea to fish for anchovies, he embarks as a crewmember and in times of closed season, he sells fish by buying it from artisan fishermen and reselling it in the fishing terminal of the region.

These activities give the necessary income that he needs to meet his personal expenses and to help support his family. Josue wishes to have steady income to keep working as a fishing salesman, in a stable job and the price of the fish has increased during the last months, and it is because of this that he is seeking a loan with Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for 1500 nuevos soles.

Josue is a very responsible and hardworking young man. He feels responsible with the development of his family which is why he works hard everyday to get ahead in life and to keep supporting his family. He has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated to be punctual and responsible when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish to support his business.

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr. Lester Antonio F. M.   él se dedica al servicio de taxi, el tiene un  año de trabajar en  este negocio, es soltero Es su segundo créditos con CEPRODEL el préstamo lo quiere pagar terminar de pagar su vehículo que lo utiliza para su negocio de taxi el espera que con este préstamo le vaya bien para crecer económicamente en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Lester Antonio F. M. provides taxi service. He has been working in this business for one year. He is single. This is his second loan with Ceprodel. He wants the loan to finish paying for the vehicle that he uses for his taxi business. He hopes that with the loan things will go well for him to grow economically in his business and in his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the car he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Cette femme est âgée de 32 ans, elle est très dynamique, en 2005 elle a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois, ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle exerce son activité dans le marché local de Gbossimé. Elle souhaite rehausser son stock, pour le réaliser elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander un prêt avec lequel elle achètera une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois et une  dizaine de sacs de maïs.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle participe aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady is 32 years old and is very dynamic. In 2005 she began selling charcoal and this business is going well for her. She carries it out in the local market in Gbossimé. She would like to increase her stock, and in order to do this she has contacted WAGES to request a loan, with which she will buy 20 sacks of charcoal and ten bags of corn. She is married and mother to two children. With the profits from her business she contributes to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal and bags of corn

loans.name: Diana Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Diana tiene  41 años de edad y es madre soltera. vive en casa propia junto a su hija. Trabaja  como obrera de campo desde hace 6 años en parcelas agricolas de la zona. Es una persona muy emprendedora que a salido adelante gracias a su trabajo. Solicita el crédito para terminar de tarrajear su vivienda. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa para tener una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra Diana Magdalena Y. A., agradece la ayuda que le podamos brindar a traves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Diana, 41, is a single mother; she lives in her own home with her daughter. She has worked as a field hand for the last 6 years in area farms. She is a very enterprising person who has gotten ahead in life thanks to her hard work. She is asking for funds to finish sealing the walls of her house. Her dream is to be able to finish building her house so that her quality of life will be better. Diana Magdalena Y. A. is grateful for whatever help we may be able to offer through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. Gisela es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos.
Gisela tiene mototaxis que da en alquiler diariamente, actualmente tiene 4 unidades, Gisela se encarga de la administración.
Gisela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de seguros para su moto.  Los sueños de Gisela son comprar carros y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gisela is 33 years old and a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank. She has three children. Gisela has four mototaxies which she rents out daily. She needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325) which she will use to buy insurance for her motorcycle. She hopes to one day be able to buy cars and help her children to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Insurance

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El Sr. A. A. Marcelino, vive en la urbanización Sebastían Barranca, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su madre quien es viuda. Trabaja como obrero de campo en agrícola la venta desde hace 2 años. Vive en casa de su hermano a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para apoyar con la realización de los acabados de la vivienda de su hermano a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. El Sr. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino A. A. lives in the neighborhood of Sebastían Barranca, which is part of the district of Santiago. He looks after his mother who is a widow. Marcelino has been working as a field laborer for two years. He lives at his brother’s house which is undergoing the final touches. Marcelino is requesting a loan to help complete the finishing touches to his brother’s house in order to provide a better quality of life for their mother. He is grateful for the support that has been provided with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Yanjindulam

texts.en: Yanjindulam G. lives with her husband and her family in a ger, a traditional housing tent in Uvs province, in the western part of Mongolia. Her husband works seasonally in a construction company as a decorator with a salary of 250,000 MNT while Yanjindulam operates a food retail business in their town. She had worked in her town as a nurse for more than 30 years and had been retired in 2009. Her current working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT and her daily revenue is between 80,000 and 90,000 MNT. She is planning to expand her small stall and says, “I am trying to afford my youngest son's tuition fees and planning to enlarge my small stall as a supermarket”.  Yanjindulam is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of food products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther W. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, beans and pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) measured by the cup to customers at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour and beans to sell.  

Esther is 45 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and provide necessary scholastic materials, like shoes, school bags, etc.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. She has been operating her business of selling charcoal and fresh fish to her neighbors and others for the past five years from home and at the market. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, Saumu wants to purchase ten bags of charcoal and a large amount of fresh water fish to re-sell. She experiences the major challenges of seasonality and competition in her business. 

With the profits from this loan, Saumu hopes to add some new rental rooms to earn more income. She currently rents a house with no electricity and piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is food. 

Saumu decided to work with Kiva Field Partner Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of charcoal and fresh water fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her house and to buy zinc sheets for her house

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo de 12 años que estudia, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio hace 10 años, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Reyna brinda servicio de bordado de prendas. Reyna inicio su negocio en casa alquilada y hace 1 año construyo su casa a donde se mudo hace una semana, Reyna también alquila cuartos en su casa, lo cual le genera mas ingresos.
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una carreta para que inicie con la venta de salchipollos.
Los sueños de Reyna son construir el segundo piso de su casa para alquilar y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Reyna is single, 33 years old, and has got a 12 year-old son that is in school. Reyna has a store in her house where she sells vegetables and general groceries. She began her business over 10 years ago, an activity that she realizes every day. Also, Reyna provides hemming services. She started her business in a rented house, but a year ago, she constructed her home which she moved into a week ago. Reyna also rents out rooms in her home in order to generate more income. She is a member of the Communal Bank Obreras and needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she would invest in the purchase of a cart so that she can begin selling salchipollos (a type of Peruvian hot dog). Reyna's dreams are to add a second floor to her house to rent out and for her son to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cart.

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en: Marrisa E. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old and is married with two infant children. Marrisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Marrisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Marrisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina esta Casada con el Sr. Esteban tienen Siete hijos que se encuentran estudiando en colegio y en la universidad, y otros ya casados e independientes, la Sra. Martina y su esposo nacidos en Potosí, Hace 20 años que llegaron a conseguir una pequeña parcela en quebrada Leon a 18 Km D. El Torno hacia el oeste en la cual Trabaja en la Agricultura, tambien se dedica a la ganaderia y fruticultura, tiene cítricos como ser: Mandarina, Maracuyá; pero el problema es que la fruta se cosecha una vez al año, por eso desea sembrar arroz y maiz, es para esta siembra que solicito el prestamo, para la preparacion D. la tierra y para la siembra D. estos productos, es una persona trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Martina is married to Esteban. They have seven children who are in high school and college, and others are married and independent. Martina and her husband were born in Potosí. 20 years ago, they were able to get a small land parcel in the Leon ravine 18 Km west of El Torno. She farms there and they have cattle and grow fruit. They have citrus such as tangerines and passion fruit. The problem is that the fruit is harvested once a year and because of that, she wants to grow rice and corn. That is why she is asking for the loan; to get the land ready and to plant these products. She is a hardworking person and she is very grateful to the institution for the support offeres in granting this loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do preparation and planting of rice and corn

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta C., 55, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Florante C., a retired pensioner, and mother of five adults, all of whom are already working and helping her with the household and finances. As of the present time, Violeta is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Violeta maintains a pharmacological direct selling business. She sells DXN, a local brand of herbal medicines and health supplements. Also included in the inventory are vitamins. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Violeta has always dreamed of having her house fixed and renovated. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying orders for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more spaghetti, tea, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Richard Kibet

texts.en:
Richard Kibet K., age 29, operates an Agrovet shop in the Njipiship market centre. He has been running this shop for the past year and has seen his business grow. He wants the business to grow further and has applied for a loan from KADET Ltd. This will be his first loan. He wants to buy veterinary medicines to add to his stock, since most of his clients are farmers. 

Richard supports his wife, Tegla K., with the income from his business. They do not yet have children. They live in Olechobose near the Njipiship market centre in Kilgoris Town. 
  
His desire for the future is to be able to open another Agrovet shop in Dikir center in Kiridon division.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicine to add to his stock

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta B. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, married with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals, especially Filipino delicacies like pork and chicken adobo, afritada, caldereta and sinigang na isda at baka to customers in the local community. In the picture you can see the actual business wherein there are lot of customers and her daughter who helps her in the business. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. She used this previous loan to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which she will invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of beans.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya U. is 27 years old.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in Tuv province in central Mongolia.  She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent, called a ger, on a small plot of land which they own for the past 10 years. Her oldest daughter attends a local primary school and her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

Sarantuya operates a clothes making and repair business in her town. She started her business in 2000, at first sewing only traditional Mongolian coats called deels. After years of successful operation, she was able to buy the necessary tools and equipment such as a  zig zag sewing machine, a multifunctional sewing machine, and a steam iron, which enabled her to make not only traditional clothes but also European style clothing. 

Sarantuya is a hardworking and honest woman. For the future, she plans to have her own sewing factory. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials and supplies for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood for making doors

loans.name: Mawulawoè

texts.fr: Madame Mawulawoè a 41 ans et est mariée. Elle a 3 enfants en charges.Elle est née à vogan et exerce son activité à Nyékonakpoè où elle habite. Elle fait la vente de pagnes au marché local de Nyékonakpoè. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1990 et s'approvisionne au Ghana à Accra. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter de nouveaux lots de pagnes et satisfaire plus de clients. La dame en question est celle qui est assise et habillé en tricot orange et jeans.
texts.en: Ms. Mawulawoè is 41 years old and married. She has three dependent children. She was born in Vogan and works Nyékonakpoè, where she lives. She sells traditional “pagnes” fabric at the local market of Nyékonakpoè. She launched this business in 1990 and stocks up in Accra in Ghana. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase new sets of “pagnes” and be able to serve more customers. She appears in the photo sitting, wearing an orange polo shirt and jeans.

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Analía Alcira

texts.es:
La sra. Analia V. es de Carapeguá, actualmente es separada, tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Vive con sus padres.
Se dedica como comerciante; vendedora ambulante de ropas Kalúa con una antigüedad de más de 3 años en dicho trabajo.
Se dedica a este trabajo ya que no cuenta con un estudio académico, comenta que cuenta con un buen ingreso y con más de 35 clientes activos.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías ya que cuenta con una demanda importante de mercaderías de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Analia Velazques is from Carapegua. She is separated, 31 years old, and she is the mother of 2 young children. She lives with her parents. She works as a merchant, selling itinerantly Kalua brand clothing for more than 3 years. She depends on her business because she doesn't have academic training. She perceives a good income and she has more than 35 active clients. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise. She sees an important demand for merchandise from her clients.

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito L. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old. Anecito is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Anecito owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Anecito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Anecito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecito is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for maintenance. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Anecito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for maintenance

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng S. is a 47-year-old village man who has had a job as a rice farmer since he was a single man.   He is also a local fisherman.   He spends over eight hours a day fishing, in and around Tunle Sap River.  He catches about 7 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Savoeurn.   She is 47 and works at farming. 

Soeng S. will use his loan to add to his savings to buy a used motorbike to transport his items to sell.  He will also purchase fishing implements to catch more fish.  Soeng S. and his wife are in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for transport, and to purchase fishing implements

loans.name: Fuente De Vida 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the member's group called Fuente de Vida (Source of Life), which is located in the rural outskirts of La Romana. She lives in a 'batey,' a community set up for workers who cut sugarcane in the blistering Dominican sun. This village was built for the sugarcane workers and their families. 
Despite the remoteness of these communities, Maria says she is happy to be able to live with her husband and two children of the 5 they have, in their small home. 

Maria is excited to take her third loan with Esperanza after having 2 years running this business. She started cooking and selling a dish called 'Pico y Pala', stir-fry using all of the chicken except for the breasts, wings and thighs. Now she has a fried food stall, where she sells different meats, plantain, fried round dough, and many other fried foods,. With this loan Maria is planning to buy all of the ingredients and she also she wants to start selling french fries. Her most difficult challenge is to have her own house. She like to listen music, and her dreams are to have her own house and to expand her fried food stall into a restaurant.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantain, oil, plates, potatoes, etc

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz I. is 60  years old, married and has four children. 

She has worked at purchasing and reselling cattle with her husband since 2004. Solmaz is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and children normal life conditions. Today they are working adults, thanks to her example. 

She would like to request a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase her inventory and to meet customer demands. Solmaz believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business. Solmaz deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase four cattle and fodder

loans.name: Nera

texts.en: Nera, 36, is a married woman with 4 children — two of them in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nera has a water-refilling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy water containers. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nera would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase container for her water refilling business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito P. is a married woman with three children. She is 38 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for fifteen years. 

She sells items like wine, seaweed and dry goods to the people in her community. She earns enough income with her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell in order to provide her customers with a wider variety of products from which to select. 

In the future, Charito hopes to manage a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more products to provide her customers with a wider variety of selections.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 38 años de edad, soltero vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope y a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Jaime es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), desde hace 4 años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa , los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Piura.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir sus gastos diarios.   También trabaja en el área agrícola en otros tierras.

Jaime solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para los mismos, ya que por falta de lluvias los pastos están escasos, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para venderlos a un mejor precio.  Jaime es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora que con empeño a sabido salir adelante en la vida para mejorar.
texts.en:
Jaime is 38 years old. He is single and he lives in his own house, equipped with running water and electricity, in the Mórrope district, approximately 40 minutes away from the Lambayeque department. In these areas people engage in agriculture, breeding and craftsmanship.

Jaime breeds sheep, an activity he has been running for 4 years. He breeds his animals at the back of his house, feeding them both with animal feed and in natural pastures. Once they have reached the ideal size and weight he sells them in the various markets of the town of Piura. Getting the best incomes in this way, he is able to pay for his daily expenses. He also engages in agriculture in other people’s lands.

Jaime asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN to buy more animals and their feed because, grass having become scarce for the lack of rain, he needs to keep them well fed to then sell them at a better price. Jaime is a very well-known member of his community because he is a responsible and extremely hardworking man who has been able to progress in life thanks to his determination.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and sheep feed.

loans.name: Sop Souleye Seck Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Souléye est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de huit femmes qui sont des voisines et peuvent se rencontrer facilement avant les réunions mensuelles.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Khoudia la responsable a trois enfants en charge; elle a une expérience moyenne de son activité qu'elle mène depuis un an mais elle est très dynamique. Elle s'approvisionne en huile, poivre, ail, bouillon etc.... dans les grandes boutiques et revend dans le village. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en bleu.


Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses produits et de diversifier ses marchandises en achetant des habits et chaussures pour gagner plus de bénéfices.


Avec les bénéfices réaliser: elle soutient son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et le bien être des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Souléye was created on May 12, 2010. It is made up of eight women who are neighbors and are able to easily meet before the monthly meetings. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Khoudia, the leader, has three children. Her experience in her activity is average; she has been practicing it for a year but she is very dynamic. She gets her supplies such as oil, pepper, garlic, and broth in large stores and resells them in her village.  She is on the right of the photo dressed in blue.

Her loan will allow her to increase her products and diversify her merchandise by buying clothing and shoes to make more profit.

With the profit she makes she helps her husband with the family’s expenses and contributes to the well being of the children.

loans.use: to purchase food products and various items for retail.

loans.name: Digna Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Digna es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro colonial, su cultura, tradiciones, gastronomía y su gente.
 
Doña Digna tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Digna es comerciante y labora vendiendo frutas desde que tenia 9 años edad,  no tienen un puesto propio por lo que vende recorriendo el mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para incrementar más su negocio. Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y está muy contenta de pertenecer a este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y solidarias.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Digna is a member of the communal bank "Nuevos Horizontes."  She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city that is renowned for the beauty of its countryside, its colonial center, its culture, traditions, cuisine and its people.

Digna is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 13, 9 and 7.  Her oldest is in middle school, the other two children are in a school in the city.   Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not own a home, so they live in rented housing. 

Digna is a retailer who has been selling fruit since she was 9 years old.  She does not have her own stall, so she sells from place to place in the market in her city.  She works every day without a fixed schedule. 

She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of fruit so that she can expand her business.  Digna has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years, and she is very content to belong to this group of hardworking and cooperative women. 

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Letty Margarita

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Letty, tiene 46 años de edad, está separada, pero de esa relación tuvo una hija que ya es mayor de edad y que aun vive con ella.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre tuvo que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su hija desde muy pequeña ya que fue padre y madre a la vez. Ella en la actualidad tiene un restaurante en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad, en el cual vende diversidad de platos para todos los gustos de sus clientes, ella vende almuerzos y platos a la carta, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hija y de una hermana, nos cuenta que antes ella vendía almuerzos por encargos pero con los créditos ella hace un año pudo poner su propio local y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por la sazón que les da a sus platos que la hacen única.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 ciclos es fundadora del Banco  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella al fin pudo poner su local.
 
Su sueño es tener un propio local ya que el que tiene es alquilado y esto se le lleva gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Subidita al Cielo” meet every 15 days in area with the same name in the neighborhood of San Pablo. This marginal urban area is the most populated section of the city of Portoviejo.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Letty. She is 46 years old, separated from her spouse, and has an adult daughter who lives with her. Letty is a determined woman who has always worked hard from the time her daughter was very young because she had to play the role of both father and mother. She currently manages a restaurant in one of the busiest parts of the city. Letty sells a variety of dishes that all of her customers enjoy, including lunches and à la carte items. She works every day and has help from her daughter and her sister. Letty says that she previously sold lunches by taking orders, but the loans she received last year helped her to secure a location. She says that she has done very well because her customers prefer the taste of her unique dishes.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for preparing her food. She is the founder of the Communal Bank and has participated in five loan cycles. Letty enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her to establish her business.

Her dream is to own her location since she currently uses a large part of her earnings to pay rent.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of cement to use in putting up new rental structures.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with two school-going children.  The family lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his children. 

David has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling from home to his neighbors and restaurant operators. He faces a major challenge of competition and disease outbreak in his poultry business. He dreams of owning his own plot in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her husband and three children. She operates a small convenience shop and is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase merchandise. She is a returning client and is grateful for the support she has received from Prisma. She hopes to continue using income generated by the store to make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, rice, beans, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: 1 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liễu has a service business providing housing rentals. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build a house for rent.

Liễu is 47 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 1 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. Liễu lives with her three dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liễu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liễu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liễu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liễu hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy more land of her own, and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a house for rent.

loans.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.en:
Junior is the chairman of the Community Bank “Winner Plus”, which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Junior runs a game room for children in his area, located mid-east of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2000. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Junior is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans six times and fully repaid them.  The loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes about $70 profit each week. Junior intends to purchase a generator for permanent power in order to generate additional profits. His ambition is to open another game room in another area. He is single, with a five year-old child.

loans.use: to buy a generator to keep the power permanent for his business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40-years-old and married with 4 children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of merchandise for her store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr: Madame Mame Penda  est une femme mariée de 56ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle exerce la profession d’enseignante  depuis plus de 25 ans.  Elle a choisi cette profession a cause de l’éducation de qualité qu’elle a reçue  et qu’elle voulait transmettre aux enfants qui sont en âge d’apprendre. Pour elle l’éducation est le seul gage de la réussite.  C’est une ancienne sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Elle a déjà  remboursé 7 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de provisions  qui  aideront  a assurer l’alimentation du foyer  durant son absence. Ce crédit contribuera à l’équilibre social de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mame Penda is a 56-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been working in the profession of teaching for over 25 years. She chose this profession due to the quality of education she received and because she wanted to pass down knowledge to children who are school-aged. To her, education is the only guarantee for success. 

She has been a long-time associate of a U-IMCEC branch since May 2003. She has already paid back seven previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs for buying provisions that will help to ensure a supply of food at home during her absence. This loan will help with stabilizing her family in life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for the house

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin, pictured here, sells grocery items from her home. She lives in a village along National Road Number Two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1984 and has three children: two sons and a daughter. One of her children is a garment worker, one is an electrician, and another one works for a hotel. 

Sarin is asking for a 1,000 USD loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son, who is an electrician, to use to get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her son

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 31 years old. She is married with four children. Evelyn has a stall where she displays her Balot (fertilized duck embryos boiled and eaten in the shell) and penoys (unfertilized boiled duck eggs) to sell. Research states that boiled duck eggs serve as a natural food supplement since they are rich in protein and other food minerals. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional eggs to process and sell. Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional duck eggs as a natural food supplement to sell.

loans.name: Bubutay

texts.ru: Бубутай  - 66 лет пенсионерка, вдова. Она долгое время работала швеей, а сейчас занимается пошивом национальных изделий, пользующихся высоким спросом среди местного населения.   Бубутай является матерью 7 детей и бабушкой 21 внука. В поисках источника финансирования, в 1995 году ее семья  начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Бубутай, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две  дойные коровы, один теленок,  три рабочие лошади и надел земли с картофелем и пшеницей.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубутай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Часть доходов от кредита Бубутай вложит в откорм скота, часть – в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bubutay is a 66-year-old pensioner and a window.  She had worked as a seamstress for a long time and is now involved in sewing national goods that are in high demand among the local population.  Bubutay is a mother of seven children and a grandmother of 21 grandchildren.  In search of a financial source, her family started their own animal husbandry and farming business in 1995.  Thanks to her diligent work, Bubutay has two dairy cows, one calf, three work horses and a plot of land with potatoes and wheat in her household today.  In order to further develop her business, Bubutay requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for the purchase of bulls.  Bubutay will invest part of the income from the loan into feeding livestock and part into house repairs.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie, a 55-year-old married mother of one, works very hard to provide for her family. Rechie has been operating a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 29 years, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Rechie would like to build and expand her business to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more store stock to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a motorcab driver while Marcelina manages their sausage and dried fish vending business. She was loaned the amount of PHP 14,900.00 to purchase additional sausage and dried fish to sell. 

Marcelina would like her business to become progressive so she will be able to sell and supply all over Mindanao. 

Marcelina is a pioneering member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional sausage and dried fish to sell.

location.town: Dipolog-Minaog, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Letecia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Zilda

texts.en:
Zilda, 40, is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a vegetable stall business selling at wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
