Mahdi is a 31-year-old, married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and their one school-age child. He has numerous responsibilities, especially covering his child’s education fees.

In 1995, he started his own upholstery business. He is now looking to target and attract more clients.

Currently, he is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more textiles in order to be able to carry on and improve his business activities, which he feels will increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to improve and expand his business by purchasing additional textiles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old, married to Peter and they are blessed with two children.  She has been selling second hand clothes for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Mary will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car and buy jerry cans

loans.name: Djomion Awanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJOMION AWANOU est composé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Julienne (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans et n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Julienne est mariée a un cuisinier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Julienne  vend du gari (farine de manioc) et du  mais depuis cinq ans à son domicile. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Julienne ensemble avec les membres du groupe DJOMION AWANOU sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du gari et du maïs.

loans.name: Fifatin Group

texts.fr: FIFATIN est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adakou Fulberte (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Adakou Fulberte est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Anicet. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adakou Fulberte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Adakou Fulberte et son mari. Pour cette raison, Adakou Fulberte vend des condiments et divers produits (des conserves, des savons, etc) dans sa boutiques depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Adakou Fulberte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Adakou Fulberte sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIFATIN, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et divers produits.

loans.name: Heremakono 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide et le mais avec FATOUMATA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is in sari-sari store (convenience store) business for ten years. She dreams to live in a decent home that she wants to renovate their house. She approached Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to buy sand, gravel, bags of cements, iron bars for house repair.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, bags of cements, iron bars for house repair

loans.name: Djahan

texts.en:
Djahan has her own shop. She is 32, married, has not children. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Kosalar village. 
Djahan and her husband settled in Khirdalan settlement
She borrowed the loan of $400 and bought the light industrial wares.
Djahan has been engaged in this business for 2 years.
Now she needs the loan of $1000 to begin selling clothing.

loans.use: To begin selling clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Muthoni Jasan intends to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a retired professor in the city of Coronel Oviedo, since she is still young, she decided to open a business of selling food and drinks at her own home. She is married and has an under age daughter. Her husband works in a cotton fluff remover company nearby their house. For this project Blanca has refrigerators and display cabinets. The loan will be use to buy merchandise to sell it at her shop. The profits will help to support the family and to pay her daughter’s school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una docente jubilada de la ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo, como es joven aún y ya se jubiló del magisterio, decidió abrir un negocio de comestibles y bebidas en su domicilio. Ella es casada y tiene una hija menor de edad. Su marido trabaja en una desmotadora de algodon cerca de su domicilio. Para este emprendimiento Blanca cuenta con heladeras y vitrinas, que le son de mucha practicidad en sus queaceres diarios. El destino del crédito sería la compra de mercaderías para venta en su local. La utilidad generada será utilizada para substistencia de la familia y costear los estudios de su hija.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines lives with her husband and four children in their own home since December 14 in the high altitude area of Llojeta in La Paz, Bolivia. Her husband works as a taxi driver and brings home 50 Bolivian pesos. With their savings, they bought some wool of a camelid and alpaca (like llamas). Ines started to spin the wool into blankets and would like to offer them for sale. She is looking for a good market to sell her products. Currently, she has orders for her blanket; she spins wool (converting the wool into fine thread) and has another helper that ultimately weaves it into a blanket. Ines brings it to a finish with braids and other designs, ready to be weaved. The loan she is looking is to buy more wool so she can rely on this occupation.

This is her first time with IMPRO but her business potential leads us to believe that Ines needs an opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en la calle desde 14 de diciembre de la zona de alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja con un taxi llevando a su casa una renta de 50 Bs. Con sus ahorros compraron lana de vicuña y alpaca e Ines empezó a hilar y se animo a ofrecer mantas, hallando un buen mercado para sus productos. Actualmente ella realiza mantas a pedido; ella hila (es el proceso de convertir la lana en hilo fino) y tiene otra persona que teje la manta. Ines le entrega el acabado fino con trencilla y otros, listo para el proceso del tejido. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más lana y poder seguir con su actividad.

No tiene antecedente con IMPRO, pero su buena disposición para con su negocio nos llevan a creer que Ines necesita una oportunidad.

loans.use: To buy more raw material

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio has a business selling articles for the home. He has three children, but his income is not sufficient to maintain his family. His wife asked for his support in making an extra effort, to open a small general store to have more income and be able to pay for the basic needs of their children and the family. This project started two years ago, and she helps with the sales in the shop. Together they have been able to grow. Antonio is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more merchandise and stock his store with every day grocercy items to sell, providing for his family, growing his business, and improving the quality of life. He offers to pay back the loan in 6 months, and very much appreciates your support in helping his family move forward.

Antonio se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar y tiene tres hijos, sin embargo no es suficiente lo que él gana para mantener a su familia, su esposa le pidió apoyo para hacer un esfuerzo extra y tratar de poner una tienda de abarrotes para tener un mejor ingreso y solventar las necesidades básicas de sus hijos y de su familia en general, este proyecto se inicio dos años atrás y ella lo apoya vendiendo en la tienda y juntos han logrado hacerla crecer.

Antonio solicita un préstamo de USD $ 1,200, que ofrece pagar en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda de abarrotes para así poder mantener a su familia, crecer con el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Él está muy agradecido por tu ayuda que le brindas para salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his store, grow his business, provide for his family and improve the quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mordern cooking equipments and cooking ingredients for his kiosk.

loans.name: Djiito 1 Group

texts.fr:
We are a group which has grown since we received our first Kiva loan through partner SEM. Our first experience proved to be very beneficial and today we have the courage to incorporate young women who, thanks to the renewal of our loan, will be able to receive training which will ensure our labor supply and will help young people in our area by ensuring them a better future. Thus with the money we will receive, we will buy basic inputs to carry out our work, which is to continue dying fabric, but this time on a larger scale in our eco-village. We thank you deeply for your belief in us with which we assure you that we will make sure your investment will be sustainable with the support of these young women who want to become financially indpendent. 

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer Liana Bianchi

Nous sommes un groupe qui s'est agrandi après que nous ayons reçu un premier prêt de Kiva à travers 

son partenaire qui est SEM. Notre première expérience s'est avérée très bénéfique et aujourd'hui, nous 

avons eu le courage d'intégrer des jeunes filles qui grâce au renouvellement de notre prêt, pourront avoir 

une formation pour assurer la relève et aussi aider au maintien des jeunes dans notre localité en leur 

assurant un avenir meilleur et plein de perspectives pour les échéances futures. ainsi donc avec l'argent 

que nous allons recevoir, nous allons acheter des produits de premières nécessité pour executer les 

taches qui nous attendent. C'est à dire continuer à faire de la teinture, mais cette fois-ci à grande échelle 

dans notre écovillage. Nous vous remercions vivement pour la confiance et nous vous assurons que grâce 

à votre confiance, nous allons faire en sorte que votre investissement soit perenne avec l'appui des jeunes f

illes qui veulent devenir indépendantes financièrement.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for dying of fabric and clothes

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
The municipality of El Sauce, León is known for being an area with very hard working residents. Such is the case of Juana, who, since a very young age, has worked as a high-quality dressmaker.

Juanita currently needs to invest in fixing up her home, which has become damaged by natural disasters. She has not been able to make the necessary repairs since her seamstress business is unstable as her clients do not need her services every day.

In order to improve her condition and invest in the reconstruction of her home, she has accepted several CEPRODEL loans. She states that they have been very helpful, and she has used them to purchase the necessary materials for fixing her humble home.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

El municipio El Sauce de León se caracteriza por ser una zona donde viven personas muy trabajadoras. Tal es el caso de la señora Juana que su actividad económica desde muy jovencita ha sido la elaboración de vestidos siendo una costurera que ha sobresalido por su alta calidad con que realiza sus trabajos.

Juanita actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su casa de habitación debido a que los fenómenos naturales la han dañado tanto y no ha logrado reparar los daños ya que el negocio de costurería es bastante inestable porque los clientes no están solicitando de su servicio todo el tiempo.

Para mejorar con esta condición e invertir en la reconstrucción de su hogar, ella ha realizado créditos en CEPRODEL y según cuenta le han sido muy útiles porque los ha utilizado para la compra de los materiales de construcción que utilizara en la construcción de su humilde vivienda.

loans.use:
Home improvements

Mejoras de vivienda

loans.name: Asia's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Asia is 46 years old and is a married woman with four children, ages 22, 18, 14, and 10. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 14 and 10. Asia is a tailor; she started in 1981. Every day, she works from 9 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in trading and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 64 years old and despite her age she is a very active person and she never stops working. She works from 7 am till 1 pm as a janitor in a school, and if the afternoons she washes and irons clothes. She lives in the neighborhood of Walter Ferreti with her only daughter. In this area very seldom there is water delivery (when it does it usually happens in the early morning), and in other occasions they have to buy it and as such the use of the restroom is not possible. She is asking for a loan in order to build a latrine in her house and that way minimize her water supply problem.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 64 años de edad y a pesar de su edad es una mujer activa que no para de trabajar, de 7 de la mañana a la 1 de la tarde trabaja como conserje en un colegio desde hace 22 años y por las tardes lava y plancha ropa ajena. Habita en el Barrio Walter Ferreti con su única hija, en ese barrio no llega agua casi todo el día, cuando llega lo hace en horas de la madrugada y en otras ocasiones tienen que comprarla por lo que el uso del servicio higiénico no es posible. Solicita un crédito para hacer una letrina en su casa de habitación y así minimizar un poco su problema de abastecimiento de agua para su casa..

loans.use: To build a latrine in her house.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha lives in the home of her parents. The house is on 21st of September Street in the Vila Ingenio zone located in the city of El Alto. She has a daughter of three years and her husband works in the Department of the Interior of La P. (here meaning the entire territory of La P., not the city)

She is dedicated to the making of wool blankets and scarves for ladies. Said production is sold in the main fair of the city.

The loan will be destined for the purchase of wool wholesale, which will permit her to reduce her costs.

This is the third loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha vive en casa de sus padres, la casa esta en la calle 21 de septiembre de la zona Vila Ingenio ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene una hija de tres años y su esposo trabaja en el interior del departamento de La P. (aquí se habla de todo el territorio no la ciudad)

Se dedica a la confección de mantas y chalinas de lana. para señoras, dicha producción es vendida en la principal feria de la ciudad.

El crédito será destinado para comprar lana al por mayor, eso le permitira reducir sus costos.

Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase wool wholesale for her business making wool blankets and scarves.

loans.name: Dijana

texts.en:
Dijana is a woman from Derventa. She is not married and has 2 children.

She currently works in production in a shoe factory. Her monthly salary is 400 KM (Bosnian Marks).

This is her first loan, which she requested in the amount of 1,200 KM ($950). To add to her income, she now wants to buy seeds to plant in flower beds, and sell these seedlings to farmers.

She also plans to keep some of the seeds for herself and grow vegetables to sell and to use for food in her home.

loans.use: To buy seeds and plant vegetables

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. supplies several local businesses with fish and also sells drinks. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Efua and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Dijana

texts.en:
Dijana is a young woman from the town of Derventa. She is married and her husband has a job as a construction worker. Right now, Dijana is unemployed. She is taking out her first loan in the amount of 1000 KM (US$ 775) to start a small baking business. She wants to focus on making cookies and other desserts that she can sell to people to use for weddings, parties, and other events.

Dijana needs this money to buy some start-up supplies and all the necessary baking ingredients. It is Dijana's wish to produce a lot of different types of cookies and serve a good number of customers. She hopes that this business will provide a good steady income for her family, as her husband's salary is not enough to support them for long.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and materials necessary for baking

loans.name: Xochiquetzalli

texts.es: Xochiquetzalli al igual que su esposo el señor Héctor tienen una niña pequeña, a la que aman mucho y por eso buscan salir adelante, por su parte la señora Xochiquetzalli tiene una tiendita en su misma casa, lo cual no le impide ver por la seguridad de su hija, el cuidado de su esposo y los quehaceres del hogar, por lo mismo esta solicitando este préstamo para comprar mas mercancía para su negocio y hacerlo crecer, “así darle a su hija y a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, demostrando que en la vida uno puede lograr sus sueños…”
texts.en:
Xochiquetzalli and her husband, Hector, have a young daughter, whom they love very much. She is the reason why they are always looking for a way to get ahead in life. Ms. Xochiquetzalli owns a general store that she runs from home, which does not prevent her from looking after her daughter, taking care of her husband, and getting the household chores done. For this reason, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her business and make it grow, thus, she can give her daughter and her family a better lifestyle, proving that one can reach his/her dreams in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Isabella M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Isabella has been running a café business since 1990. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Isabella currently earns about 50 USD from her business and is requesting a loan of 275 USD in order to buy additional utensils, cooking oil, rice and maize flour. In the future, she plans to establish another café. Isabella thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy utensils and cooking supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 134, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos, 6 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja viajando como jefe de campamento. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.n.nEn la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio de venta de comida “Menú”. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado y comprar lo necesario para preparar sus deliciosos platos de comida y brindarle lo mejor a sus clientes. nnCon este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 7 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 5 kilos de carne, 6 kilos de pescado, verduras, etc. nnGracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido y por ende tendrá la oportunidad de darle una mejor educación a su menor hija.n
texts.en:
Ms Julia belongs to the Community Bank "San Fernando II", located at 134 Jr. Sinchi Rosa, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the administrative division of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of seven children, six of whom are grown up, while one is still dependent on her. She is married and her husband works travelling as a camp director. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in selling food. She has worked with the community bank for six years. Currently she continues with the same business selling lunch menus. She wakes up early to go to the market and buy the necessary items to cook her delicious meals and bring the best to her customers. With this loan of S./ 2,500, which will be repayed in 4 months, she will buy 7 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 5 kilos of meat, 6 kilos of fish, vegetables and more. Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has grown, and she will have the opportunity to give her youngest daughter a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, seafood etc.

loans.name: Los Canarios Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado "Los CanaR."  están representado por la señora Lorena Silvia. En el grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como al comercio  de ropa, zapatos, comida, a la elaboración de pan, prendas de vestir y algunos de los socios se dedican al servicio mecánico, contracción y a la elaboración de muebles. Todos los integrantes del grupo  se conocen ya que residen en el mismo barrio por lo que su compromiso con el grupo es de responsabilidad y compromiso. El financiamiento esta destinado al incremento de insumos y materiales a la venta así como a la compra de herramientas de trabajo. Los socios (as) ya trabajaron en otras institución en grupos solidaR. por lo que tienen experiencia en esta modalidad de financiamiento, ellos (as) están concientes de la responsabilidad que implica un crédito pero saben que para un futuro mejor para sus familias vale la pena el esfuerzo. Es la primera vez que trabajan con la Fundación Agrocpital pero por la convicción y la determinación que tienes los socios (as) se las da la oportunidad de mejor su calidad de vida através del crédito.
texts.en:
“Los CanaR.” group is represented by Lorena Silvia. They perform different activities such as selling clothes, shoes, and food, as well as making bread, clothes, and furniture. Some members work as mechanics and construction workers. All members know each other as they live in the same neighborhood and therefore they have a strong commitment towards the group. Financing will be used to purchase supplies, goods and work tools. Most the members of the group have already worked with other support groups, so they are aware of the responsibility of requesting for a loan but they believe it’s worth the effort, because they are doing it for a better future for their families. This is the first time they will work with Fundación Agrocapital. Their commitment and determination is driven by the opportunity to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: Azra M. Shafique Group

texts.en:
Azra Baji is a 44 year old married lady who resides in a famous historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan.  She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. 

Azra Baji completed her education up until the 8th standard.  She couldn’t study further due to the low financial circumstances of her house.  Her mother was a seamstress and she delivered her art to Azra because she believes that this is a tool that every woman can use in very crucial circumstances. 

Azra's husband's name is M. S., and he is a plumber by profession.  She has three kids: one son and two daughters.  Her son belongs to a cloth selling business.  Her daughters sell plastic shopping bags in the market and earn a profit.  Azra baji is also involved in her daughters' business.  They make contributions to improve their financial condition. 

Azra Baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her son’s cloth selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few more members of her locality.  Maqsoodan Baji and Zareena Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.  Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.  Sheena Baji wants a loan to buy religious books (Islamic) for her book shop. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Da

texts.en: Mrs. Da P. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Houy Im, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, they do not earn enough income to provide a good living. Thus, Mrs. Da P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition with this loan. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a company while the other is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband and her child are shown on the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Oladeji

texts.en: Oladeji O. is 45 years old and married. He sells planks of wood, and is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to sell. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 42-year-old woman. She earns a living through her work as a meat vendor. Her husband encourages her to work because he is confident that she will be successful. 

Imelda started her business when the owner of the slaughter house started to trust her and lent her meat on a consignment basis. This allowed her the flexibility she needed. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase additional meat to sell. 

Imelda is married and blessed with 4 children. Two of her children study in school while the other two have already graduated. Her children are the reason why she plans to have her own slaughter house one day, to increase her profit.  

Through her hard work, she dreams that her youngest child will finish her school studies. She also hopes that after a year she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase 10 kilos of beef and 20 kilos of pork

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 6 years. She is a bites (snacks) seller. She belongs to Mkimbizi "A" west group loan (group code 2019).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 11 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items in order to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Christina is 50 years old, married, and has nine children, ages 32, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, 18 and 16. She also cares for nine additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items in order to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  exerce le commerce de matériaux de construction  et d’aluminium. Il exerce son activité depuis 2003  dans un magasin. Il voudrait ajouter à son commerce la vente de ciment. Il a déjà obtenu un crédit qu’il a bien remboursé, il demande alors de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de ciments. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants, sa femme est une revendeuse.
texts.en:
This gentleman owns a business selling aluminum and construction materials. He has done this work in a store since 2003. He would like to expand his business to include the sale of cement. He has already accessed a loan through WAGES which was repaid in full. He is now requesting a second loan in order to purchase 50 bags of cement. He is married and is the father of three children. His wife works as a retailer.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement for resale

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi earns a living selling foodstuffs such as yam, cassava, corn and various traditional dishes. She started this business five years ago, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell. Bisi is 41 years old, married and has one child. She wishes to express her gratitude to all Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Teresita is just starting this business.

In 2005, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is a 30-year-old trader. She is the the mother of three children, all of whom are now in school. Lydia is widowed: her husband died after a prolonged illness.

Lydia is a very resourceful mother who supports her family through hard effort. She earns a livelihood through the sale of used clothing, curtains, and bedsheets. The sale of these items has a large market share in Ghana, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a successful market for many women. Lydia has been in this business for a year now. She usually concentrates on bedsheets and used towel sales. In addition, she also trades in grocery products: she tells us that this has generated extra income to feed her family.

She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing as well as to buy additional grocery products to increase her inventory. She would eventually like to have enough capital to rent a storefront from which to trade.

She believes this loan will help her save for her children's future.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig D. lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small repair shop for bicycles. He opened his repair shop in 2008 and since then, his business has stabilized as the locals get acquainted with the service he offers. His business capital has increased from 300,000 MNT to 800,000 MNT. In the future, he hopes to expand his repair shop by selling second-hand accessories for cars and trucks. As the cycling warm season approaches, he expects more customers for his bicycle repair shop. He requests a loan to purchase more bike accessories for his business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle repair supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old, married, and a mother with five children. Three of them are in school whilst the rest are working. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their future. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tin tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. She says these products sell very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With six years experience in her business she wants to add other foodstuffs like maize, eggs, and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this would be possible with the help of loan. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tin tomatoes etc. She is convinced that the loan would help her increased her stock in the event of price hikes and also to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy food items for resale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
66-year-old Elvira L. is the mother of two children. Now she is also a supportive grandmother to her grandchildren. After the death of her husband, Elvira had her children and grandchildren to think about and to have a reason for living. 

Her membership in ASHI since 1997 has given her a chance to have her own business and to keep herself busy. From an initial loan of Php 5,000, she can now borrow Php 25,000 and can even reach the peak amount in the future, because she has maintained her excellent performance thoughout her membership in ASHI. Therefore, Elvira's wish of expanding her business with the help of her eldest child, who is her business partner, is about to happen, because it has now grown, although not yet to the extent that she expects. 

When she will reach the highest amount ASHI can offer to lend her, she plans to rent a space in the market where she can sell dried fish. With the opportunities she can get from her membership in ASHI, she can also help her children send their children to school. When she passes away, at least she has made her business successful and her children can own a business some day.

loans.use: To buy dried fish. A small amount will be used to travel to buy the product.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. Mary works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Mary is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She also deals in sugar. Mary buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana. She supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She has been in business for over twenty – five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Reyna es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Reyna tiene una panadería en su casa, en donD. elabora panes típicos, cuenta con 3 operarios, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados y terminales terrestres.
Reyna necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. leña y harina.
Los sueños D. Reyna son que sus hijos estudien y comprar maquinas para implementar su horno.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the communal bank Amor y Verdad (Love and Truth). She is married, 35 years old, and has 4 children. Reyna has a bakery in her house, where she bakes typical (Peruvian) breads with 3 workers. She makes the majority of her sales in the markets and in bus terminals.

Reyna needs a loan of 2,500 soles that she will use to purchase firewood and flour.

Reyna dreams that her children will be able to get an education and that she will be able to purchase equipment to improve her oven.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase firewood and flour

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en: Miroslav is married with two children. For the last two years he has run a business renting office space in a building that he co-owns. Affordable prices and good customer service attract clients and make his business a success. Miroslav would like to borrow money to do some final work inside the building so that he is able to rent out all the space. He is requesting 11,000 UAH to complete the work.

loans.use: To finish the interior of the building

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia Torrez R. tiene la edad de 50 años, es una mujer muy responsable con su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella dio inicio por cuenta propia ya que necesitaba generar ingresos para sufragar sus gastos, a pesar de que Ana no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera, logro salir adelante con este humilde negocio, ya que ella se hace cargo de su Mama. Ana tuvo ciertos desafíos como fue el aumento de los productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, detergentes, gaseosas, pollo y ciertos productos para el hogar. Su deseo es lograr tener hijos ya que hasta el momento no tiene.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia Torrez R. is 50 years old and a responsible businesswoman. She has managed a small grocery store for more than 7 years. Ana started her business as a means of generating income to cover her expenses. Despite not having the opportunity to attend school, she is able to get ahead and take care of her mother because of her modest business.

Ana has encountered some challenges, such as not being able to increase her inventory. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy candy, detergents, sodas, chicken, and other household products. She would like to have children but does not have any at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase inventory

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is from the village of Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to reinvest in her business, as well as purchase food and medicine for her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 29 años, ella es una mujer muy proactiva para los negocios. Es madre de 3 hijos que son estudiantes, vive con su pareja, que es el padre de sus hijos, quien la apoya en su negocio. 

En una parte de su terreno tiene un pequeño aserradero donde toda la madera que compra la convierten tablillas listas para la venta. En esta labor ya tiene un periodo de 6 años y le está yendo muy bien, generalmente lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la administración del mismo, y estar pendiente de sus trabajadores. Nelly considera que su actividad le es rentable porque es un negocio propio, cuenta con clientes regulares y sus ventas son diarias, por lo que obtiene ganancias satisfactorias.
Para más adelanta quiere constituir un local para que su negocio tenga el espacio adecuado para su mejor funcionamiento.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que ha notado que sus compañeros son personas responsables, y sobre todo, muy organizadas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más madera para seguir activa en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelly is 29 years old; she is a very proactive woman with businesses. She is the mother of 3 children who are students. She lives with her partner who is the father of her children and who supports her in her business.

On part of her land, she has a small sawmill where she converts the wood she buys into ready to sell clapboards. She has had this business for a period of 6 years now and it’s going very well. In general, what she likes most about this job is managing the business and keeping an eye on her workers. Nelly considers her work to be worthwhile because it is her own business; she has regular customers and daily sales, so she has been able to obtain satisfactory earnings. In order to move forward, she wants to build a place for her business that has adequate space for making the business run better.

This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP and what she likes about the communal bank is that she noticed that her partners are very responsible, and above all, very organized. With funds she is requesting, she will buy more wood to keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a mother of four currently living in Asugkah, just outside of Bamenda.  

Through various struggles, Rachel has managed to keep a positive attitude that is reflected in her smile.  Rachel's most significant pain was the passing of her son.  She has also been dealing with being the sole provider for her family since her husband recently abandoned her and the children.  Despite her troubles, Rachel is very hopeful for her future and that of her children.   

Rachel has been a GHAPE member for 18 years!  She is currently on her ninth loan and has successfully repaid each one.  She has requested GHAPE for an additional loan in order to purchase socks and shoes to be sold at retail.  After an exploration into various businesses including the management of a farm and raising of livestock, Rachel believes her shoe and sock sales will not only succeed but be her best business to date because she can sell year round and there is little environmental risk.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of socks and shoes for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth F. is 52 years old and she is happily married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client. Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

Ruth sells crates of drinks in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season.

She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

Ruth says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Бадалова Хосият проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 65 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Хосият более 20 лет проработала по специальности, "кассиром". Потом Хосият решила начать свое дело и она открыла продуктовый магазин рядом с домом. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 9 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hosiyat B. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 65 years old, a widow and has 4 children. Hosiyat had worked as a cashier for over 20 years. Then, Hosiyat decided to start her own business and opened a food store near her house. She has been involved in this business for over 9 years. She is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Billy Atieno

texts.en:
Billy Atieno O. started her tailoring business in 2008 after her tailoring course training. She is married and blessed with a child.

Billy Atieno’s main reason for joining K-MET was to work as a community health worker with the community, especially the widows and orphans in Rongo, Kenya.

Billy Atieno would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 to expand her tailoring business. She says her clothes are selling like hot cakes in Rongo market.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina M. is 38 years old, single and was ill for 24 years of her life. Just recently, she had the courage to undergo an operation to remove a cyst from her ovary. One of the reasons why she had to endure the ailment she had for so long was because she lacked the money to pay for the operation.  Moreover, she felt she had no one encouraging or supporting her morally.

Filomina lives with her 69-year-old mother and she acts as a provider for herself, mother, and other close family relatives. It was through ASHI, one of Kiva's field partners in the Philippines, that she had savings which she used to spend for her operation. Loans from ASHI have also enabled her to start up and maintain a small “sari-sari” (variety) store business. Little by little, Filomina’s business is growing, but it's not growing as fast as she'd hoped because  the living expenses incurred by her family and the cost of her medicine is almost equal to her income.

Filomina’s health is now in better condition after her operation, and she's gotten good post-operative results from her doctor regarding her condition. She is excited to grow her “sari-sari” store. She wishes to increase the inventory of goods in her store for the convenience of people in their village, which is far from the main market.  Moreover, Filomina wishes for a better kind of life for both her mother and herself. Therefore, for her dreams to come true, she is  requesting to borrow a much larger amount from ASHI this time.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of goods/foods for a "sari-sari" (variety) store.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar A. is 30 years old and is single. He lives with his parents and supports them financially.

Anar is a small-business entrepreneur who sells fruits and vegetables which he buys from the local farmers. His dream is to get married in the next several years and for this purpose he works very hard to earn more profit.

Anar is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal goods to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao P., age 26, is married and lives with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has one young child. She is employed at a local garment factory and earns approximately US$3 gross per day. By doing this she is able to cover her family expenses, particularly her children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2000. 

Her husband weaves Cambodian traditional silk at home, earning an income of US$3.30 per day. Their standard of living has improved since P. has been involved in this business. P. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more silk for resale in the city. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more silk for resale

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
En el barrio las colinas Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor Carlos Roberto Martínez  realiza su trabajo como contratista en el municipio de Somotillo y sus comarcas aledañas  realizando de todo tipo de obras de construcción.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar la compra de 150 bolsas de cemento para la finalización de una obra que el esta llevando acabo en el barrio Cataluña municipio de Somotillo.
texts.en:
Carlos Roberto M. works as a building contractor in the neighbourhood of Colinas in the town of Somotillo and the surrounding region. Mr M. does all types of building work and is in need of a loan to buy 150 bags of cement to finish a building project in the Cataluña neighbourhood of Somotillo in which he is currently involved.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 150 bags of cement to finish off a building project.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís es instructor de gimnasio, él es un joven que tiene 25 años que se caracteriza por ser responsable y que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a su familia. 

José Luís es un joven emprendedor que abrió en la ciudad del Urubamba un gimnasio “Luis Gym” que cuenta con 32 maquinas,  él nos cuenta que al principio sus amigos le ayudaban con la atención del cliente pero actualmente sus amigos trabajan para él. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.     

José Luís pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son cuatro años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina trotadora que cuesta aproximadamente de 2000 soles y pronto va inaugurar un gimnasio  en la ciudad de Calca. El anhelo del socio es abrir una cadena de gimnasios por el valle sagrado. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
José Luís is a gym instructor. He is a youth of 25 years who is characterized as being responsible, and who is always on the lookout for opportunities to get ahead. He supports his family with his daily efforts. José Luís is an enterprising youth who opened a gymnasium in the city of Urubamba called "Luis Gym," that has 32 machines. He tells us that at the start his friends helped him attend to the customers, but currently his friends work for him. He has had this business for 4 years, and it has gone very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. José Luís belongs to the communal bank "Tercer Milenio," that works with the Asociación Arariwa. He has belonged to this communal bank for 4 years. His first loan was for 100 dollars that he invested in his business. Currently, he needs a loan to buy a treadmill that costs about 2,000 Peruvian soles. Very soon he is going to open a gym in the city of Calca. His wish is to open a chain of gyms in the Sacred Valley. He is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and he pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a treadmill

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 39-year-old married man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He runs a barbershop, where he offers his services cutting hair and giving facial treatments. He has been in this profession for the past nine years. 

Today, for the third time, he is applying for a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors and shaving blades) to increase the income of his barbershop. He always repaid his previous loans on time. These loans allowed him to improve his work by purchasing the necessary tools for his work because when he first opened his business, he had difficulty buying these necessary items.

loans.use: To buy chairs, scissors and shaving blades

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha T. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Editha is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as cotton, candies, coffee, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Editha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Editha from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a resident of Boreawla, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She is the wife of S. A.. She owns a 3-room house, which she has lived in with her family for more than 30 years. 
 
A very talented lady, Sakina operates a business selling vegetables. She sells the vegetables at her home. She places them in the corner of the garage, and her neighbors come to her to purchase the vegetables. She has been doing this work for more than three years. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
 
Her husband is a rickshaw driver. A rickshaw is a local three-wheeled motor vehicle. He has been in this profession for the past five years. He generates an income of PKR 500 per day. They both use their income to manage their family's financial expenses and to save some money for rainy days.
  
Sakina is applying for a loan from Asasah so that she can invest in her vegetable selling business by purchasing more vegetables. Expanding her business will help her generate a good income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bryan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bryan de 29 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general el ofrece sus mercaderías de manera ambulante, porque tiene una amplia variedad de productos. Actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos pues se acerca el día de la madre y necesita complacer los pedidos de sus clientes. Desde muy joven  inicio con este negocio, pues por medio de su hermana y su esposa fue que el decidió integrarse en esta actividad que ha sido muy provechosa para su familia. Solicita el préstamo a Fundación para la compra de más mercaderías. Sueña con mejorar cada día su actividad pues lo importante es relacionarse con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Bryan, who is 29 years old, is a merchant. He makes his living selling general merchandise, and he offers his products via a mobile business because he sells a wide variety of products. He currently has a lot of orders because Mother's Day is approaching, and he needs to complete his customers' orders. He started his business when he was quite young. His sister and his wife encouraged him to get into this business, and it has been very profitable for his family. He is requesting the loan from Fundación in order to purchase merchandise. He hopes to continue to improve his business because it is very important to build good relationships with his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar D. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and child in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in Uvs province of western Mongolia. His wife works as cleaner in a local restaurant while his child stays at home. 


Otgonbayar operates a raw material business in his town. He started his business with the help of his older brother. Otgonbayar operates his business seasonally. He purchases skins and wool from herders and sells them for a profit at the central market. His daily profit ranges from 500 to 1000 MNT. 


Otgonbayar is an open-minded and easy going person. He is requesting a 390,000MNT loan to purchase more livestock skins at wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sonia Emely

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 25 años de años de edad, reside en Cacaópera del departamento de  Morazán   está acompañada tiene tres hijos entre las edades  de 1 a 8 años, vive con su compañero de vida, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (tienda).
Por la necesidad de ingresos  ella decidió iniciar el negocio el cual lleva cuatro años de manejarlo ya que en la única tienda por la zona, el negocio a prosperado, atiende en un horario de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm sus clientes son vecinos y personas que residen por la zona.
Actualmente Sonia solicita un préstamo para adquirir productos como son Azúcar, bebidas carbonatadas, boquitas  como churros  y otros, este dinero le ayudara a solventar la demanda de sus clientes, obtener más ingresos y solventar las necesidades familiares. 
Las aspiraciones de  Sonia son, ver crecer su negocio y con las ganancias que obtenga arreglar la casa de habitación y apoyar a sus hijos dándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
To earn an income, Sonia decided to start a business, which she has been managing for four years. Since hers is the only store in the area, it has done well. She works from 6 am to 8 pm. Her customers are her neighbors and people that live in the area. Sonia is requesting the loan in order to acquire products such as sugar, carbonated drinks, and snacks such as churros, among others. The loan will help her respond to the demand of her clients, earn a higher income, as well as help in meeting her family's needs. Sonia hopes to see her business grow and with the money she earns she hopes fix up her house and support her children by offering them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, carbonated drinks, snacks such as churros, among others

loans.name: F. Comfort

texts.en: Madame Comfort A. is 40 years old and lives in Lome, Togo with her husband and two children. Since 1990 she has been working at the Hedzranawoe Market in Lome selling used clothing. She is now requesting her first loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the city of Macupa tangub City. She is 49 years old. Rosita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from retailing dry goods like flakes, shampoo, and soap in the local community . Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Karina Ruth

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserio Rama Tepo, una zona rural del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de abarrotes en general en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Este negocio es importante porque le brinda los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia ya que, como su padre trabaja en la agricultura, necesitan de una actividad que les brinde recursos permanentes para poder salir adelante.

El negocio goza de mucha acogida gracias a la calidad de trato que ofrece y a que la bodega les provee de productos de consumo diario que no pueden obtener facilmente ya que la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del pueblo más cercano.

Karina desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,  por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Karina ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y con el fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra contenta ya que gracias al apoyo de Kiva su negocio ha podido avanzar. Karina es una joven responsable y que gusta mucho de la actividad que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and brothers in the Rama Tepo neighborhood, a rural zone located in the Mochumí district, within the Lambayeque province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She’s been selling groceries from a home-based store for more than one year. This is an important business because it brings in the income that she needs for her personal expenses and for supporting her family. Her father works in agriculture and they need a steady income in order to get ahead. The business attracts many customers, thanks to the service she provides and because the shop is stocked with daily food items that are not easily obtained within the zone; it is located far from the nearest town. Karina would like to expand her business to satisfy her customer demand, so she is requesting this loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. She will use the money to invest in more grocery items to meet her objective. Karina has worked with our institution, and Kiva’s backing, in the past. She is happy and, thanks to Kiva’s support, her business has been able to get ahead. Karina is a responsible young woman who enjoys her work very much. Her neighbors and acquaintances know her as a confident person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en: Nurgul S. is leader of this group. She is forty-eight and married with four children: her daughters are twenty two, seventeen and eleven and her son is five years old. Her husband is an ecology inspector. Nurgul sells convenience goods, a business she started twelve years ago with initial investment of 20,000 soms: she purchased a one-room flat and converted it into a shop. Her monthly income is 7,000 soms. With the profits from her business, she has been able to purchase a house and a car. Nurgul is applying for a loan in order to purchase convenience goods to increase her turnover which will also increase her profits. In the future, she is planning to increase her turnover further and give her daughters an opportunity to receive higher education at the institutions of higher education in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. About the other group members: Gulzat Z. is treasurer of the group. She is forty-five and married to a truck driver. She makes and sells national handicrafts for the house. She started her business six years ago with 6,000 soms obtained in the form a loan from microcredit company MCC Mol Bulak Finance. Her monthly income is now 1,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase materials for making more national handicrafts. In the future, she is planning to expand her business. Zheenbiubiu U. is forty-five and married with three sons who are twenty-five, twenty-four and eight years old. Her husband is a teacher at the local music school. Together with other members of her family, Zheenbiubiu runs a business providing music and master-of-ceremonies at various family celebrations and other events. They started their business six years ago with rented musical equipment and now they make 15,000 soms each month. With the profits from their business, they were able to purchase musical equipment, build a house and pay for their son’s marriage. In the near future, with help of their business, they are planning to accomplish the marriage of their second child. Jumagul A. is twenty-six and married with a five-year-old daughter. Jumagul works in a barbershop and her husband went to work in Russia to make money. With the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell. In the future she wants to save money and rent a pavilion in Bishkek and start providing hairdressing services. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more convenience goods for her store

loans.name: Nemicia

texts.es: Nemicia tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. muy pequeña aprendió a cultivar la tierra, le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas. Con el pasar del tiempo, ahora trabaja junto a su esposo, sembrando maíz y papa, actividad que le ayuda en su economía y en la educación D. sus hijos. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho el trabajo, fue lo único que aprendió desD. niña y lo hace muy bien, es así que logró independizarse. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino que, según dice, es un negocio seguro ya que venD. sus animales mensualmente, recibiendo regulares ganancias. Como es una mujer muy empeñosa para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además D. comprar más cabeza D. reses. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono, semillas, así como también contratará mano D. obra para que le ayuD. en la siembra.
texts.en:
Nemicia is 61 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home. She grew up learning to farm, and she liked to help her parents with their farming chores. Time passed, and she now works with her husband, growing corn and potatoes, which helps her with finances and her children’s upbringing. She states that she enjoys the work, that it is all she has known since childhood. Because she is good at what she does, she has been able to support herself. She also raises cattle and sheep, which she calls a reliable business. She sells animals each month, generating steady earnings. Because she is highly committed, she plans to grow larger quantities in the future, and also to buy more cattle. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is happy to know that she has financial support. She has always been consistent in making her payments, and she enjoys belonging to her communal bank, because all the members are reliable and support one another. She thanks those who make it possible to have the loan, which will serve her in growing her business. She will use the loan to purchase bags of fertilizer, seeds, and will also hire labor to help her with the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar sacos de abono, semillas y mano de obra para que le ayude en la siembra.

loans.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Chimedtsogzol D. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His oldest son is a student and his daughter attends a secondary school while his wife currently stays at home. 

Chimedtsogzol has been operating both an animal husbandry as well as agriculture business with his family's help since 1970.  He has gained a lot of experience from running his businesses. In the 30 years of operation, he has been able to provide for his family and to pay his children's tuition fees.  For the future, he hopes to expand both his businesses. He is a very hardworking man and says, "my dream is to expand my business so that we can purchase houses for my children in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia" He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Carmen Giovanna

texts.es:
Carmen de 33 años, vive en el Guasmo  de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).   

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos Yambal, trabajan con el código de la prima como vendedora oficial, cuando tubo capital compro productos para tener en stop. En la actualidad desde muy temprano ofrece los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. una de las preocupaciones que tiene es dejar solo a su hijo con su mama, mientras que sale a trabajar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener cuartos de alquiler para tener mas dinero para darle una mejor vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil.  She sells Yambal products.  Yambal is a company which provides female entrepreneurs with the opportunity to make their own independent sales.

To help with her family's expenses she began selling Yambal products.  She works with her cousin's code as she is the official seller.  When she had enough capital she bought products to have in stock.  Currently, she offers products to her neighbors and friends from very early in the morning.  She sells perfume for $20.00 to $75.00.  One of her worries is having to leave her son alone with her mother while she goes out to work.

With her loan she would like to buy Yambal Products such as perfume, creams and deodorants. In the future she would like to be able to finish building her house and have rental rooms in order to have more money to provide a better life for her three children.

loans.use: Perfume, creams

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as an experienced constructor from the past 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his family needs. His wife plays a major role in helping him with the household. Today, he is requesting a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. for a new big project he is planning to lead. He wants to be prepared for this new project and accomplish it successfully, and to build a good business reputation with the new construction entrepreneur he is working with in order to take more projects in the future.

loans.use: For a new big project being planned

loans.name: Kazinga Development Group-Kihihi

texts.en: B. Benon, 41, belongs to the Kazinga Development group-Kihihi. He is married with three kids and for six years he has been running a food-selling business in the Kihihi Market. Primarily he has sold rice and coffee. To start up in this business, he relied on his savings given the fact that he is a secondary school teacher. Benon says that hard work and the good chord he has struck with his clients have gotten him where he is today. He still teaches and earns a salary. His business earns a profit of 70,000 shillings weekly. With this loan he says he is going to procure more bags of the aforementioned food to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more of more bags of rice and coffee for resell

loans.name: Junks Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Junks Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Sallay K. is the leader of this group. Sallay is 40 years old and married with five children – two in primary school and two in secondary school. Sallay sells clothes, belts, socks, etc. With the help of this loan, Sallay will invest in her business by buying clothes, belts and socks in large quantity to add to her current ones. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Wallie Mansaray handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy clothes, belts and socks to resell

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
After the collapse of the Soviet Union, fifteen small republics, including Kyrgyzstan, were left to survive on their own and struggle with economic instability.
