Collective farms, which worked only for the government, stopped functioning. The process of “privatization” started. Families were given land according to the number of people in a family. Private businesses of cattle breeding and farming took place in the end of 20th century. Rosa I.’s family also became land owners and their own story began. 


Rosa I. is the treasurer of this group.  Rosa and her colleagues formed a group when applying for this group loan. Rosa’s group members are not only close friends, but each of them is also a professional in farming. All of them are residents of a small town called Kochkor in northern Kyrgyzstan.  Fifty-two-year-old Rosa is the most experienced of the group.  She has been involved in farming for at least fifteen years. 

Rosa is a proud mother of six sons and two daughters.  Her youngest son, a junior in college, is the only one still dependent on Rosa. Rosa and her husband, who is also a farmer, received land in 1995 and started cultivating it. This occupation brought enough revenue to purchase cattle and additional land in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan.  Now the family is hoping to get this loan to purchase more cattle, and spend the proceeds on a gift for Rosa’s husband:  a long-waited automobile. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en: Mariza belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros. She is 24 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. She is requesting the loan to invest in a restaurant. She is planning on opening a Cevichería in Cachimayo within the next couple of months and needs the loan to pay the deposit to rent a small space, to buy kitchen supplies and tables. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in restaurant

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the last two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she operates a fresh water selling business which contributes to her source of income. Zawadi faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to expand her business and sells as wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Leonard Wafukho

texts.en:
Leonard Wafukho W. is a single man of twenty four years old and a father to two children who are twins.  He lives in Kitale town with three other people who are his relatives and he provides for their basic needs. He operates a retail shop in the same area, and he has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Leonard's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to buy five bags of sugar worth 15,000 and two bags of rice worth 5,000. 

With the income he is going to get he plans to buy more stock and add his daily sales.  In future he wants to become a wholesaler and educate his two children.

loans.use: To add stock e.g., buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Zenaida is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling banana products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Zenaida joined Kiva's partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell at her store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from it to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell at her store

loans.name: Nhik

texts.en:
Nhik V. has been in the farming business for years in Kompong Tom province. She plants various crops to earn a living and usually generates an income of $1.20 each day. Her husband died of senility years ago. Nhik V. is blessed with four children, two of whom are married while the other two are single. Two of her employed children are sewing worker in the garment industry. 

Presently, her children wish to buy a small kiosk in order to start a sewing service business.  This is the reason Nhik V. has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy kiosk for sewing business

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es: Crispin, de 49 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Felicia de 53 años y su querida hija Liz de 28 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Crispin, es la siembra de papa, arveja, lechuga, espinaca y choclo, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado, puesto que no quiere que los químicos le causen una enfermedad. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprarse un auto, con el cual él mismo pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insecticidas, ya que tiene que fumigar sus siembras.
texts.en:
Crispin is 49 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 53 year-old Felicia, and his beloved daughter, 28 year-old Liz, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Crispin's business is growing potatoes, peas, lettuce, spinach and corn.  After harvesting his crops, he sells them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where he has several customers who are aware of the quality of his produce and so do not hesitate to wait and buy all his produce wholesale.  What Crispin most likes about his work is sowing his land and making it fertile and productive.  He has been in this business for 22 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his fields as he has to do it very carefully since he doesn't want the chemicals to make him sick.  In the future, he hopes to continue selling his produce but, in order to improve his profits, he would also like to buy a car so that he can use it to transport his crops himself.

This is Crispin's first loan with MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments punctually if he would like to access another loan in the future.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy insecticides since he has to spray his crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticides to protect his crops from insect infestations

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children.  He has owned a flower nursery since 2000. He cultivates different kinds of flowers at various seasons and offers special flowers arrangements for all occasions and events.  He is the main income source of his family.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools, extra seeds, and herbs needed for his work. In the future, he intends to grow his business and build a garden where people can make visits and enjoy the beauty of nature.

loans.use: to purchase new tools, extra seeds, and herbs.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida comes from Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s 3rd largest city and famous for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her husband and children in the area of Medina Town for the past 35 years. 

She married Y. M. who is a daily wage laborer. His income is not enough for the whole family and that’s why Zubaida does sewing work for her neighborhood clients to help her husband financially. She is known as an expert in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 

She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She is the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters. Her two elder daughters left their education after the 8th class and started working. Both of them work in a factory on a monthly wage. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her sewing business. Using the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete her work in a shorter period of time and earn better profits by producing quality work. She is hopeful that taking a loan from Asasah and investing in her business will be a good step towards a brighter future of her family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application with Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zubaida.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty currently sells bread. She is 21 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom go to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Nelgui

texts.es:
Nelgui  es padre de familia de 44 años de edad,  vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande a 40 minutos de distancia del departamento de Piura. Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Nelgui se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con  pastos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de de la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado Nelgui es de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, será destinado  para la compra de alimentos balanceados ya que por falta de lluvias en esta zona se ha escaseado el pasto y es necesario comprar otros alimentos complementarios para que sigan engordando y desarrollándose normalmente para poder venderlos a un buen precio en los mercados y así poder pagar su préstamo y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Nelgui es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y brindarles otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelgui, 44, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  The house has running water and electricity and is located in the district of Tambogrande, 40 minutes away from the department of Piura.  In this area the main activities are agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

Nelgui raises and sells sheep.  His farmyard is behind his house.  He gives them natural fodder, and once they are ready for market sells them in the cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  This has provided him with income to cover his household expenses.

The loan in the amount of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternative will be used as seed capital to buy balanced animal feed since there is a scarcity of fodder due to the lack of rain in the area.  He needs to buy complementary feed for the livestock's normal development so he can get a good price at market.  This will enable him to pay back the loan and give his family a better lifestyle.

Nelgui is a very hard worker and intent on getting ahead to lead a better life and provide more opportunities to his children.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Diappo Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diappo Liggey est créé le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme principales activités l'embouche et le petit commerce.



Madame Aminata la responsable est âgée de 26 ans; elle est mariée mère de trois enfants.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite en boubou mauve couverte d'un châle blanc.



 Elle mène une activité de petit commerce diverse marchandises tissus, chaussures, produits alimentaires etc.....Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de dix ans.Elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine.



Son prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises et des moutons pour renforcer sa capacité de vente.


Son souhait c'est de beaucoup travailler pour obtenir une autonomie financière. Elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Diappo Liggey solidarity group was set up on 12th May 2010. It is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood and who are mainly active in animal fattening and small trading businesses.

Aminata, who is in charge of the group, is 26 years old; she is married and mother to three children. She is standing on the right of the photo wearing a mauve "boubou" (a West African flowing dress), covered by a white shawl.

She has a small trading activity selling various goods such as fabric, shoes and food products etc. She has more than ten years' experience. She also has a sheep fattening activity.

Her loan will enable her to buy goods and sheep in order to strengthen her sales capacity.

She wants to work a lot in order to become financially independent. She helps her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and sheep

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, 35, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Catalina has a food stall business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more chickens and other ingredients for her food production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Christian Patricio

texts.es:
Christian Patricio tiene 25 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Christian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Christian Patricio is 25 years old and is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

This communal bank is called VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe and is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the canton of Ventanas. The communal bank has 20 members all of whom work in short cycle agriculture planting corn and rice.

Christian works in short cycle agriculture growing corn and rice. He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and sells his produce in the market of the same town.

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure. The support from this loan will help economically supplement his needs. His dream is to continue working. He also likes sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anara

texts.en:
Anara is 40, married and has three children. She works as an accountant for the local administration and also cultivates her land. Her family has been farming for the past 15 years, starting with initial capital of 7,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS). They work hard on 1.67 hectares of irrigated land growing beans and potatoes. 

Now Anara is applying for a loan of 25,000 KGS to buy manure to fertilize the land. With the revenue, she plans to broaden her business by getting involved in cattle breeding. 

======================================

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (one orphan of her late sister). Olivia lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees for the orphan and food for the family.
Olivia has a business selling second-hand clothes (bras). She has been in this business for ten years, and works six days a week. Olivia sells her products door to door, by means of retail. Olivia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes (bras). The main business challenges for Olivia include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her movements. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to find permanent business premises and also to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes (bras).

loans.name: Grace Aracelly

texts.en:
Grace is 19 years old and married. Grace is slightly estranged from her parents because they objected to her marriage. But she married for love and now lives with her husband Luis, a locksmith who is 18 years old.

Grace lives and works in Latacunga, a plateau town in Ecuador, capital of the Cotopaxi Province. Latacunga is known for its chilly weather and the presence of nearby Volcano Cotopaxi, an active volcano that has repeatedly damaged the city during eruptions.

This will be Maria's first Kiva loan. She will use her loan to buy more pigs and feed. She works several hours a day, helped by Luis. She hopes this loan will help boost their income and improve the quality of their future life together.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Koemeng

texts.en:
Koemeng, 41 years old, and her husband, Veasna, 37 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have three children - one son and two daughters. Two of the children are garment workers and one is in school.  

Koemeng is a garment worker and her husband is a motor taxi driver. Koemeng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house and to do some house repairs.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and make house repairs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 61 years old and is a married woman with eight children. Her younger children still go to school.

Marina is engaged in raising hogs and rice farming. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. She focuses on raising pigs and helps work at the farm when she can.

Marina requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds. Marina wishes to have a good business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is 51-years-old and married with 4 children.

Hermosilia is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Hermosilia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

Hermosilia has been raising cattle for 10 years now and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Hermosilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; la socia tiene 64 años de edad. La socia es casada y tiene 8 hijos los cuales son ya todos ellos independientes, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo frutas, la socia va los días jueves al terminal de frutas ella compra al por mayor y luego lleva  a su casa, la socia vende en el mercado la fruta en forma unitaria o por kilos, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de frutas del terminal. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCO” Communal Bank, located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.
This is Mrs. Rosa; she is 64. She is married and has eight children who are all independent. She works in retail, buying and selling fruit. On Thursdays she goes to the fruit market and buys fruit wholesale. She then brings it home. She sells the fruit in the market individually or by the kilo, and wants to invest this loan in the purchase of fruits from the market. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fruits.
She thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fruits.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en: 46-year-old Emilda is a married woman with two children, ages 20 and 26. She is a seaweed farmer and has been engaged in this kind of business for 15 years. Emilda earns about 6,000 PHP per month from this business. She plans to use her loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs, and other materials. Emilda hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs, and other materials
